loans.name: Appoline

texts.en:
Appoline is 38 years old and married with five children. Appoline's husband is a teacher. Appoline has a business selling various items such as juice, water, sugar, rice and so on. Her business is well-organized and she is open from 8 am until 8 pm every day. 

Appoline has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by adding foodstuffs such as rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, etc. With these additional goods for sale, Appoline hopes that her profits will increase and allow her to continue taking care of her family and keep reinvesting for better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more goods like cooking oil, juice, water, etc.

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en: Harutyun G. lives with his wife and son in Karakert village. Together with his son, Harutyun looks after the family’s cattle and cultivates the land. With his previous loan from SEF in 2007, he purchased cattle. Unfortunately, due to a cattle disease, a great number of the cattle died and Harutyun’s economy suffered a lot. With the current loan, Harutyun is planning to purchase cattle feed and seeds to cultivate his farm.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed and seeds for the farm

loans.name: Demberel

texts.en:
Demberel, 56, is married and lives with his wife and two sons in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. They live in a ger, the Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in someone's back yard. His wife is a guard at a private company, while his two sons are employed as assistant construction workers. 

Demberel manages a grocery trading booth near to his home. He started his business in 2008. Since then he has been able to stabilize his business and he attributes his business success to the good location of his booth. Now his monthly sales have reached to about $420. He sells a variety of grocery items, including vegetables, flour, candies and drinks. He is an open-minded and polite man who says, "One needs to work hard instead of doing nothing all day." 

He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more grocery items in order to increase his sales.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items

loans.name: Serikbai

texts.en:
Serikbai S. is a 40-year-old widow who lives with her five children in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. Her older two children, age 17 and 19, are students, while younger three, age 6, 10 and 16, are pupils. 

In 1994 she started a meat-trading business that she managed with the help of her husband, and since then, she has gained much experience. Unfortunately, she has had to manage her business alone since her husband's death in 2008. 

Now her working capital exceeds 500,000 MNT and she earns 20,000 - 25,000 MNT of profit daily. 

She is a hardworking lady who pays all her children's education cost. She says, "All I want is to provide necessary education cost for my children in order for them to be well educated citizens." 

She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to buy more meat at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To buy more meat at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Mahabat's Group

texts.en:
Mahabat S. is the treasurer of this group. She is 37 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom attend school.  Her husband is a taxi driver.  In order to earn money to meet the family's needs, Mahabat together with her husband’s help breeds livestock. She is requesting a loan to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future, Mahabat wishes to purchase a new vehicle for the family. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans has a mixed farm that produces maize, bananas, napier grass and milk. He has been in the farming business for ten years and employs one farmhand. Evans earns additional income from his shoe business in Nyamira, western Kenya. His biggest challenge in farming has been diseases which affect his production.

Evans has requested this loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help improve his family's livelihood. He would like to expand his farm in the future by acquiring at least 3 acres of land and buying 5 high breed dairy cows. 

Evans is 33 years old and married, with a 4-year-old child who attends school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Laureta

texts.en:
Laureta is 51 years old and is married with 5 children.

Laureta works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Laureta has borrowed and paid back 7 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the sari-sari store for 2 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Laureta aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a married man with three children, two boys and one girl. Two of his children attend school while one is still too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing.

For the past eleven years, he has operated a cosmetic shop, selling retail to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation and competition from other cosmetic shop operators in his area of operation. He dreams of purchasing a motorcycle for transport business in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase cosmetics for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his living standard.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 22 years old and single. He has been running his butchery business for six months. His monthly income is KES 6,000, which he uses in his business.

He has been loaned KES 10,000 by KADET Ltd. This is his first loan from KADET. He intends to use his loan to purchase more meat for sale in his butchery.

He plans to use the profit from his business to expand and also to add more stock. In the future, he hopes to open up another butchery.

loans.use: To purchase more meat for sale in his butchery.

loans.name: Jesutogbe 1 Group

texts.fr: JESUTOGBE 1 est un groupe de huit personnes, dont les membres résident dans la même agglomération au Bénin et mènent des activités complémentaires. La représentante du groupe, Philomène(dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un tailleur du nom de Antonin. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Philomène et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Philomène n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Il y a près de vingt cinq ans que Philomène mène comme activité la vente de produits divers et des cartes de recharges téléphoniques à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Philomène vend de l'eau glacée à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de subvenir sans grande difficulté à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Philomène s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Philomène sollicite un crédit avec les autres membres du groupe JESUTOGBE 1. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: The Jesutogbe 1 group comprises eight people who all live in the same town in Benin and run complementary businesses. The group leader, Philomène (with the raised hand in the photo), is 41 years old and married to a tailor named Antonin. The couple have four children, all of whom are in their care and attend school. Philomène and her husband live together with their children. Philomène only attended primary school. For close to 25 years, she has run a business selling various items and rechargeable phone cards at her home. In addition, she also sells ice water at her home; this allows her to provide for herself and her children without too much difficulty. Philomène gets her supplies in Benin. With the goal of satisfying her clientele, she is seeking a loan along with the other members of the Jesutogbe 1 group. This loan will allow them to better respond to the needs of their clientele and generate greater profits.

loans.use: To buy various items and rechargeable phone cards.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas de 51 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicado en el distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Tomas se dedica desde hace 10 años a la crianza y comercialización de ganado porcino (cerdos), su corral los tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento ideal lo puedan ofrecer a sus clientes y con los ingresos que obtenga puede solventar los gastos diarios de su casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar de otras especies de animales para seguir comercializandolos a sus clientes , con la finalidad de que obtenga  mejores ganancias y así pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Tomas es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia salga adelante.
texts.en:
Tomas, 51, lives with his wife and children in his own home.  The only utility they have in the home is electricity; their home is located in the Morrope district of the department of Lambayeque.  This is an area known for its livestock, agricultural and handicraft production.  

Tomas has been raising and selling pigs for 10 years.  His corral is located at the back of his house.  He feeds them with nutritionally balanced feed, and once they grow to an ideal size he offers them for sale to his customers.  With the income he derives from this activity he is able to cover the daily household expenses.

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy another species of animal to sell to his customers, with the objective of obtaining better earnings and having a better quality of life.  Tomas is a hardworking and responsible person who only wants the best for his family.

loans.use: to buy animals other than pigs to expand his business

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel, de 20 años, es una joven sencilla y trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposo Deodono de de 25 años y su querida hija Lorena de 03 año, a quien desea brindar un mejor futuro. Maribel desde muy niña trabajaba en las tierras de sus padres, con sus ahorros acumulados mas la herencia que heredo de sus padres hoy tiene 02hectareas de terreno y los trabaja con mucho ahínco y ha logrado volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, cacao, café y palillo, productos que luego los lleva a vender hasta los centros de acopio situados en la ciudad de San Francisco, donde las vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, ya que se siente muy feliz haciéndolo, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los tendales por ello contrata jornaleros para que le apoyen en el carguío de sus productos. Con el crédito solicitado comprará más plantas de café para luego injertarlos y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos. Más adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este será su crédito número 02 con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos, Por otro lado se compromete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en sus anteriores créditos. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos los integrantes son personas responsables. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles comprará plantas de café para posteriormente injertarlos y sacar buena ventaja de sus frutos en menor tiempo.
texts.en:
20-year-old Maribel is an unassuming and hard-working young woman who lives in her parents' home together with her husband, 25-year-old Deodono, and her beloved 3-year-old daughter Lorena, who she would like to provide with a better future.

Maribel worked on her parents' land from a very young age.  With some savings that she had and an inheritance from her parents, she acquired two hectares of land which she works diligently and has made very productive.  Maribel grows cacao, coffee and turmeric which she takes to warehouse centers in the town of San Francisco and sells wholesale.  Her crops have provided her with the income she needs to support herself.

What Maribel most enjoys about her work is caring for her crops as she feels very happy doing this.  She has been in the business for 10 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her produce from the farm to the drying areas.  She employs laborers to support her in transporting her crops.

Maribel will use the loan she has requested to buy more coffee plants which she will then graft and benefit from their fruit.  In the future, she would like to buy more land so that she can increase her crops.  This will be her second loan from MFP and she hopes to receive a small loan so that she can achieve her goals.  For her part, she pledges once more to make her repayments on time as she did with her previous loan.

Maribel enjoys being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible people.  She will use the 1,000 soles she has requested to buy coffee plants to graft and benefit from their fruit in less time.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants

loans.name: Ndane Ndeb

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée qui tient une petite boutique au bord de la route goudronnée qui traverse son village.Elle a 7 enfants qui fréquentent tous l'école.Pour mieux améliorer les conditions de vie de  sa famille, elle cultive durant l'hivernage un champs de mil et un champs d'arachide.Elle est membre de l'UIMCEC et sollicite un pret de 250000F pour augmenter son fonds de commerce.Elle compte acheter 10 sacs de riz, 100 litres d'huile et des produits divers.Elle ambitionne d'élargir son magasin et de construire plus tard sa propre maison.
texts.en: The borrower is a married woman with a little shop on the side of the sealed road which runs through her village. She has 7 children and they all attend school. To further improve the living conditions of her family she cultivates millet and peanuts during the winter months. She is a member of the UIMCEC and requests a loan of 250000F in order to increase her business capital. She intends to buy 10 bags of rice, 100 litres of oil and various other products. Her goal is to expand her shop and to eventually construct her own house.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of rice, 100 litres of oil and other products.

loans.name: Giecela

texts.es: Giecela tiene 39 años, esta felizmente casa y vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Tiene 7 años de experiencia en la venta de comida típica, llamado chicharrón, negocio del cual atiende todos los días, excepto los fines de semana. En tiempos que tiene mayor demanda es cuando es época festivas, es durante los meses de agosto y setiembre principalmente. Su esposo siempre esta a su lado para apoyarla en este trabajo,  actualmente sus puesto vienen cantidad de gente a consumir sus platillos. Ya son mas de tres oportunidades que viene solicitando créditos y trabajando de la mano con MFP, considera que esta institución es una de sus mejores aliadas cuando se trata de concretar un proyecto de negocio de las cuales esta muy agradecida  por l que continuara siendo  puntual con sus pagos. El dinero que está solicitando, será destinada para la compra de un stand salchipapero con el que podrá prepara mayor variedad de platillos al paso.
texts.en: Giecela is 39 years old.  She is happily married and lives with her husband and their 2 children in a home they own.  She has been selling a typical local food called chicharrón (fried pork skin) for 7 years. She runs the business every day except weekends. She experiences higher demand during the festival season, mainly in the months of August and September.  Her husband is always at her side to help her with this work.  Many people already come to her stand to eat her dishes.  She has already requested 3 loans and works hand in hand with MFP, which she considers one of her best allies when she is trying to finalize a business project.  She is very thankful and will continue to make her payments on time.  The loan she is requesting is to purchase a stand to make hotdogs and French fries, which she will use to prepare a greater variety of dishes.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile cart that she can use to sell hot dogs and french fries.

loans.name: Senovia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMANECER ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Senovia; ella tiene 46 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura y también tiene una molinera de granos, ella tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra maíz, papa y haba, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de agricultura y mejorar el negocio de molinera. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas y también granos secos al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Senovia belongs to the “Amanecer Anteña” communal bank, located in the District and Province of Anta within the Department of Cusco. She’s 46 years old with a live-in partner and 4 children. She alternates her daily chores between running an agricultural business and a grain miller. She has a plot for faming where she sows corn, potatoes, and beans. Through these businesses, Senovia has been able to provide her children with a better quality of life. 

Senovia wants to expand her agricultural business and improve the miller business as well. She has requested the loan to buy seeds and dry grains in bulk. She is happy about the loan and promises to fulfill her payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and dry grains in bulk.

loans.name: Nory Edith

texts.es: Nory compró hilazas y elaboró hamacas y bolsos que vendió entre sus clientes, también invirtió sus utilidades en otro negocio que es la venta de queso y productos agropecuarios en su propia casa. En la actualidad está aplicando a su nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará una parte en materiaa primas e insumos de artesanías para elaborar hamacas y bolsos; otra la invertirá en queso pues ha logrado unas buenas utilidades y rápida rotación de su capital con este negocio y esto la hace muy felíz. Su mensaje a los financiadores es el siguiente: "Han sido muy colaboradores porque logro intereses  bajos, trabajo con una mayor comodidad y estoy agradecida y seguiré pagando sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en: Nory bought yarn and produced hammocks and bags that she sold to her customers. She also invested her profits in another business that sells cheese and agricultural and livestock products from her own home. Currently she is applying for her new Kiva loan, part of which she will use to buy raw materials and handicraft supplies to produce hammocks and bags; the other part she will invest in her cheese business as she has obtained good profits and a fast turnaround of her capital which makes her very happy. Her message to the financial supporters is the following: "You have been very collaborative because I attain low interest rates, I work with greater comfort and I'm thankful and I will continue making my payments."

loans.use: to purchase materials to make hammocks and invest in her cheese business

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema  lives in Uganda. She is single and has seven children, six of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her mother).    

Rehema has a restaurant. She has been in this business for eight years, and she works seven days out of every week. Rehema sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

Rehema has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, cassava and rice.    

The main business challenges for Rehema include the ever increasing prices of food stuffs, and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start growing some of the foodstuffs and to own a fully stocked restaurant.  

Rehema lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, beef, cassava and rice.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 38 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past five years, Miriam has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells children's clothes. 

To help expand her business, Miriam has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Miriam to generate greater profits and increase her standard of living. Miriam hopes that in the future she will be able to start up another boutique. 

Miriam is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Miriam who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie is a married woman with two children aged 13 and 7. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store business and sells seaweed for a living. Leslie sells items like spices, vinegar and canned goods to the people in her community. Leslie earns about 10,000 PHP per month from her business.

Leslie has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as vinegar, oil and seaweed. She hopes to have a stable income that will help her sustain her children's education and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as vinegar, oil and seaweed

loans.name: Zulay

texts.es:
Zulay tiene 55 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Zulay se dedica a la venta de calzado de dama desde hace tres años. Ella vio la oportunidad de iniciar este negocio puesto que ella vio que en su comunidad no habia ninguna tienda de zapatos, y las mujeres debian viajar a otro pueblo para hacer sus compras. Ella vende el calzado en su casa, y tambien aprovecha las actividades de la iglesia a las que atiende todos los dias para ofrecer sus productos.

Zulay ha solicitao un prestamo a Fundacion Mujer para la compra de zapatos de dama y tambien para acondicionar su casa para la exhibicion de los zapatos y el mantenimiento de los mismos. Con la ayuda del prestamo ella podra tener una gama de diseños mas amplia, y asi incrementar sus ventas.

Zulay quiere establecer una tienda de zapatos formal en un local, donde sus clientas puedan venir a comprar y ella siempre pueda tener inventario. Ella quiere realizarce como empresaria, una faseta mas de su vida.  Ella espera que su negocio sea mas rentable y asi poder proporcionar una mejor educacion para sus nietos.
texts.en:
Zulay is 55 years old, married, and has three children.  She has been selling ladies' footwear for three years.  She saw the opportunity to start this business as she realized that there were no shoe stores in her community and women had to travel to another village to make their purchases.  Zulay sells her footwear from home.  She also makes the most of the church activities she attends every day and offers her products there. 

Zulay has requested a loan from Fundación Mujer to buy ladies' shoes.  She will also fit out her home so that she has somewhere to display and keep her shoes.  With the help of this loan, she will be able to have a wider range of designs and thereby increase her sales.

Zulay would like to set up a formal shoe store in some premises where here customers can come and buy and she can always have stock available.  She would like to fulfill herself as a businesswoman and take one more step forward in her life.  She hopes that her business will be more profitable so that she can provide her grandchildren with a better education.

loans.use: to buy women's shoes to sell

loans.name: Marziya

texts.ru: Марзие 49 лет. Она работает учителем кыргызского языка и литературы в школе города Исфана. В связи с тем, что заработная плата учителей низкая,   в 2010 году, в поисках дополнительного источника дохода, Марзия начала заниматься торговлей детской и подростковой одеждой на местном рынке. Она арендовала контейнер (торговое место) и открывает его каждый день во второй половине дня, совмещая бизнес с основной работой. Хороший ассортимент товара Марзии, приветливое обслуживание, практичные советы при подборе одежды привлекают  все больше и больше клиентов. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Марзия обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента товаров за счет закупа одежды зимнего периода.   Доходы от кредита Марзия планирует направить на дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Marziya is 49 years old.  She works as a Kyrgyz language and literature teacher at a school in the town of Isfana.  Due to the fact teachers' salaries are low and to find an additional source of income, she decided to start her own business of selling children's and teenage clothing at a local market in 2010.  She leased a container (retail space) and opens it every day during the second half of the day, thus, combining her business with her primary job.  Marziya's good selection of merchandise, friendly service and practical advice with clothing choice attract more and more customers.  In order to further grow her business, Marziya requested a loan in the sum of 70,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to expand merchandise assortment by purchasing winter seasonal merchandise.  She plans to direct the profits from this loan to continued business expansion.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Akuach

texts.en:
Akuach is a 32-year-old married woman with three children. All of her children are in school. She has had a business selling milk in Langber Bor, South Sudan for 2 years.

Akuach is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and milk. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and milk for sale.

loans.name: Sofiatou

texts.fr: Sofiatou est âgée de 34 ans et est mariée à un certain Théodore. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants à leur charge. Sofiatou et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Sofiatou  n’a pas fréquenté l’école, mais a appris la coiffure, une activité qu’elle exerce passionnément depuis une dizaine d’année et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. Parallèlement à cette activité et pour mieux assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Sofiatou  vend dans son atelier, des tissus et des produits cosmétiques. Sofiatou  s’approvisionne au Nigéria et au Togo. Ce premier crédit permettra certainement à Sofiatou  de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Sofiatou is 34 years old and she is married to a man named Théodore. The couple have three dependent children who all attend school. In addition to their own, they also have two other children in their care. Sofiatou and her husband handle together the various household responsibilities. 

Sofiatou did not go to school, but she did learn the trade of hairstyling, an activity she has been practicing passionately for about ten years, and which allows her to earn significant income. To better provide for her children, Sofiatou also sells fabrics and cosmetics from her shop as a secondary activity. 

Sofiatou gets her stock in Nigeria and Togo. This first loan will help her to bolster her activity and better meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, cosmetics, and fabrics.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael, age 41, lives with his wife Irene in the village of Chabinaani in East Georgia. Michael works as a tin-smith and operates his own workshop. He fills orders from customers in his own village and from those nearby. Irene works as a teacher in the village. The average monthly income of the family is 635 Laris. 

Michael has requested credit for purchasing additional spare parts for his tin-smith plant. After adding the new parts, he is confident that the plant will be able to perform more operations. It will allow Michael to diversify the services he provides to customers. Accordingly, the family income will increase. 

Michael plans to reinvest part of the increased income into further development of his workshop. He wants eventually to purchase an additional plant. He will also apply some of his profits toward improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his tin-smith workshop

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 45 years old and married to Dominic. They have three children. For the past three years, Elizabeth has been operating a retail shop and she earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. 

Elizabeth is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy stocks of tea leaves, bread, cooking oil, maize flour, and books. This will be her first loan with KADET Ltd. Elizabeth will use her anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to own a wholesale store.

loans.use: to buy tea leaves, bread, cooking oil, maize flour, and books

loans.name: Yoerm's Group

texts.en:
Yoerm, 51, is married and lives with her family in a village of the Bovel district. She has four children. To make a living, she has been planting cassava for 7 years and her husband works for others for a fee to earn additional income for the family. The current business earns her family about 80,000KHR per day. 
Yoerm has been with VisionFund for five cycles and now she is leading group to seek for a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to increase her family’s income from her current business so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Khazratkul

texts.ru: 59 летный Хазраткул из города Сарбанд. Он трудолюбивый и честный дехканин. У Хазраткул есть хороший опыт. Он 20 лет занимается животноводством. Хазраткул научился у своего отца. Благодаря нему он сейчас имеет работу т постоянный доход. Хазраткул тоже учить своих детей этому ремесло. Он покупает молодых телят, откармливает их несколько месяцев, потом перепродает их на скотном рынке. Ему в работе помогает дети. У Хазраткул трое детей. Его жена занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Хазраткул обратился за кредитом. За счет кредита хочет приобрести несколько молодых телят.

loans.use: Для купли несколько молодых телят.

loans.name: Reinalda

texts.en:
Reinalda has worked in the beauty industry for over 23 years. She started off by working as an assistant in a friend’s beauty salon during the day and attending class at night to finish attaining her high school degree. After learning how to cut hair and give manicures, she began offering her services to her friends and family at their homes. Soon after getting married, her and her husband decided it was best for Reinalda to start her own business out of their home. This business has allowed her to provide a good source of income for her family while also being able to care for her 4 children.

Reinalda is seeking the loan in order to invest in the physical appearance of her beauty salon. As it is, her business and her home are very difficult distinguish. She wants to invest in new furniture and tools in order to make her salon look much more professional.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Reinalda is seeking the loan in order to invest in the physical appearance of her beauty salon.

loans.name: Be

texts.en:
Be is 35, her husband, Nhan, is 39. Be lives with 2 children, aged 3 and 10. The elder is at primary school. Be also looks after her parents-in-law, who are in their seventies.

Be has a small grocery store at her home and her husband is a farmer: he takes care of the vegetable garden which is 2500 square meters. Both the grocery store and the garden are their main income, which comes to only $5 person/month. It is thus difficult for them to pay for food and the parents' medicine, plus the child's school fees.

They hope to receive a loan of $75 from Kiva so that they can increase the kind of goods for the shop and purchase some fertilizer and seeds for the garden. They will repay monthly.

loans.use: To increase the kind of goods for the grocery store and purchase some fertilizer, seeds for the garden

loans.name: Chi

texts.en: Chi was born in 1974 and her husband was born in 1965. They have 3 daughters and a son between 10 and 20 years of age. Only the son attend school.They have 0.5 hectares of land for rice. Because of poor soil and spreading insects, their crop is only enough for them to eat. Their income is $12 per person/month. Now Chi operates a small tea shop at home to improve their income. She hopes to receive a loan of $75 to supply for her tea shop. Chi will repay monthly.

loans.use: Supplying for the tea shop.

loans.name: Nut

texts.en: Mrs Nut R. is 63 and lives alone in Phnom Penh in Cambodia. She is a farmer and she also sells blankets. She would like to purchase additional blankets to increase the inventory and her store. She hopes this will increase sales and revenue for her business.

loans.use: To purchase blankets for her home products business

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Mrs. Roseline O. sells drinks in the semi-urban area of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She learned the trade for six months after which she started her business in 1996. According to her, if the loan amount of $325 is given to her, she will be able to expand her business (i.e. buy more drinks).  She is 40 years old and married with five children.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks for sale

loans.name: Sleiman

texts.en: Sleiman is a 28 year old man who lives in south Lebanon in the region of Nabatieh. Sleiman has a restaurant in which he offers chicken, fench fries and other meals. Sleiman is a very ambitious and productive young man who is striving to provide for his family; his wife and his two children. This is the 5th time that Sleiman is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua to grow his business. Sleiman needs to generate enough revenue to be able to buy a car for his family. He wants to take his family for a drive and with all the hard work and efforts he is investing in his restaurant this would be a nice reward.

loans.use: To grow his business and buy a car

loans.name: Ramez

texts.en: Ramez is 32 years old and lives with his family in the Bekaa region of Lebanon. Ramez rears and breeds animals and needs a loan to increase his animal livestock. Ramez loves his work and enjoys working in a natural environment. He is his household's sole provider and is known to be an independent and reliable person.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is 45 years old and the mother of four children. She lives with her family in the region of Lebanon known as Borj Barajneh. Fatima makes pottery for a living, and needs a loan to buy raw materials and supplies for her business. This is her four loan from A. Majmoua, and we are proud of how well she and her company are doing.

loans.use: To buy material for a pottery-making business

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 38 years old. He has three children. Two of them are studying in high school and the other one is in university. His elderly mother became his responsibility after his father's death. He has a small shop of glass sales. He applied to borrow $1200 to purchase new and different shapes of glass to sell and expand his project. He also wants to make some advertising to increase his income and save for a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new and different shapes of glass

loans.name: Dodo

texts.en:
S. Dodo is 48 years old. He is married with four children. Dodo is a doctor and working in the Central Regional Hospital. Considering that he has a large family the salary of a doctor is not sufficient to fully support his family. Dodo decided to find an additional source of income. Thus Dodo grows onions. This business is stable and generates a significant income for the family.

Dodo is requesting $600 for the term of 12 months. The loan will be used to purchase seeds required for growing onions. Dodo has been given a loan once before and he managed the loan with accuracy. He promises to repay the current loan promptly and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for growing onions.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en: Saumu is 27 years old and is a single woman. Saumu owns a small shop that she started in 2004. Every day, she works from 7am to 9pm at her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more  items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Ungwana Elgon Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Jane S. is an average Kenyan woman. She is 43 years old, and married with four children. She also lives with the two orphaned children of her late sister, who perished two years ago.

Jane started her second-hand clothes business two years ago after accumulating savings from her previous job in Eldoret town. She sells ladies’ wear but would like to diversify by adding men’s and children’s clothing as well. Every week, Jane purchases four bales of clothing from a local clothes wholesale market and then sells them to her regular customers. With the little profit that she gets from her business, she is still able to feed, clothe, and educate her children. With the help of her loan, Jane will be able to purchase many bales of clothes and increase her monthly sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Jane would increase her stock of used clothing with her portion of this group loan.

loans.name: Fuente De Esperanza (Source Of Hope) Bank Group

texts.en:
Elisabet is the mother of four children, the last of whom was born only a few days ago. She has two businesses - one selling chicken and the other selling clothing. Esperanza International has given Elisabet two loans already, both of which she has successfully paid back. With her third loan, Elisabet hopes to continue growing her businesses so that she can better provide for her family. One day, she dreams of having her very own house and providing her children with the best education.

This loan will also fund the business efforts of the other women in the group.

Please note: The man in the photo is Elisabet´s husband. He appears on her behalf because she is still at home resting with her new born baby.

Note: This is a group loan. Each woman in the group helps to support and guarantee the loan.

loans.use: To grow her two businesses and support her four children

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro is 37 years old and is very dedicated to his work as a farmer. He cultivates coffee, and now has a large quantity of plants in his nursery to plant later in the land. He hopes that his work with help him accomplish his dream that he so anxiously awaits, like getting married and starting a family. For this, he wants to increase production of plants, and save money in order to offer his future family a home with all the basic needs and comforts, so that his future children can grow in a harmonious environment filled with love. To accomplish these goals, he wants to purchase new coffee plants and requires your help to do it. Pedro needs $300 to buy the plants with the fertilizer they need. We hope that you can help Pedro to achieve his goals in the economic and personal sphere.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Pedro de 37 años es un hombre muy dedicado a su labor dentro de la agricultura, él cultiva café, ahora tiene una gran cantidad de plantas en su vivero para luego sembrarlas en sus terrenos. El desea que su actividad le ayude ha alcanzar los sueños que espera tan ansiosamente, como son; casarse y formar una familia. Por ello, desea incrementar la producción de sus cultivos ahorrar dinero y ofrecer a su futura familia un hogar con todas las necesidades básicas y comodidades para que sus futuros hijos puedan crecer en un ambiente armonioso y lleno de amor. Para ello, desea adquirir nuevas plantaciones de café y requiere de su apoyo para lograrlo, la suma que solicita es de 800 soles, necesarios para la compra de estas plantaciones y para su respectivo abono. Esperamos que usted pueda ayudar a Pedro a lograr concretar sus metas en el ámbito económico y personal.

loans.use: To purchase new coffee plants and their necessary fertilizers.

loans.name: Carmen Amalia

texts.es:
Carmen started this business to pay for her sons' education and to provide for her family. Later, her family began to have financial problems when her husband lost his job. Fortunately, with her business Carmen was able to support her family. Thirteen years ago she began selling groceries out of her house, and little by little invested in her business and expanded her offerings.

Carmen needs a $1,000 loan which she will repay in 6 months to purchase merchandise and promotional banner to hang outside her business, which will make her business more reputable.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Carmen inicio con este negocio debido a que necesitaba dinero para pagar los estudios de sus hijos y para que no les faltara nada en su casa, en aquel entonces su necesidad fue que pasaron por una crisis económica muy difícil por que su esposo no tenia trabajo pero afortunadamente con el negocio logro sacar adelante a su familia. Empezó hace 13 años vendiendo ahí mismo en su casa abarrotes y mercería, comenzó con muy poca mercancía y poco a poco le a ido invirtiendo a su negocio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $1,000 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y mandar hacer unas lonas promocionales para poner a fuera de su negocio y así que su negocio sea mas redituable.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Blanca Esthela

texts.es:
Blanca es casada y tiene 2 hijos: Kelia Mareza de 26 años, Hever Arturo de 23 años, su esposo trabaja en la venta de ropa. Inicio el negocio para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares y del hogar. Empezó hace 5 años vendiendo abarrotes en su casa y poco a poco fue invirtiendo en mercancía hasta lograr establecer su tienda de abarrotes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $350 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu ayuda ella saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Blanca is married and has 2 kids: Kelia Mareza who is 26 and Hever Arturo who is 23. Her husband works selling clothes. She started her business to help her husband with the family's expenses and household costs. Five years ago she started selling bric-a-brac from her house and bit by bit she invested in merchandise until she was able to open a bric-a-brac shop.

She needs a loan of $350 (which she will repay over a period of 4 months) to buy merchandise. With your help she will move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchanside/comprar mercancia

loans.name: Kenja

texts.en:
Kenja T. is 44 years old. She is a widow and the mother of three children. After the death of her husband, Kenja had to find ways to provide for herself and her three children. For three years she has had a business baking and selling the national bread, “lepeshka”. It has now become the family business as the children of Kenja are grown-up and they are helping their mother.

Kenja is a cheerful, hard-working woman despite the difficulties she faces. She has already received and repaid loans from IMON which have helped create stability for her business. Today Kenja is requesting a loan of 2200 Somoni (650 USD) with the term of 12 months. She is planning to purchase flour and coal required for baking the national bread, “lepeshka”. This purchase will enable her to increase her sales, to earn more so she can provide her children with a good education. With your help this will be possible. Be an important part of the growth of Kenja’s business!

loans.use: Purchasing  flour and coal

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili O. has been selling juice and clothes in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She works from 8:00am to 8:00pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $200 each month. She has previously taken out one loan from BRAC Tanzania which she repaid successfully and on time. She is requesting her second loan from so that she can buy more inventory for her shop.

Pili is 32 years old, married, and has one 1-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more juices and clothes to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Zaragoza

texts.en:
Zaragoza is a member of the "Sol Radiante" (Brilliant Sun) Village Bank. Zaragoza is 62 years old and married with eight children. Zaragoza has a store in her house, located in the Mariscal Caceres neighborhood of Ayacucho, where she sells dry goods, fruits, vegetables, and liquor. She works every day with the help of her son.

Zaragoza also has income from renting out her house. Zaragoza needs a loan of 900 soles to buy rice, sugar, and toothpaste. She dreams that her children will overcome the obstacles that face them in life, dreams of improving her business, and of saving for old age.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Zaragoza es socia del Banco Comunal Sol Radiante. Zaragoza es casada, tiene 62 años y 8 hijos, Zaragoza tiene una tienda en su casa ubicado en la Asoc. Mariscal Cáceres, en donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras, frutas, licores, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. su hijo. Además Zaragoza alquila su casa.

Zaragoza necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, crema dental. Zaragoza sueña con que sus hijos se superen, mejorar su negocio y ahorrar para su vejez.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, and toothpaste

loans.name: Mrs. Mom Pring Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank which consists of twelve members is located in Ra village in Kampong Chhnang province and they plan to use the loan which they have obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Mom P. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn her living. Aside from the plantatiO., she is a cassava seller. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to add to her capital to buy more cassava to re-sell. Mrs. Mom P. is a 36-year-old widow with three children who are attending the local school.

This is a group loan consisting partly of end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loan and the rest of have monthly payment loans. The EoT members are not required to pay any principal O. the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments O. time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% O. Kiva.

loans.use: to add her capital to buy more cassava to re-sell

loans.name: Anifatou

texts.fr: Dame A. Anifatou est née le 24 janvier 1975, mariée à ASSANI Soumaila, elle est mère de deux enfants Akim agée de 10 ans en classe de CM1 et de rachidatou agée de 06 ans en classe de CP. Elle a une petite boutique  de vente de poissons, elle s'approvisionne à CAJAF COMON et les revend aux bonnes dames. A coté de sa boutique de vente de poissons elle vend aussi des cassettes CD, pour aider son mari  a supporté les charges familiales qui lui incombent. Pour rendre plus connu son activité , elle a sollicité ce pret pour renforcer son commerce.
texts.en:
Mrs. Anifatou A. was born on January 24th, 1975. She is married to Soumaila Assani and is the mother of two childen. Akim, age 10 is in elementry school and Rachidatou, age 6, is in primary school. Anifatou operates a small shop selling fish. She buys her stock in Cadaf Comon and resells them locally, to women. At one side of her fish shop, she also sells cassettes and CDs. These activities support her family living expenses. To make her business activities more widely known, she is requesting this loan to strengthen her business.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 15 cases of soft drinks, 10 cartons of canned drinks, audio CD's and video DVD's for resale

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella.
Julia es casada, tiene 48 años y 4 hijos, Julia se dedica a la agricultura D. papa, quinua en sus tierras D. Chontaca, sus productos los comercializa en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Además Julia tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa.
Julia necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz y para el pago D. los peones.
Los sueños D. Julia son que sus dos ultimas hijas sean profesionales, tener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Estrella (Star) communal bank. Julia is 48 years old, married and has 4 children. Julia grows potatoes on her land in Chontaca. She sells her products in the markets of the city of Ayacucho. Furthermore, Julia has a grocery shop in her house. Julia needs a loan of 1200 soles that will be invested in the purchase of rice and the payment of her employees. Julia dreams of her two oldest children becoming professionals and that she will have a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and pay her employees

loans.name: Siek

texts.en:
S. is 46 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She is a widow, and she has seven children: the first three are working in a private company, and the other four are students. S. is a local vegetable seller to the villagers in the market. She gets up in the morning to buy vegetables from the field in bulk and hurries, taking them to the market to sell retail at a good price. She is a struggling mother and a responsible neighbor. 

S. recently faces difficulty with transportation. So S. is looking for a loan to buy a motorbike for herself and her family. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living. S. was not available during the photograph so her son is taken instead.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for herself and her family

loans.name: Nemecia

texts.es:
La socia Nemecia; tiene 42 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos (22,14,,8) años de edad, ella vive en Urb. Pueblo libre C-7 en arcopata.

Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades domésticas con el comercio, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes (arroz, harina, leche, aceite, granos, galletas, fideos, entre otros), la sra. Menecia desea implementar su tienda de abarrotes, para lo cual solicita el préstamo.

L a socia está muy agradecida y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su préstamo en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
The member Nemecia is 42 years old. She is married and has three children 22, 14 and 8 years old. She lives in the housing development Pueblo Libre in Arcopata.

Nemecia divides her time between doing house chores and working at her store. She has a grocery store, where she sells rice, flour, beans, pasta, oil and milk among other products. She would like to buy supplies to stock the store and this is the reason to request the loan.

The member Nemecia is very grateful and values the support given to her through the loan. She is committed to repay the total amount within the scheduled time

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.ru: Музаффар Собиров 1973 года рождения, женат имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Опыт работы в торговле 9 лет.  Музаффар сотрудничает  с 2006 года. Он получил кредит для расширения бизнеса. Торгует напитками  в магазине. Также есть холодильник , где держит мороженое. Зимой торговля идет не так хорошо, но сейчас напитки и вскоре будет сезон и покроет те расходы которые он совершил зимой. В начале он продавал мелочами, теперь за счет кредит расширил магазин, за это он благодарен Микроинвест и за поддержку КИВА.
texts.en:
Muzaffar S. was born in 1973. He is married and has three children. He completed secondary school and has nine years of experience in sales. Muzaffar has collaborated with MicroInvest since 2006, when he received a loan to expand his business. He sells alcoholic beverages and soft drinks in a store. There is also a freezer where ice cream is kept. Over the winter sales were not good, but soon it will be the time of year when the sale of beverages will pick up and cover the expenditures he made over the winter. He started out selling small items, but with access to credit was able to expand the store. He is grateful to MicroInvest for the loans and to Kiva for the support.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Since 2000, Mary K. has worked as a petty trader who produces and sells gari (a flour made of cassava roots) at Shama Junction. She is married with four children and received an education through junior high school. Her husband vulcanizes car tires for work. She is responsible for supporting her family with housekeeping money.  Her loan will be used to purchase additional cassava for gari production and she hopes to use the new profits from her business to support her children’s secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase additional cassava for gari production

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia D. C. is from the town of Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 58 years old. Virginia is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a retail business selling variety of cooked snacks like grilled meat. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from her snack vending.
  
Virginia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP (US$150), which will be used as additional working capital. This loan will be taken out by Virginia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Starting a rabbit-raising business

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica, 32, is married and the mother of four children who are currently in school. She operates a shop and sells all kinds of clothing for men and women, like blouses, skirts, slippers, dressing bags, jeans, trousers, etc. She sells in the various communities during their market days. She sometimes sells through hawking and has been trading for the past 13 years. 

It is her desire to provide a quality education for her children to secure them a better future. Monica is constrained by funds in running the business. She needs the loan to inject more working capital into the business to boost her progress. She believes the loan will help her purchase a large quantity of good quality items to upgrade her inventory. She says she would be grateful for that assistance. Mary belongs to a village bank called "Nkunimdie," which means success.

loans.use: To purchase dresses, slippers, dressing bags, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy four calves

loans.name: Santos Osmin

texts.es: Santos Osmin V. E. reside en el municipio Cojutepeque departamento de Cuscatlán. Santos es un hombre casado con 45 años de edad, vive con esposa y tres hijos mayores de edad, de los cuales dos trabajan y uno es estudiante universitario. Santos posee un negocio hace 2 años el cual consiste en la venta de granos básicos en la plaza de Cojutepeque, el deseo de Santos es tener mayor cantidad de sus productos para poderlos vender al por mayor lo que le permitiría generar un mayor ganancia, pero esto solo puede ser posible con su ayuda para financiar este crédito el cual el utilizara  Santos en la compra de mayor cantidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Santos Osmin V. E. lives in the Cojutepeque municipality in the Cuscatlán department. Santos is 45 and married. He lives with his wife and three grown children. Two of the children work and one is a university student. For two years Santos has been selling basic grains in the Cojutepeque plaza. Santos wishes to have a larger quantity of products to sell wholesale. This would allow him to have greater earnings. But, this is only possible with the help of a loan. Santos will use the loan to buy a larger quantity of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a larger quantity of basic grains

loans.name: Bat-Erdene

texts.en:
Bat-Erdene B. is a 26-year-old single lady. She lives with her parents in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Bat-Erdene graduated from a local technical college in 2006 with a degree in electrical engineering. In spite of her degree in engineering, she started a small convenience store business in early 2008. Her convenience store is located in a busy suburban area of the city; therefore, her business does pretty well.

Bat-Erdene mostly purchases her inventory of food products from Ulaanbaatar's various wholesale markets, where she is able to find the best deals in the city. Some of the food products are delivered by the producers. The selling volume usually peaks during national holidays and in the fall when school starts.

As school starts in September, Bat-Erdene requests a loan to stock up her food inventory in order to get ready for the peak season for her business.

loans.use: To stock up her food inventory

loans.name: Seab

texts.en:
Mrs. Seab S., 45, and her husband, Mr. Vannak Roeung, 46, were married in 1990 and have four daughters, two of them attend school and other two assist their mother in silk weaving business. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Seab is a silk weaver, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then in turns it to sell at market in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a soldier. Seab is requesting her second loan of $1,100 to purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Five years ago, Mario started his own business supplying cleaning necessities to various shops and grocery stores. Having previously owned a similar business in his home country, Mario realized that he had the experience and the know how to start a similar business here in New York. He is now a successful, self-employed, small business owner working hard to support family members still living in the Dominican Republic.

Like many other immigrant business owners, Mario’s start up phase was not an easy one. Having arrived in the United States, Mario had difficulties obtaining loans from banks due to his lack of credit history. Unfortunately this led him to more predatory lending options, forcing him to pay high interest rates and leaving him with little to send home to his family. However after seeing a Univision report on ACCION USA, he approached ACCION USA for a loan and was approved. Mario will use his ACCION USA loan to help him purchase wholesale inventory to sell.

Mario is a firm believer that maintaining client relationships and offering good customer service are key factors in running a successful business. In the future Mario hopes to expand his business and hopes that his success will allow him to provide work for other entrepreneurs.

loans.use: buying Cleaning supplies  wholesale

loans.name: Tseveldorj

texts.en: M. Tseveldorj is 61 years old and lives with her husband in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her husband are both retired and live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Tseveldorj currently operates a clothing trade business in her town to support herself in retirement. She started her business in 2006 with a working capital of 500,000 tugrugs. She has found success in her new trade and attributes this to her good business knowledge and selling skills. Tseveldorj is very hard working and is very persistent in achieving her goals. She says, "My business is continuing quite well and someday I hope it will be managed by my grandchild." She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for her business

loans.name: Mir Malang

texts.en: The man who is pictured is Mir Malang, the son of M. A.. He lives in the 19th district of Kabul Afghanistan. He would like to take an individual loan of 50000 Afghani to construct his house. He needs to buy construction materials with his loan. He is glad that these kinds of processes exist in Afghanistan to support the people.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela tiene 35 años, vive con sus 2 pequeños hijos y su pareja, en su casa propia. Ella es una mujer muy hogareña y trabajadora.

Desde muy joven se ha desempeñado en variedad de oficios y siempre los ha realizado con muchas ganas porque sabe que todo trabajo bien realizado obtiene buenas recompensas.
Es así que en unión con su hermana se dedica a vender comida en un pequeño puesto en un paradero de transporte público de mucha afluencia cerca de su casa. De esta manera puede trabajar velar por sus pequeños que necesitan de muchos cuidados ya que están en una etapa de crecimiento, además de apoyarse mutuamente con su hermana para generarse una fuente de ingresos económicos.
Ellas siempre piensan en grande y ya están haciendo planes de expandir su negocio, pero saben que el camino es largo y aun tienen mucho por recorrer, aun así están muy optimistas de lograr un futuro mejor.

Este es el segundo préstamo que realiza con MFP y siempre ha sido muy responsable con todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de ingredientes y utensilios de cocina para obtener mayor clientela y brindarles un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Adela, 35, lives in her own home with her partner and her two small children. She is a hard-working, home-lovng woman. From a very early age she has worked at various jobs and has always done them with enthusiasm because she knows that all work well done brings good rewards. Together with her sister she sells prepared meals from a small stand at a busy public transportation stop near her house. This allows her to work while still watching over her small children who need a lot of attention since they are in a growing stage and to provide mutual help to her sister thus earning income. They have big plans and are looking to expand their business but know that the road is long and they have a long way still to go but, even so, are optimistic that they will attain a better future. This is her second loan with MFP and she has always been responsible with her repayments. The funds she is requesting on this occasion will be used to buy a larger amount of ingredients and cooking utensils so that she can serve more customers and offer improved service.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and cooking utensils for her meal preparation.

loans.name: Manoushak

texts.en: Manoushak is a 62 year old woman who lives in Beirut, Lebanon with her husband. Manoushak has owned a clothing shop since 2006. Manoushak's work is exceptional because she offers nice and fashionable clothes. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. She is currently requesting a loan from Al Majmoua so that she can purchase more merchandise for her shop. Manoushak has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time. Her previous loans helped her increase and diversify her merchandise. Manoushak decided on doing her business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. Before opening her shop she used to sell from her house.

loans.use: purchasing more merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Brenda Lee

texts.en: This is Brenda Lee B., a 34-year-old entrepreneur from Cabrera, Pasay City. One of her three children is in high school and the other two are in grade school. Her husband, Victor, is a cook. Brenda has been buying and selling processed meats like longanisa (local sausage) and embutido (meat loaf) and hotdogs for five years now. In addition, she also sells soft drinks and ready-to-wear (RTW) clothing. She now earns more than P8,000 a month in net income but her earnings sometimes vary depending on the supply and demand of frozen products. Brenda applied for a fresh loan of P24,000 from CCT so she can re-stock her frozen supplies. She wishes to see all her children finish their studies. She also dreams of having a stall in the market. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To re-stock her frozen goods

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María T., de 50 años de edad, está casada hace 25 años tiene 2 hijos mayores que ya formaron familia, su hija casada vive con ella.
Cuenta en su domicilio con un salón de belleza con servicios de saunas, masajes, y maquillajes, su hija es la encargada de la parte de los masajes, está en el ramo hace mucho tiempo por lo que ya tiene una clientela formada, además como campaña de promoción cada semana realiza  ofertas de algunos de  los servicios que ofrece su Salón de Belleza.
Como la casa es amplia, también tiene rentas de algunos departamentos arriba de su casa, y actualmente tiene un pequeño comedor donde da de comer a algunos trabajadores del lugar.
La señora T. es muy activa en todos sus emprendimientos y dice cuidar mucho de su crédito porque mediante ello puede realizar muchas cosas.
texts.en:
María T., 50, has been married for 25 years and has two adult children who have formed their own families. Her married daughter lives with her. She has a beauty salon in her home that offers sauna, massage and make-up services. Her daughter is in charge of the massages. She has been in this line of work for a long time now so she has a well-established regular customer base. In addition, as a marketing technique, she offers weekly reduced prices on some of her beauty salon's services. Since her house is ample, she also rents out some of the upstairs bedrooms and she also has a small dining room where she caters meals for some of the area workers. T. is very active in all of her enterprises and she says that she is very careful with her credit obligations because it is through financing that she is able to accomplish so many things.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For improvements to her beauty salon.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is 23 years old. She is a married woman with two children, one of them currently in school. She prepares and sells pastries such as meat pies and doughnuts. She supplies them by herself in the market center and retails them to her customers in bulk. Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials as prices are going up. She requests loan support to remain in business. With the loan, she believes she can provide for her family and especially for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy baking materials (flour, sugar, margarine, yeast,firewood etc.)

loans.name: Erlina

texts.en:
Erlina I., 49, owns a small rice farm. This farm helps her buy the things her family asks for, like food, clothes and other basic necessities. She said that if she does not work hard on her farm, she won’t get anything for her family. 

Now she is having difficulty maintaining her 1-hectare farm because of financial constraints in the family. She would like to apply for a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Jorge Aurelio

texts.es:
Jorge es socio del Banco Comunal 30 de Junio.
Jorge es casado, tiene 70 años y 12 hijos de los cuales 1 hija vive con el. Jorge tiene una carpintería en su casa, además se dedica a la compra y venta de maderas.
Jorge necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de madera.
Jorge sueña con ampliar su negocio y comprar mas maquinas.
texts.en:
Jorge is a member of 30 de Junio communal bank. Jorge, 70, is married and has 12 children; one daughter still lives with him. Jorge has a carpentry shop in his home. He's also a wood merchant; he buys and sells various kinds of wood. Jorge needs a 2000 sol loan to buy lumber. Jorge dreams with enlarging his business and buying more machinery.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu C. sells cooking condiments at the central market, Bo, and has been in this business for twenty-two years now.

She is married to a trader who also trades in foodstuffs. She has ten dependents. She has spent most of her lifetime in her business.

Kadiatu wants to increase her profit margin by purchasing additional stock. She hopes to use the proceeds to support her kids' schooling and to start construction of their house on their recently purchased land.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy crates of chicken to stock her business

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en: Genelyn T. runs a sari sari store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is a 35-year-old woman living in the town of Central Lopez, Sagay City. She is married and has one school-age child. Genelyn has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) month. In 2003, Genelyn joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Genelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from NWTF. She is now requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 7th loan from NWTF. Genelyn plans to use the additional revenue to pay the tuition fees of her children. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of – not just a few – but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to realities surpassing their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase additional product to sell

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon O. is a 62-year-old married woman who supports her family by engaging in ready-to-wear clothing and a pig-fattening businesses. She lives in Barangay Su-ay, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental, with her husband and their three adult children who are 34 to 38 years old. Corazon has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 15,000. Corazon is now borrowing Php 20,000 so that she is able to expand her ready-to-wear clothing and pig-fattening businesses. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 20,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Corazon aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her businesses

loans.name: Alamuta Group

texts.fr:
ALLAMOUTA est un groupe de solidarité de huit (08) femmes toutes mariées. Elles vivent dans le même village et ont formé leur groupe par affinité depuis le 05 juillet 2001. Elle font parti du Banc Villageois de TEREMBASSE dans la région de Ziguinchor au Sénégal, elles ont entre 40 à 55 ans et sont mères d'au moins cinq enfants. Elles sont de la même ethnie; les BALANTE.

leur activité principale est la vente de poissons frais et d'huile de palme

Pour augmenter leur capacité d'autofinancement  afin de renforcer et d'intensifier leurs activité elles ont décidé de devenir des membres clients de CAURIE-MICRO FINANCE depuis 9 ans et sont à leur dix-septième  prêt solidaire et n'ont jamais eu de problème de remboursement.

Leurs nouveaux prêts leur permettront de développer et de faire la promotion de leur activité commerciale en augmentant leur quantité d'approvisionnement en marchandises tels que le poisson frais et l'huile de palme qu'elle achète auprès des transformateurs résidant dans leur village.

En se faisant des bénéfices à partir de leur commerce, elles font face aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et augmentent leur niveau d'épargne dans leur Banc Villageois
texts.en:
ALLAMOUTA is a solidarity group formed by eight women, all married. They live in the same village and have formed their group on July 5, 2001, based on friendship ties. They belong to the Terembasse Banc Villeagois in the region of Ziguinchor in Senegal; they are between 40 and 55 years of age, and each has at least five children. They all belong to the same ethnic group, the Balante. Their main activity is selling fresh fish and palm oil. In order to improve their ability to support themselves and to strengthen their business, nine years ago they have decided to join Caurie Microfinance and are now on their 17th group loan. They never had any issues with repaying their loans. The new loan will allow them to grow and promote their business and to purchase larger stock of their wares such as fresh fish and palm oil which they purchase from producers in their village. The income derived from their business is used to meet everyday family expenses and to increase their savings at the Banc Villageois.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening the group's self-sufficiency

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean M. is from the town of Sto.Niño. She is 55 years old, married and has 5 adult children. Jean owns & operates an agricultural business. She tills a 1.25 hectare rice field and harvests approximately 70 sacks of rice from it. She also raises some pigs and hopes for her new venture to grow. Jean has been involved in farming for over 40 years.

In 2008, Jean joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and pigfeed. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Jean from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:
