Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pigfeed

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 28 años de edad ella vive al lado de su esposo y su pequeño hijo Diego de 8 años de edad. El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de productos de belleza, ya que necesitaba de un trabajo en donde pueda disponer de su tiempo para cuidar su hijo, que aún esta en etapa escolar, de esa manera ha logrado continuar con esta actividad durante 6 años. Ahora sus ventas lo realizan en la tienda de su suegra, haciendo uso de una vitrina en el que coloca sus cosméticos para exhibirlos, logrando así venderlos rápidamente. Otra manera de vender sus productos lo hace cuando deja a crédito sus productos, es le resulta rentable y sobre todo puede brindarle un ingreso extra a la economía familiar. María quiere seguir en este negocio y para ello necesita comprar más mercadería para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos los pagos de las cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de cosméticos para tenerlos en stock.
texts.en:
María is 28 years old. She lives with her husband and her small son Diego, who is 8. She works selling beauty products, since she needed a job where she could set aside time to take care of her son, who is still in school. She has managed to continue this work for six years. Now she conducts sales in her mother-in-law’s store, making use of a showcase in which she displays her cosmetics, selling them more rapidly. Another way for María to sell products is to sell on credit, which has been profitable for her, and above all, can provide extra income to her family finances. María wants to continue this business, for which she needs to buy more merchandise in order to meet her customers’ demands. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she commits to being very timely with all of her payments. With the loan that she is requesting, she will buy large amounts of cosmetics to keep in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Cosmetics to Sell

loans.name: Samina Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Samina Parveen fills orders from her neighborhood for her embroidery business to earn an income. She lives in Multan, a city of shrines and sweetmeats in Pakistan. She has applied for a loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan) for her embroidery business.

She is a very skillful woman and keeps herself up-to-date with the new embroidery fashions. Fortunately, her creativity helps her to make new designs in her mind and try to realize them on the clothes. She says that she is blissful by the grace of God that He has caused her to be born with this talent.

Her customers admire her work and give good orders to her. She works hard to manage the orders on time. More than that, she loves her work because it has given her a good business which continues to improve her financial situation.

With the loan she will buy embroidery materials such as clothes, colored thread and beads in bulk which will help her fulfill larger orders in time.

loans.use: To purchase embroidery materials for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Miriams Leticia

texts.es:
Miriams de 46 años, vive en la perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y el estero que conecta al río, a unas cuantas cuadras). Ella vende Avon (empresa que ayuda a las mujeres para que puedan trabajar vendiendo productos por catalogo). 

Ella para poder mantener a sus dos hijos ya que esta separada de su esposo tuvo que ingresa como vendedora de Avon por catalogo, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo tener ingresos, para tener mas ingresos ella también cose ropa a sus clientes. También a readecuado su casa y tiene una vitrina para vender los productos.

En el futuro quiere tener su negocio mas grande y tener su propio taller de costura.
texts.en:
46-year old Miriams lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil along the Perimetral (ring road). The roads are made of earth, and there is a marsh adjoining the river a few blocks away. Miriams sells Avon products (the company helps women to sell their products via catalogs). In order to support her two children--she is separated from her husband--she had to join the company as a salesperson. She worked hard and gradually started to make money. To make extra income she also makes clothes for customers. She has also altered her house and added a display case for her products. In the future Miriams wants to own a bigger business and have her own clothing workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy material, perfume, lotions

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is married. She is an entrepreneur from Khoost. She owns a clothing sales business, selling children’s clothing merchandise in one of the local markets in her hometown. The inventory she offers for sale is relatively cheap and of good quality. Margarita has been in the trade for 17 years. Her net profit amounts to about 3,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Margarita is seeking a loan of 9,000 Grivnyas to increase the variety of merchandise she offers for sale in her vending kiosk. Margarita’s clients are satisfied with inventory at her kiosk. They are attracted by affordable prices and friendly service. Margarita has her loyal clientele. She can be characterized as a reliable and trustworthy borrower who is seeking to further develop her trade and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Vilma Roxana

texts.es:
Vilma Roxana M. M. tiene 30 anos. Es soltera y vive con su familia en el cantón de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. 

Vilma es una socia de la ventanilla rural Lucha Para Triunfar. Son 13 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.

Vilma tiene un negocio de viscuteria (adornos como aretes). Realiza sus compras en Guayaquil y vende en el canton de Ventanas. Solicita el préstamo para incrementar la venta de viscuteria. Su sueno es seguir adelante y que vaya bien en el negocio y que tenga buena salud en su familia. 

Le gusta practicar deportes.
texts.en:
Vilma Roxana M. M. is 30 years old, single, and lives with her family in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Lucha Para Triunfar” (Fight To Win). There are 13 members in total, most of whom engage in agriculture.

Vilma has a business selling trinkets (such as earrings). She buys in Guayaquil and sells in the canton of Ventanas. The loan she is requesting will be used to expand her trinket business. Her dreams include getting ahead, doing well in her business, and experiencing good health within her family.

Vilma enjoys practicing sports.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her trinket business

loans.name: 080703-Hoang Thinh-Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Ha N. T., 32, lives in the town of H. Hoa-Thanh Hoa. Ha is the leader of a 4-member group loan. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 080703-H. Thinh-H. Hoa.

Ha is married and has three young children. To make a living, Ha operates a family member's manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling plastic products to local businesses and community members. Ha has been engaged in this business for one year and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2010, Ha joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. This is her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan of 3,079,800 VND, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Ha plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  L. T. Yen is a 30 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079.800 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector.


2.  H. T. Duyen is a 35 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector.


3.  L. T. Thanh is a 31 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas of the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for its Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ha N. T. (32) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố H. Hoa-Thanh Hoa.  Ha là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 080703-H. Thinh-H. Hoa (080703-H. Thinh-H. Hoa).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng nhựa cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Ha thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 1 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Ha kiếm được khoảng 2,000,000 VND.  Vào 2010, Ha đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Ha đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,079,800 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  L. T. Yen (19) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.

2.  H. T. Duyen (20) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.

3.  L. T. Thanh (21) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 52 años, separado hace muchos años, vive en su casa propia, tienes 7 hijos de las cuales ahora vive en compañía de su pequeña hija. Hace más de 20 años, se dedica a realizar transporte de taxi; y solo lo realiza por las noches, debido que hay menos trafico que en el día, por otro lado se encarga de llevar y recoger a su pequeña hija del colegio, y así también cuida de su pequeña hija, quien es su mayor adoración y siempre esta pendiente de ella. En todos estos años de trabajo, aprendió a conocer a sus pasajeros y sabe que así se evitaría menos riesgo de algún asalto o robo de su vehículo. Se siente muy satisfecho con el trabajo que realiza, debido a las rentas que le generan, por ello desea en adelante comprarse un auto, asimismo desea ampliar el nuevo negocio de ferretería  que emprendió con su hermano. Es su 16avo  crédito con MFP, en sus anteriores créditos ha sido muy puntual y espera serlo ahora también, por lo que en su grupo tiene el aprecio de todos. Con el crédito que solicita,  piensa comprar una llanta para su carro y con resto dará como inicial para la compra de una moto, de esa manera trabajará su hijo que se encuentra desempleado.
texts.en:
Juan is 52 years old and has been separated for many years. He lives in a home of his own and has seven children but only his young daughter lives with him. He's been driving a taxi for more than 20 years. He only drives in the evenings, since there is less traffic. He also drops off and picks up his daughter from school and cares for her. She is his main adoration and he is always mindful of her. He has learned to know his passengers over the years and knows that he can reduce the risk of robbery or theft of his vehicle. He is happy with his work, because of the profits that it gives him. In the future he wants to buy a car for himself, and at the same time expand the new hardware business that he and his brother have started. This will be the 16th loan through MFP. He has been very punctual with his previous loans and he expects to be so with this one because he has the admiration of all of the members of his group. He plans to buy a tire for his car with some of the money from this loan and the rest he will use as a down payment for a motorcycle, so that his unemployed son can work.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance

loans.name: Kledyn Yolibeth

texts.es:
la señora Kledyn Yolibeh R. F. tiene 24 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos.
su actividad es la venta de tamales, chorizos, chanfaina y frito de cerdo esta actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años. 
Kledyn todos los dias se levanta de mañana para preparar las comidas y sale a vender hasta en la tarde
al mercado viejo de San Lorenzo.
gracias a su negocio puede pagar su renta y la manutencion de sus dos hijos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de harina de maiz, hojas de platano, leña, carnes de cerdo y pollo, chicharrones y otros materiales para hacer los tamales.
su mayor sueño es tener su propia casa en donde sus hijos puedan crecer sanos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kledyn Yolibeh R. F., 24, is a single mother of two children. She sells tamales, sausages, chanfaina (a stew-like dish made with offal) and frito de cerdo (fried pork with rice or yucca). She has been in this line of work for five years. Kledyn rises early in the morning every day to prepare the meals and then goes out to sell them in the afternoon in San Lorenzo’s old market. Thanks to her business she is able to support her two children. She will use the loan to buy corn flour, banana leaves, firewood, pork and chicken, fried pork skin and other supplies for her tamales. Her greatest wish is to have her own home where her children can grow up healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, sausages, corn flour, vegetables, pork, chicken, banana leaves, condiments, salt.

loans.name: Ailene

texts.en:
Ailene B. is 46 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. She is from the village of Poblacion in Quezon municipality, Bukidnon province on the Mindanao islands. Ailene makes and sells specialty food products like chicken and pork barbecue, homemade sausages, and hotdog kababs to the local community. Ailene has been in business for over six years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Ailene joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan, her first, of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw foodstuffs needed to make her products. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw foodstuffs needed to make her products

loans.name: C2362 Abizeranye Group

texts.en:
Adela is 45 years old and married with six children between the ages of 15 and 28. Adela also takes care of two dependent relatives. With this big family, Adela provides all the necessities because no one else in her family works. Adela is a business woman selling various foodstuffs such as beans, maize, and so on. Adela is seasoned in her business because she has 10 years of experience. The hours of her business are from 5 in the morning to 6 in the evening. Adela is also the group representative for five people with different businesses. 

Adela and her group are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand their businesses by purchasing different products needed by their customers. With this loan, Adela and her group will be able to earn enough profit to help them sort out their business problems and their family problems as well.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Oyunsuren

texts.en: Oyunsuren Z. is 30 years old. She lives with her husband and two daughters in an apartment in Baganuur, one of the remote districts of Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. Both of her two daughters attend a local school while her husband operates a taxi service using his car and helps with Oyunsuren's business. Since 2004, she has been purchasing second hand raw materials such as glass and plastic bottles, aluminum, copper and brass, etc. to sell for profits. After many years of operation, she has established a stable business and a good position in the business community. Her earnings have enabled her to purchase a new car for her husband and to improve her family's standard of living as well. Over the years, she has gained not only in experience but also permanent suppliers. For the future, she plans to trade her car in for a big truck. Oyunsuren is a modest and honest woman and she is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan  in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To increase her working capital.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 35 years old and lives in the town of Litein in western Kenya. He is married with four children, whose ages range from 9 to 2 years old. 

He has been in the farming business for four years and employs one other worker. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. 

Five years from now, Julius hopes to own four purebred dairy cows. With the increased income from the loan, he also hopes to be able to pay school fees for each of his children.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Fevigean

texts.en: Fevigean B. owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 22 years old, married and has a baby. They are from the village of Salucong, Reina Mercedes, Isabela. Fevigean has been in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Fevigean joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Fevigean is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia A., from the town of Sto. Niño, is 33 years old, married, and has four children, her eldest only eight years old. To make a living, Nemia owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting rice for sale. She works hard to improve her family's living conditions.

Nemia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from CEVI, she is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Diana Yaneth

texts.es:
Diana Yaneth A. R. tiene 24 años de edad Vive en Unión Libre junto a su compañero y sus hijos en el cantón de Chillanes Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TRES DE NOVIEMBRE, Esta compuesta por 28 socios y esta a 90 minutos de  la oficina se encuentra dentro de los límites del Cantón Chillanes. Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Diana Yaneth se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Compra sus productos en Mata de cacao y sus ventas se realizan en el Comercial  Matilde Esther y vende los  productos en Bucay.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es  mejorar la vivienda.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en: Diana Yaneth A. R. is 24. She is in a common-law marriage and lives with her partner and children in the Chillanes Canton, Bolivar province. She has 2 children. The V.R.C. Tres de Noviembre group has 28 members and is 90 minutes from the office, within the limits of the Chillanes Canton. This region is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour; the sowing of rice, bananas, corn, cocoa, oranges and yucca. They spend a lot of time doing this work. Diana Yaneth works in agriculture, sowing rice, bananas, corn, cocoa, oranges and yucca. She purchases her products in Mata de Cacao and sells in the Matilde Esther Market and in Bucay. She is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural inputs and fertilizers for the cultivation of rice, bananas, corn, cocoa, oranges and yucca. The support of this loan will help her economically to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to improve her home. She enjoys sports.

loans.use: agricultural inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly G. is from the village of Kalawaig, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 28 years old and married with a school-aged child. To make a living, Merly owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Her main source of income comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods, and toothpaste in the local community. Merly has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

Merly joined HSPFI in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. Merly is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and junk foods. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. Merly plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio de 22 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel, trabaja en una ferretería de mucho prestigio, vive con su padre y dos pequeños hermanos, su padre tiene una tienda donde ofrece artículos de primera necesidad.
Actualmente Julio solicita un préstamo para comprar herramientas ya que por ser empleado de esta ferretería le realizan un descuento por cada compra, él quiere iniciar con su padre en la venta de herramientas,aprovechando el descuento que en su trabajo le harán a las herramientas y con ella iniciar un negocio paralelo al que atenderá sin dejar de trabajar en la ferretería.
Sueña con que iniciar el negocio, ganar clientela y con la ayuda de su padre mejorar juntos la situación económica actual y en un futuro poder ser microempresarios.
texts.en:
Julio is 22 years old and he lives in San Miguel, in the department of San Miguel. He works in a very well known hardware store. He lives with his father and two younger siblings. His father has a general store from where he sells basic needs products. 

Julio requests a loan to purchase tools. Since he is an employee of the hardware store he is able to get a discount on his purchases. He wants to start selling tools together with his father, taking advantage of the discount he enjoys from his work.  They will start an additional business that he will manage without having to leave his job at the hardware store. 

He dreams of starting this business, to earn a clientele, and together with his father, improve the family's financial situation, and in the future be small businessmen.

loans.use: To purchase tools.

loans.name: Muchira

texts.en:
Muchira is a farmer from the town of Murang'a in central Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last 15 years and employs two farmhands. His mixed farm produces french beans, vegetables, tea and milk that he sells to the local market.

He recently repaid his previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000Kes and has requested a loan of 60,000Kes to purchase water pump and pipes. He says that these will enable him to expand his farming activities and hence improve his output and income. He plans to expand his farming in future and if possible export his products directly.

Muchira is 48 and married with two children ages 12 and 14 who both attend school.

loans.use: To purchase water a pump and pipes.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: Anahit A. lives in the village of Tolors in the Syunik region of Armenia. She lives with her husband and daughter, who is studying at university in Yerevan, the capital city. Anahit and her husband look after the cattle farm and cultivate the land. Anahit is a member of the local milk collection unit. To be ready for the busy spring working season, Anahit wants to ensure she has everything that is required. She has applied for this loan to purchase seeds and gasoline to transfer the produce.

loans.use: to buy seeds and gasoline

loans.name: Emille

texts.en:
Emille, age 31, earns his living as a motorbike taxi driver. He has been engaged in this business for 3 years and his business is well-organized. He gets up at 5am and works until 9pm every day, transporting people from their workplaces. He and his wife have three children.

Emile has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy essential materials for his motorbike. His goal is to send all his siblings to school, pay fees for his children, and to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy materials for his motorcycle

loans.name: Quick Action Group

texts.en:
Dora F. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Dora was born in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone, 39 years ago. She is married to a businessman and the couple has five children – one in primary school and three in secondary school. The other is not of school-going age. 

This is the first loan that Dora and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Dora, who has had 15 years of experience in selling women’s dresses and shoes, is going to use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to buy more women's dresses and shoes to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy women's dresses and shoes to add to her business inventory.

loans.name: Perch

texts.en: Perch S. lives in Suser village with his wife and two daughters. He is engaged in agriculture from which he receives the main income for the family. Perch’s farm includes 2 cows, 13 cattle, 1 pig and 5 turkeys. He also cultivates 2 hectares of barley and 1.96 hectares of alfalfa. Perch applied to Kiva partner, SEF, in 2009 to increase his livestock. Now he has applied again to increase his livestock. With the requested loan he plans to repair his cattle farm and buy two cows.

loans.use: to repair his cattle farm and buy livestock.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 21-year-old married man living in Tyre with his wife and one child. He works hard to provide his family with the best standard of living and education. For the past six years, Ali has worked in land rehabilitation and drilling. He is a hard worker who is loved and honored by his friends and most of his customers, who are his friends, relatives, and neighbors. Ali has a good reputation and a strong commitment to work. 

Ali is requesting his first loan from Al Majmoua to buy sand and stone which are necessary to improve his business and make it easier and faster. He hopes to expand his business in the future by buying another Caterpillar drilling machine.

loans.use: to buy sand and stone to improve his business

loans.name: Peter Ngugi

texts.en: Peter, who has operated a business in the transport industry in Naivasha for the last two  years, is 27 years old, married to Mary Wanjiru, and the father of one child. Introduced to KADET LTD  by his friend, Peter repaid his previous loan of KES.15,000 well and in good time. He is now requesting his second loan with which he plans to open a retail shop. In the future, Peter hopes to grow the new retail business into a wholesale operation.

loans.use: to open a retail shop.

loans.name: Lizeth

texts.es:
Lizeth nació en el distrito de Calca provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco (Calca se encuentra a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco), ella tiene 23 años edad. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad de donde nació. (La ciudad de Calca caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes por ser una zona turística, ganadera y agrícola). Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Clorinda Matto de Turner” de la Asociación Arariwa. 
   
Lizeth es profesora y trabaja en el colegio particular “San Toribio de Mogrovejo” de la ciudad de Calca. Ya es un año que trabaja en dicha institución y le va muy bien. Ella actualmente es sus tiempos libres se dedica a la elaboración de su tesis pues se quiere graduarse para obtener el título profesional de Educación. Ella también nos cuenta que tiene un pequeño negocio familiar que consiste en vender productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más. Ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes que está ubicado en su domicilio y esta implementado con las necesidades básicas. 
Con este préstamo de USD. 500 dólares surtirá su negocio con más productos, comprará por ejemplo arroz, cocoa, aceite, leche en tarros, insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Lizeth es una mujer luchadora y su sueño es hacer una maestría. Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Asociación Arariwa por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Lizeth was born in Calca District, Calca Province in Cusco Department.  (Calca is located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco.)  She is 23 years old.  She is currently living in the city of her birth.  (The city of Calca is characterized by having beautiful scenic spots and for being a center of tourism, cattle raising and farming.)  She is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Clorinda Matto de Turner” communal bank.

Lizeth is a teacher working at the “San Toribio de Mogrovejo” private school in Calca.  She’s been working at said institution for a year and does very well.  In her spare time she is busy writing her thesis because she wants to graduate to obtain a professional title in Education.  She also tells us that she has a small family business which consists in the sale of basic need items like rice, sugar, noodles and other things, for example.  She has a small home-based grocery store stocked with basic need items.

She will use this 500USD loan to stock the store with more products.  For example, she will buy rice, cocoa, oil, jugs of milk, personal hygiene supplies, home cleaning supplies, packets of soft drinks and other products to keep her customers happy.

Lizeth is a tenacious woman whose dream is to get a Master’s Degree.  She is very grateful to the Asociación Arariwa Movement for helping women like her to have opportunities to make their dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng, age 44, is married with four children, two of whom are themselves married. One of their single children is a sewing worker. 

She is a domestic rice farmer in the Prey Chor district. Aside from her current occupation, she also sells sugar cane juice in front of her house for extra income as the photo above shows. 

Her husband is a motor taxi driver in the local market and earns a profit of about $1.50 per day. Usually Seng generates around $1.60 of profit a day to meet the needs of her family. 

Previously she prepared the wedding party for one of her children, but hasn't paid for some of the expenses yet. This is the main reason she has decided to seek a loan: to pay the remaining wedding-ceremony expenses.

loans.use: to repay expenses from a wedding ceremony

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past five years, she has operated a restaurant business, cooking rice and beans with flat bread and selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the rainy season it becomes difficult to operate her business. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase four sacks of potatoes, twenty crates of soda and ten crates of beer. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase four sacks of potatoes, twenty crates of soda, and ten crates of beer.

loans.name: Jalal

texts.en:
Jalal is 41 years old. He is married with two children. He sells foodstuffs like macaroni, wheat, buckwheat, cotton seed oil and other products. 

When he started the business three years ago it was only retail sales. Gradually expanding the business, he purchased the goods as a wholesaler and distributed them among the stores. The business became successful and stable and his current monthly profit is about $250.

Jalal requests a 900 AZN loan for purchasing foodstuffs to increase the range of goods for sale.  He already completed his first loan from AqroInvest CU and has a good client history. He thanks all supporting him and promises to pay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs to increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Gerges

texts.en:
Gerges is a 21-year-old single man living with one parent and two siblings. He is from Lebanon. 

In 2009, he started running his own business. He works as a female hairdresser serving clients at their domiciles. His business income is very important because he helps his father with the household expenses. Today, he is requesting to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new hairdressing tools and supplies. He intends to expand his business operation further and hopes to be able to open a formA. beauty salon in the coming years.

loans.use: to purchase new hairdressing tools and supplies

loans.name: Fernando Jose

texts.es:
Fernando tiene 41 años de edad, trabaja arduamente como fontanero en la ciudad de managua y a la vez es casado y padre de familia de tres menores los que se encuentran en el colegio.
el visita las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un prestamo para construir dos cuarto de habitacion para sus hijos, ya que el no cuenta con sufucientes ingresos para realizar la mejora por tal razon a cude a ceprodel para que le financie un prestamo, todo esto es con la finalidad de brindarles mejores condiciones de vivienda a su esposa e hijos.
agradece aceprodel por la oportunidad que le fue brindada.
texts.en:
Fernando is 41 years old and works hard in his job as a plumber in the city of Managua. He is married and the father of three children who are in school.

Fernando visited the offices of CEPRODEL so that he could request a loan for building two rooms in his home for his children. He does not have sufficient to complete this improvement, so he has come to CEPRODEL to seek financing with this loan. All of his efforts go toward providing better living conditions at home for his wife and children. Fernando is grateful to CEPRODEL for this opportunity that has been given to him.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials so that he can build rooms for his children.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther tiene 58 años, radica en su ciudad natal al lado de su esposo y una de sus hijos en su casa propia. Tiene 5 años de experiencia en ventas de comida que prepara en su misma casa  y de manera adicional también vende artículos de acuerdo a la temporada, permitiéndole ganar más dinero. Ella siempre esta en búsqueda de oportunidades de negocio así como procura buscar el lugar adecuado para venderlas. Durante estos años de  trabajo ha logrado ahorrar capital y ello le sirve para impulsar su iniciativa de negocio por lo que tiene planes de seguir creciendo e innovando. Es su crédito número 7 con MFP, en todo este tiempo de trabajo ha demostrado su liderazgo en el banco comunal. El dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en el negocio por el cual se ha asociado con un familiar, que es la venta de sombreros, por ello comprará este artículo en variedad.
texts.en:
58-year-old Esther lives in her home town together with her husband and one of her children.  She owns her own home.

Esther has more than five years experience selling food which she prepares in her home.  She also sells items according to the season.  This allows her to earn more money.  Esther is always looking for business opportunities and trying to find the right place to sell her goods.  Over the years, she has managed to save money which she uses to drive her business initiatives.  She has plans to continue growing and innovating.

This is Esther's seventh loan from MFP.  Over the years, she has demonstrated leadership within her community bank.  She will invest the money that she is requesting in a business that she has gone into with a family member (selling hats).  She will buy a range of these products.

loans.use: to buy more hats

loans.name: Estrella

texts.es:
Estrella, D. 60 años es una mujer con espíritu joven y muy alegre, esta casada ya muchos años, vive en su casa propia junto a su hijo, nuera y su esposo.El trabajo D. Estrella consiste en vender bebidas gaseosas, este trabajo lo hace en su casa ya que hay bastante personas que buscan refrescarse ante el incremento D. la temperatura en esta parte del Perú, lleva haciendo este trabajo ya por mas D. 20 años, lo hace sola ya que su esposo trabaja D. manera independiente y sale temprano y vuelve muy tarD..
Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que realizando esta actividad mas el trabajo D. su esposo pudo hacer muchas cosas, agradece que siempre haya ingresos y espera poder ampliar su negocio mas adelante.Este es el préstamo numero 14 entre Estrella y la institución MFP, esta muy contenta con el grupo formado, además D. tener  muchas ganas D. poder seguir trabajando ya que le agrada el trabajo con MFP por que los interés son muy bajos además D. acceder a los seguros a muy bajo costo.
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles ella comprará bebidas gaseosas ya que es un mercado muy granD. y esta empezando a vender al por mayor.
texts.en:
Estrella, age 60, is a cheerful woman with a youthful spirit. She has been married for several years and lives in her own home with her husband, her son, and her daughter-in-law. Her work consists of selling soft drinks from her home since there are plenty of people looking to buy refreshments as a result of the high temperatures in this part of Peru. Estrella has been in this business for more than 20 years. She works alone in her business since her husband is self-employed. He leaves early and returns home very late. What she likes most about her job is that it is more than work to her. It has allowed her husband to do more things, so she is grateful to always have income and hopes to expand her business going forward.

This is Estrella’s 14th loan with MFP. She is very pleased to be part of her group. In addition, she is determined to continue working with MFP because of the low interest rates and access to insurance at low cost. The amount of 1500 PEN that she requested will be used to buy sodas since she has a large market and is starting to sell wholesale.

loans.use: to buy sodas in bulk.

loans.name: Luis Abel

texts.es: El Joven Luis es un pequeño agricultor de la zona de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa e hijos, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar a su hijo es sus estudios, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas que invaden el cultivo de piña ya que estas plantas por falta de fertilizantes e insumos pierden color, tamaño y sobre todo sabor natural a piña. Agradece  el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de los fondos Kiva para poder sacar adelante su cultivo y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis is a young man who works as a small farmer in the District of Ticuantepe. He lives with his wife and children. His plans for the future are to improve his living conditions and to support his son in his studies. The greatest challenge he faces is dealing with pests that have invaded his pineapple crop. Due to the lack of fertilizers and other supplies, his pineapples crops have lost their color, size, and all of the natural flavor in the fruit.

Thanks to the support AFODENIC has provided by supplying Kiva funds, Luis will be able to move forward with his plantings and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and farming supplies.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana tiene 69 años de edad vive con su esposo e hijos y es vecina de una comunidad ubicada en la Costa Pacifico Sur de Costa Rica, llamada La Palma de Puerto Jimenez, en la provincia de Puntarenas. Es una zona que ha crecido comercial y portuariamente, muy explotada ya que, poseen hermosas playas a su alrededor. Se da mucho lo que es la pesca, la agricultura y ganadería. Esta comunidad está llena de costumbres y actividades.

Desde hace varios años que Juana se dedica a trabajar por las ventas por catalogo para superarse cada día. Desde que  ingreso a este negocio los resultados han sido buenos, ya que ha tenido una gran aceptación en su comunidad y los ingresos que ha generado lo han ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia.

En estos momentos lo que desea Juana es solicitar un préstamo por ¢300,000 (trescientes mil colones) para la compra de ropa y zapatos, para así venderlos y obtener ganancia para incrementar su recursos económicos. Ella espera vender muchos productos para su familia y llegar a generar más ingresos para mejorar su condición de vida.  

Juana es miembro de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Raíces Capitales S.A,  razón por la cual dice sentirse  muy agradecida por las oportunidades  de acceso al crédito que esta le brinda y poder llevar a cabo sus proyectos de vida.
texts.en:
Juana is 69 years old.  She lives with her husband and children in a community located on the southern part of Costa Rica's Pacific coast.  The community is called La Palma de Puerto Jimenez, and it's in the province of Puntarenas.  It's an area that has grown in commerce as a result of its port, which is heavily used; it also has beautiful beaches nearby.  There is much fishing, agriculture, and livestock farming, and this community is rich in traditions and activities.

For the last several  years, Juana has worked making sales from catalogs in order to get by.  The income from this business has been good as she is well-accepted in her community, and the income that she's earned has helped her to move her family ahead in life.

At the moment, Juana is requesting a loan for ¢300,000 (three hundred thousand colones) to buy clothes and shoes in order to sell them and earn money to increase her financial resources.  She hopes to sell many products on behalf of her family, and to be able to earn more income to improve their living conditions.

Juana is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Raíces Capitales communal bank, which is why she says that she feels very grateful for the opportunities she is being given for access to loans, and to be able to bring about her life's plans.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes in order to sell them.

loans.name: Cruz Maria

texts.es:
Cruz de 42 años de edad, vive con sus hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con el servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de La Matanza que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por ser agrícola y ganadera.

Cruz tiene como actividad laboral la confección de prendas de vestir y el servicio de costura, desde hace 5 años, su negocio lo tiene en su casa, cuenta con su propia clientela y también realiza trabajos a pedidos, la competencia en el rubro no es mucha, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus necesidades familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla de 1200 para comprar material y una máquina remayadora, para seguir brindando un buen servicio y cumpliendo con los pedidos que le han hecho, lo que le permitirá tener mayores ganancias para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Cruz con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo a sabido sacar su negocio adelante, con el ideal de brindarle otras oportunidades en la vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Cruz Maria is 42 years old. She lives with her children in her own house, with only electricity service, located in the district of La Matanza that belongs to the department of Piura. This area is known for agriculture and livestock.

Cruz Maria has been in the business of making clothing, working as a seamstress for the last 5 years, from her own house. She has an established clientele and also takes orders. She does not have much competition in this line of work. With the profit that she makes she can cover the basic necessities for her family.

She is asking for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1200 soles in order to buy supplies and a darning-overlocker sewing machine in order to continue providing good service and to complete the orders which she has. This will permit her to have better earnings in order to improve her quality of life for her family. Cruz Maria works hard and puts in effort to secure a good business future with the dream of giving her family more opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy supplies and a darning-overlocker sewing machine in order to continue making clothing

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 39 years old and lives in the Paynesville area. She’s married and her husband is a social worker. They have three children who are between 6 and 14 years old, all of whom are in school and live at home. For the past eighteen years she has been selling clothes in the local market. She makes a good profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes for her business. She hopes to become a larger-scale businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her business

loans.name: Saffa

texts.en:
This is 25-year-old Saffa. He is married and has three children, aged 6, 4 and 3 years. He has three additional dependents who live with him because they are his relatives.  

In 2008, Saffa established his clothing, shoes and belt business. He began his business because he dropped out of school and needed some form of employment to get income to support his family. Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, he earns about 1,800,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Saffa now requires a new loan in order to buy more women's jeans and men's jeans. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Saffa plans to give his children a better education and to travel to Dubai. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy men's and women's jeans for his business.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.en:
Honorata is 42 years old and married. She is a patient and diligent person in the community. She has a vegetable stand in front of her house to sell different vegetables from her own backyard. Honorata loves to plant vegetables in her backyard so that she can sell them in the community for her income.

Honorata is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos to buy different vegetable seeds to plant in her backyard to sell more vegetables in the future.

Honorata dreams that someday she could have a big farm for her vegetables so that she can meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds for her business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth sigue trabajando como docente del nivel primario en el distrito de Anta,la socia tambien se esta dedicando al negocio de venta de panetones por la epoca navideña y tambien la socia vende productos de belleza como perfumes y cremas,por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar los negocios de venta de panetones y negocio de venta de productos de belleza . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar panetones y productos de belleza como cremas y perfumes al por mayor.
texts.en:
Ruth continues working as a teacher at the elementary level in the Anta district.  She also is working in her business selling "panetones" [Christmas cakes] for the Christmas season, and she also sells beauty products like perfume and creams.

With these small businesses she gets her children ahead.  She wants to expand her businesses selling panetones and beauty products.

She is requesting the loan to buy panetones and beauty products such as creams and perfume wholesale.

loans.use: to buy "panetones" [holiday cakes] and beauty products such as creams and perfume wholesale.

loans.name: Khayrullo

texts.ru: Хайрулло занимается развозкой людей по маршруту Вахдат – Душанбе. Ему 22 года. В этой области он год. Кредит берет для ремонта своего автомобиля.
texts.en: Khayrullo is involved in transporting passengers along the Vahdat - Dushanbe route.  He is 22 years old.  He has been in this business for one year.  Khayrullo is requesting this loan to make repairs to his car.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car

loans.name: Nyandeng

texts.en:
Nyandeng is a 30-year-old married woman with three children. Two of them are in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Nyandeng is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase footwear

loans.name: Demur

texts.en:
Demur lives in the village of Kvaliti, West Georgia with his family: his wife Ketevan, 40 years old, his son, daughter-in-law and three grandchildren (2, 3 and 5 years old). 

Demur works as a taxi driver in a nearby town. His son is leading the agricultural activities of the family. Ketevan and her daughter-in- law are housewives and care for the three children. 

The family has two milk cows. They produce and sell on average 30 kg of cheese at the local market. In addition, they have a pig, which gives to the family on average 10 piglets for sale per year. Along with the abovementioned, the family owns 1,500 wine trees. They produce wine and sell it locally. The total average monthly income of the family is 550 laris. 

Demur requested a loan for purchasing an additional milk cow. They will be able to produce more cheese, which will be sold at the local market. It will increase the income of the family by 16%. Demur will spend it for purchasing additional goods for the children, to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba has been producing and selling kenkey (maize dumplings) in Asebu Brebia for 15 years. She is a single parent with 3 children whom she is responsible for feeding and clothing. Aba will use her loan to purchase maize in bulk for the production of her kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to produce more kenkey to sell.

loans.use: to purchase maize in bulk for the production of her kenkey.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en: Roger is a 46-year-old Lebanese man. He’s divorced and has only one child. Roger is ready to sacrifice his life just to offer his child a suitable life far from problems and complications. Although Roger had to work really hard and nonstop, he was capable of managing the family household in a good way. He has many years of experience as a car mechanic and opened his own garage many years ago. As he wishes to better develop his work, Roger is asking today for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase a new scanner machine. This step will facilitate his business, allowing him to receive more clients who are going to be served rapidly.

loans.use: to purchase a new scanner machine

loans.name: Ton's Group

texts.en:
Ton is 62 years old and lives with her husband and 10 children in a rural village within the Thmor Koul district. Rice farming and bean growing have been the only main sources of her family’s income for about 10 years. This current business earns her family a daily income of about 55,000 KHR, but she is able to save 30,000 KHR each day. 

This is the second loan for Ton with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to request a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Jeneffer

texts.en: Jeneffer is a married woman. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a farm where she grows maize, beans and other crops. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 22,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to be a large scale farmer within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Dimcho

texts.en: Dimcho N. is 47 years old with vocational high school education. Until 1990 he worked in the Police Department of Silistra town. His wife – Nellie Neikova, is a teacher. In 1990 his wife was discharged and they both decided to start retail trade with coffee. Since then the family lives on the income from the activity of their company “Agrodimex”. They have two children – a daughter (21 years old) and a son (19 years old). Both of them are students in Bucharest.

loans.use: To buy 10 new tables and 40 chairs

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa lives in Mtambani area in the Ilala District of Dar es Salaam. She is married with one child. Sharifa runs a tailoring business at her home.

The business has not been good recently due to insufficient sewing materials. She wants to improve her business by having enough supply sewing materials and a rented business premise. She is currently working on the varandah of her house which does not attract customers and does not provide her enough space. She also needs to add two sewing machines and one assistant. The strategy requires a capital boost of USD550.

loans.use: Business improvement

loans.name: Ada Betulia

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Ada Betulia, and my principal activity is the manufacture and sale of tortillas. My business is located in my home. I have several years of experience dedicating myself to this activity. Thanks to this business, I have helped my two daughters become professionals, and this motivates me to keep moving forward.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Hola mi nobre es Ada Betulia, mi actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de tortillas, ubicado en mi casa de habitación, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a esta actividad, gracias a este negocio he logrado hacer profesional a mis hijas (2), y eso me motiva a seguir adelante.

loans.use: To buy corn, lime, and firewood

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.en:
Olimjon is the father of six children and lives on a collective farm in a rural community called Khonobod. Olimjon’s income from farming is not sufficient to support his large family, so he also raises cattle at home with the help of wife and children. This is not a new business for Olimjon and his wife because they have done it since the childhood.

Recently Olimjon received a loan from Microinvest to buy a young bull. Now he has asked us for a new loan of $800 to repair a shed in which he can house his cattle when winter starts, and to increase the size of his herd by buying one more young bull.

loans.use: To repair the shed in which he houses his cattle and buy one young bull.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
I have been sold food (like my delicious menuda and quesadillas) for 13 years. This restaurant has been my family's source of income and my two daughters work with me. I am asking for a loan of $1,200.00 to buy a temperature control system for my restaurant because the cold season is approaching and I want my customers to be more comfortable and be able to eat the food that I sell.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Tengo ya mas de 13 años dedicandome a la venta de comidas (como el delicioso menuda y quesadillas). Este negocio a sido la fuente de ingresos de mi familia, en este negocio trabajamos mis dos hijas y yo. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls para acondicionar el negocio ya que se viene la temporada de frió y quiero que mis clientes estén mas cómodos y puedan consumir los alimentos que vendo.

loans.use: To install temperature control in my restaurant

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is the well-groomed, business-oriented owner of Bana Mityana Enterprises. Her store, which sells a well-stocked and varied assortment of cosmetics, lotions, shampoos and soaps, is located on a steep path just a hundred yards from a well-traveled road in the village of Zana. A lot of shops here are standalone shanties. Customers do not enter the store; instead they come up to the counter and ask to see the products. Edith has been in business for the past three years and has a second store with the same products in the next village. She is growth-oriented and wants to expand and get into a larger location. She also wants to diversify and own a petrol station. For now, though, she plans to use her loan to keep both of her cosmetic stores well stocked.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics, shampoos, lotions, etc., for her two stores

loans.name: Faida Self Help Group

texts.en:
Rose A. O., 38, is married with two children. Her primary business activity is a nursery school and a home care center. She started off with less than 10 children in 1998 and has since expanded to 60 children. She says that her main reason for starting the nursery/baby care was because of her love for children and desire to see them grow and also for profit to take care of her family's needs.

Rose started off with a capital base of Ksh 5000/= and has gradually ploughed back profits into her business over the years to allow her to reach to where she currently is. Her main challenge is lack of capital to cater to the increasing children seeking admission. This deficit is mainly in the learning facilities and feeding programme for the children. She thus intends to use the loan capital for this purpose while also using the profits from the business to help in meeting her family's needs.

Rose is the Chairman of the group she belongs to and she hopes to use her leadership skills acquired while managing the school to similarly ensure that the group remains cohesive to enable her to benefit from other loans in future. She has so far exhibited these leadership skills in marshalling the group together during the training sessions. Her business is in area called Muhoroni, almost 80 kilometres away from Kisumu town. This is the first loan she is taking with the Faida self help group but the training records from the loan officer indicate good attendance and participation by the group during group training sessions.

loans.use: To expand learning facilities and feeding programme for her nursery school

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam produces chocolate which she sells in small cardboard packages in the city of La Paz and around the country.

Her home and workshop are located in the San Sebastian neighborhood in the city of La Paz.

This is the first time she has requested a loan. The credit will be used to buy the main supplies for her work as cocoa, sugar, essences, vitamins, cardboard packages and bags.

Her work allows her to request this loan because she has experience in her business and the analysis of its cash flow shows she will have the capacity to repay the credit.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Description Historia del Cliente: Miriam elabora chocolate en paquetes de cartón en la ciudad de La Paz y el interior del País.

Su domicilio y Taller se encuentran ubicados en la zona San Sebastián de la ciudad de La Paz.

Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado para capital de trabajo (Cacao, azúcar, esencias, vitaminas, bolsas y cartón). Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su actividad económica y el análisis de flujo de caja muestra la capacidad de repago del crédito.

loans.use: The credit will be used to buy the main supplies for her business as cocoa, sugar, essences, vitamins, cardboard packages and bags

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru:
Farhod was born in 1983, is married and has one son. He has been taking out loans from MicroInvest since 2003. He buys the merchandise in large quantities from wholesalers and sells it in his store. He has a large variety of different liquors and beverages from different makers. He also has a contract with the local distillery to buy their product. Farhod has a fast commodity circulation and good monthly sales profits. He is very wise about paying off his loans. He is one of our most successful clients.

He is asking for a loan from Kiva to purchase the next batch of merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Фарход,1983 года рождения,женат имеет одного сына.В Микроинвесте кредитуется с 2003 года.Товар закупает у оптовиков большими партиями и реализует в своем магазине.Имеет широкий ассортимент алкогольных напитков разных производителей.Имеет договор с местными спирт заводами на продажу их продукции.У него быстрый товарооборот и ежемесечно имеет хорошую прибыль.Достаточно умен и аккуратен при платеже займов.Он является одним из успешных клиентов нашей организации.

В КИВЕ захотел участвовать с целью получения займа на покупку очередной партии товара.

loans.use: Purchase the next batch of merchandise

loans.name: Babaeva

texts.ru:
Z. Babaeva is 35 years old, married and has 3 children. She has a professional high school degree. For the last 2 years she has been selling children's clothes. She started her business after she got married, since her husband went to find work in Russia due to high unemployment in Tajikistan. Now she is the main provider of her family and is busily selling and purchasing goods to keep her business running and to feed her children and her husband's parents. In the future she is planning to travel herself to purchase clothes wholesale and become a wholesale clothing distributor instead of a market vendor.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Бабаева Замира – 35 лет .Имеет мужа и троих детей. Образование средне специальное. Занимается продажей детской одежды вот уже 2 года. Начала заниматься этой деятельностью после замужества, так как ее муж из за безработицы уехал в РФ на заработки. Теперь она как опора и поддержка семьи не смотря на любую погоду занимается куплей и продажей чтобы прокормить и свою семью и родителей мужа. А в будущем планирует ехать за товаром сама и перейти на оптовую продажу одежды.

loans.use: Expanding inventory

loans.name: Aleksandra

texts.en: Aleksandra was  born in 1984  and she  is not  married.  She lives with her family in East Sarajevo. She is a student and she receives a monthly stipend of 100 KM. This is her first loan, and it is for 1200 KM. Aleksandra will use it to buy additional clothes for her boutique where she works. She wishes to expand the business and open her own boutique because she wants to be independent.

loans.use: To buy clothes for the boutique.

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en: Mrs. Vuthy S. is rice farmer and Khmer noodle seller in Kork Sandek Village in Kampong Speu Province. Mrs. Vuthy S. needs to buy a cow so that she can plough her field and this is way she has asked for a loan. Mrs. Vuthy S. is married with two children, one of whom is enrolled in school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mon Thaov, is a subsistence farmer. Previously, Mrs. Vuthy S. obtained a loan to purchase fertilizers and rice seeds for her plantation. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy cows in order to plough her rice field.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest a blender and raw materials for a small cafeteria.

loans.name: Thun

texts.en:
Thun P., 37, lives in Kampong Cham with her husband, Eam Koy, and their five children. She works out in the fields, growing rice and vegetables for US $1 each day, while her husband works in construction, making US $2.50 each day. Two of their children are employed, and one is still a student.

All of the children are still living in the home and dependent upon their parents’ income. Thun P. has asked for a loan of US $600 to purchase a motorbike to transport crops to sell at the market. Current public transportation costs have risen rapidly along with gasoline prices and she feels that she can cut down on some unnecessary expenses through this purchase.

With her extra savings, in the future, she would like to raise pigs.

loans.use: Purchase motorbike to transport crops

loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarorn M. is a widow with seven children: four daughters and three sons. One of her children is married and lives outside the family home. Three of her children are garment factory workers and two other children study in a local school. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sarorn M. has been farming for many years. She grows tomatoes and bananas near her house. Besides farming, she also sells porridge in the morning in front of her house. However, the main income of the family is from her children who work in a garment factory.

Sarorn M. is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase materials to repair some parts of her house.

loans.use: To repair some parts of her house.

loans.name: Dominica

texts.es:
Dominica es una mujer de 40 años, vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos.  Desde que se casó se ha dedicado a la crianza de animales, ahora al cuidado y crianza de sus vaquitas, a las cuales trata de mejorar su raza, por ello se dedica en ellas durante todas las mañanas, las alimentan y les brinda lo necesario para su salud, ya que tienden a enfermarse, pero gracias a los medicamentos o vacunas que brindan las municipalidades, puede estar  aliviada.Sin embargo, el cariño que les tiene hace que el alimentarlas sea lo que más le agrade, para ello tiene que dedicarse al cultivo de maíz, porque son las yerbas de éste las que más alimentan a sus  animales, además que obtiene maíz para su consumo diario.
Dominica tiene en su familia a sus mayores motivadores para su trabajo y el bienestar de estos es su prioridad.
Invertirá el dinero que pide en la compra de un becerrito que pueda criar, y  desea que en un futuro cercano inicie la crianza de animales de mejor raza.
texts.en:
Dominica is 40 years old, lives with her husband and 6 children. Since she got married she has worked rising animals and currently she is rising little cows, and she is trying to improve their breed, so she works with them all morning, she feeds them and gives them everything they need to keep them healthy, because they get sick very easily, but thanks to all the medicine and vaccines supplied by municipalities, she is relieved. What she likes the most is to feed them, so she has to cultivate corn, which is what they eat and she also cultivates for her own consumption. Dominica’s greatest motivation is her family and they well being. She will invest the money to buy a young cow to rise and wants in a near future to rise animals of a better breed.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a young cow to increase the quantity of her livestock

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Trần Thị Xuân 51 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2001. Chồng mất sớm hiện tại chị đang sống một mình, tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn chị đã đầu tư vốn vào chăn nuôi, các vòng vốn vay đều được chị đầu tư hiệu quả, mô hình chăn nuôi của chị đã lớn hơn. Hiện tại chị đang nuôi 20 con lợn chuẩn bị xuất chuồng. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn.
Thu nhập bình quân. 4.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Ms. Tran Thi X., 51 year of age, has been a part of this organization since 2001. She became a widow after losing her husband at an early age. After taking a part of this organization, she was able to borrow a small amount to invest into raising livestock. Each loans she previously received was invested with a lot of success; expanding her farm each time. Presently, she is raising 20 hogs and hope to invest more into her business. She is requesting a loan amount of 10.000.000vnd. Her monthly income is 4.000.000vnd/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pigs

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.en:
Mavzuna is not married yet and lives with her parents. She has a small cattle ranch. She raises cattle and then sells them at the market, and at the same time she provides her family with milk products. Her father also helps her out because it is hard work to look after them. Mavzuna buys cattle almost every week. After fattening them for a month, she sells them.

With the help of loan, she plans to increase her livestock and construct a comfortable winter cow-shed for her cattle.

loans.use: Increase livestock and construct a winter cow-shed

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 21 años, convive con su pareja y tiene  tres hijos. Ella es agricultora, actividad a la que se dedica por 4 años desde que tuvo su familia, dentro de su trabajo, lo que le agrada realizar es la selección de las frutas para su venta posterior. Lo rentable es que a su comunidad  concurren grandes comerciantes que demandan grandes cantidades de fruta. Lo difícil es encontrar  el mejor postor que le ayude a tener las ganancias justas. Esta en su cuarto préstamo con MFP, y no tiene  moras, ni retrasos de pagos. María  tiene pensado invertir 1000 soles en la compra de plantas de cítricos de  diversas variedades, y sobre todo en los abonos que  necesita  para sus terrenos.
texts.en:
María is 21 years old, lives with her partner and has three children. She is a farmer and has done that work for four years since she has had a family. What she likes about her work is making the selection of fruits to then sell. It is profitable because in her community there are large buyers that compete for large amounts of fruit. The difficult part is finding the highest bidder that allows her to make earnings that are fair. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she has had no delays or gotten behind in her payments. María is thinking to invest 1,000 soles in a wide variety of citric plans and above all, in the fertilizer she needs for her land.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase citric plans and fertilizer

loans.name: Savaing

texts.en: Mr. Savaing M. lives in Ta Sen village in Kampong Cham province. He is a motorbike taxi driver who can make a small income to support the family. His wife, Mrs. Khat Eng, is a pig breeder. Since her pigs are bigger and bigger, she does not have enough money to support them. Thus, Mr. Savaing M. decided to request a loan to purchase pig food and he would use the rest of money to buy more piglets for breeding. He hopes to increase his income and improve the living conditions with this loan after he sells his pigs. He is 54 years old and the father of six children, one of whom is a construction worker while another is a teacher in the local school. One stays at home to do housework while the others are enrolled in the local school. His wife is also presented with him in the picture.

loans.use: To request a loan to purchase pig food and use the rest of money to buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Mr Abra B. est né en 1967 à Afagnan. Elle est mariée et mère de sept (07) enfants. Issue d’une famille de commerçantes, elle s’est vite lancée la préparation et la vente de l’huile de palme. Avec son courage et son dynamisme et surtout la qualité de son huile, elle a réussi à s’imposer dans son milieu drainant derrière elle une importante clientèle. En vue de lui permettre de constituer un stock important de matières premières entrant dans la préparation de l’huile (noix de palme), elle sollicite un financement. Cela lui permettra de vendre les stocks en période de pénurie pour dégager de bons bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mrs. Abra B. was born in 1967 in Afagnan. She is a married mother of seven. Having come from a family of traders, she quickly took to preparing and selling palm oil. With her courage, energy, and especially the quality of her oil, she has succeeded in establishing herself in her environment with a large following clientele. In order to allow her to build up a sizable stock of necessary materials for making the oil (palm nuts), she is seeking a loan. This will allow her to sell the stock in times of shortage to earn some nice profits.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To prepare and sell palm oil

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reyna Isabel Díaz B. tiene 28 años, está soltera, y tiene un hijo de tres años de edad. El propósito que Doña Reyna tiene para su negocio es construir un establecimiento en donde pueda comercializar su comida. El tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de diez años. Doña Reyna dio inicio a esta actividad por que su hermano logró prestarle dinero y comenzó establecerse una mesa en la afueras de su vivienda. Reyna Isabel ofrece los productos como gallo pinto, huevo, maduro y queso frito, y más tarde decide realizar un financiamiento para invertir en su negocio. Sus deseos para el futuro son mejorar su nivel de vida para que su familia no se necesidades. Ella necesita C$ 4.000 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Reyna Isabel Díaz B. is a 28-year-old single mother with a 3-year-old son. Ms. Reyna is planning to build a business space in which she can sell her meals. She has been running this business for 10 years. Ms. Reyna started the business because her brother managed to lend her money, so she set up a table outside her home to sell food. Reyna Isabel offers dishes like gallo pinto (a Nicaraguan dish that consists of rice and red beans), eggs, fried plantains, and fried cheese. She later decided to seek a loan in order to invest it in her business. Her goal for the future is to raise her standard of living so that her family will not lack anything. She needs a loan of C$ 4,000.00 Nicaraguan Cordobas, which will be repaid in 12 monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary sells second hand shoes and clothes. She also rents out VCD'S to her customers. She would like to make a loan for N150, 000 to purchase more second hand shoes and clothes to sell. She hopes to expand this business. She is 28 years old and married with 2 children. She says thanks to kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Susana Tatiana

texts.es:
