SUSANA TATIANA C. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Éxito” con domicilio en el Jr. Inmaculada N° 287 del distrito de Callería, tiene 40 años, 03 hijos a su cargo, y su cónyuge tiene trabajo independiente.

Inicio su negocio en el rubro de repostería, y con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles,  compró insumos necesarios para preparar tortas para toda ocasión, este negocio le da tiempo para atender a su familia tranquilamente.

Actualmente ella, está implementando una Fuente de Soda en su propio domicilio, por lo que el préstamo de S/.3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en los pisos, techo, separaciones, vitrinas, conservadora e insumos para su local, también está mandando a diseñar e imprimir sus propagandas, debido al buen carácter que muestra a sus clientes, está segura que el negocio ha de salirle muy bien.

Dice que Manuela Ramos es una ONG que da ayuda a las mujeres, aunque estos sean limitados, son los necesarios para seguir adelante y están al alcance de los pagos.
texts.en:
Susana Tatiana C. C. is a member of the “Mujeres de Éxito” (“Successful Women”) Community Bank and lives at 287 Inmaculada Lane in the Callería district. She is 40 years old, has three children, and her husband is self-employed.

Susana started a baking business and with her first loan, for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles, she purchased the supplies necessary to prepare cakes for all occasions. This business leaves her enough time to take care of her children.

Currently, Susana is building a soda fountain in her home. She will invest this loan for 3,000 nuevos soles in new floors and a roof, as well as display cases, a cooler, and other supplies for her shop. She will also design and print advertisements. Because of her good nature and relationship with her customers, Susana is sure that her business will be successful.

Susana says that Manuela Ramos is an organization that helps women, even if they are have limited resources. They do what is necessary to get ahead and stay on top of their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new floors, a roof, display cases, a cooler, and other supplies for her shop.

loans.name: Valeriu

texts.en:
Valeriu is a farmer. He has been working in agriculture since 1990. Valeriu's grandfather was also a farmer and he learned many things from him.

Valeriu has three children, who are still students and they all want to achieve higher education. For this their father is ready to do everything. He decided to start up a business growing plums all year. For this business, Valeriu needs money to build greenhouses at his home to launch this business. He would like to borrow from Microinvest to buy wood and film.

loans.use: To buy wood and film.

loans.name: Diélika

texts.fr:
Diélika T.  a 47 ans, mariée et  mère d’un garçon. Elle réside avec son époux, sa coépouse et leurs enfants à Sanoubougou I (Kapel Kourou), un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école, elle s’est initiée à l’activité d’achat et de  vente des légumes et tubercules (pomme de terre et igname) il y a plus de dix  ans. Elle mène son activité au niveau du marché des fruits et  légumes au pied de la colline Mamelon non loin du grand marché de Sikasso.
 Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant sept ans. Après plusieurs prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son 6ème prêt individuel et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 30 sacs de pomme de terre et 15 sacs d’igname. Elle achète ses marchandises en gros sur place auprès des  agriculteurs venant à la foire,  avant de les revendre en détail aux  non résidents  et aux forains.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 250 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Diélika T., age 47, is married and the mother of a boy. She resides with her husband, co-wife, and their children in Sanoubougou I (Kapel Kourou), an outlying district of Sikasso City (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having had the chance to continue in school, she got introduced to the business of buying and selling vegetables and tubers (potatoes and yams) over ten years ago. She operates at the produce market located at the foot of Mamelon hill, not far from the grand market of Sikasso.

Concerned about doing better in satisfying her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso seven years ago. After several solidarity loans (group loans) with a women's association in her area, she is now on her sixth individual loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid.

She intends to use this loan to buy thirty sacks of potatoes and fifteen sacks of yams. She purchases her merchandise wholesale locally from growers coming to the fair. And then she resells it retail to non-residents and to fair vendors.

With this loan, she envisions realizing a monthly profit of 250,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to augment her working capital, to help cover family expenses, to make loan interest payments, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tubers (potatoes, yams)

loans.name: Marice

texts.en: Marice P. owns a small grocery store in Cabacungan, Claveria Misamis Oriental. She is married and lives happily with her husband and two children. Her husband makes a living driving a motorcycle. Marice believes that she does not have enough money to support her children, and has decided to begin growing cassava on her family's land to increase her income. She needs financial help to start this business, and has applied for a loan from Kiva partner HSPFI to make this possible. She has already taken out and successfully repaid two loans from our organization, and wants us to mention how helpful it would be to secure this third loan.

loans.use: To establish a cassava farm and incease the inventory of a grocery store

loans.name: Elizabeth Noemi

texts.es: Elizabeth Noemí Ojeada G. tiene la edad de 24 años. Es una mujer casada y tiene 1 hijo y todavía no asiste a una escuela. La actividad económica es la pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Comenzó con esfuerzo propio vendiendo mercadería en general como ropa, calzado, perfumes pero debido a la circunstancias tenia que como cuidar a su hijo fue que decidió establecer una pulpería en su vivienda. Elizabeth tiene muchas esperanzas de salir adelante con su negocio y lo ha logrado. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos naturales y gaseosas. Su deseo es que su hijo logre tener una vida digna y que nunca le falte el alimento diario.
texts.en:
Elizabeth Noemi G. is a 24 year old married woman with one child who does not attend school yet. She runs a grocery shop at her home and has been in this business for the last 5 years. She started the business with her own efforts, selling general merchandise such as clothes, shoes and perfumes. Since she had to take care of her child, she decided to establish a grocery shop at her home. Elizabeth has high expectations and wants to keep the business growing.

The loan requested is for working capital, the purchase of basic grains, candies, soft drinks and natural sodas. She hopes that her son can have a dignified life and that he will never miss a day with out food.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Amor Y Seriedad 2 Group

texts.en:
These five micro-entrepreneurs live in a small community insiD. La Romana called Batey Magdalena. In order to purchase their inventory, they must travel to the main city of La Romana, which means a long trip by bus or motorcycle. This is why they try to go when they have enough money to buy in bulk, or enough orders. 

Milagros G. is this group's coordinator. She is married to Juan Yan and they have 2 children aged 8 and 2. Milagros sells clothing and accessories. So far, the best system she has found is to take orders of specific items and delivers the products to her customers, who then pay. This way she avoids purchasing merchandise she might not sell. Milagros has been able to create a faithful clientele that effectively employ her as their personal shopper: they ask her for a certain item, and she purchases it to resell to them. 

Milagros would love to have her own house someday; she thinks it would improve her life greatly and she could use the extra money she now uses to pay rent.

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes and bedding, pre-ordered by her customers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
Mary C. Núñez es una señora de 50 años de edad, vecina de  una comunidad  rural de Costa Rica situada 45 kilómetros al sur de San José llamada San Cristóbal Norte. San Cristóbal es una zona un poco montañosa donde se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, agricultura de hortalizas, café y otros, artesanía, ganadería y muchas otras actividades. Doña Mary vive con su esposo y con sus dos hijos. 

Desde hace 15 años que doña Mary inició un negocio de confección de ropa, mayormente confeccionando prendas de lana. Ella elabora diferentes tipos de prendas de vestir que luego vende en negocios de la comunidad y sus alrededores o incluso la llegan a buscarla a su casa. Su microempresa ha ayudado a que la condición de vida de su familia haya mejorado considerablemente. Dice que el poder brindar un buen servicio a las personas y cumplir con sus exigencias, son la base del éxito del negocio.

Actualmente doña Mary requiere un préstamo de ¢200.000 (doscientos mil colones) para comprar una máquina especial para coser y materiales como telas, hilos, etc. Con esta inversión espera poder incrementar su producción y mejorar la calidad de los  productos. Afirma que gracias a este préstamo podrá atraer a más clientes, ofrecer mejores alternativas y mejorar considerablemente la calidad de sus productos.

Doña Mary es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN), una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Ha recibido 20 microcréditos y los ha cancelado responsablemente.
texts.en:
Mary C. Núñez is a 50 year old woman. She is a resident of the Costa Rican rural community of San Cristóbal Norte, located 45 kilometers south of San José. San Cristóbal is a slightly mountainous area where you will find different types of businesses such as vegetable farms, coffee plantations, arts & crafts, livestock farms and more. Doña Mary lives with her husband and their two children.

For 15 years, Doña Mary has been in the tailoring business, making primarily woolen garments. She sews different types of clothing and then sells them to businesses in the community and the surrounding areas. Some pieces are even sold from her home. Her microbusiness has helped improve her family’s living conditions considerably. She says her business is successful because of her ability to provide good service to everyone and meet their demands.

Doña Mary now requires a loan of 200,000 colones ($350 USD) to buy a special sewing machine and materials such as fabrics, threads, etc. With this investment, she expects to increase production and improve output quality. She claims that through this loan she will attract more customers, offering better choices and high-quality products.

Doña Mary is a member of the Community Credit Corporation of San Cristobal Norte (SACRIN), one of the 100 partner organizations affiliated with EDESA in Costa Rica. She has received 20 microloans and paid them all responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine & materials

loans.name: Eloina

texts.es: Eloina cuenta con 41 años de edad. Tiene 2 hijos y su esposo es empleado de una lechería. Cuenta con casa propia dotada de todos los servicios básicos. Se dedica a la venta de comidas los fines de semana y adicionalmente cuenta con una pequeña venta de abarrotes en su domicilio y su esposo trabaja como encargado en una lechería. Su venta esta medianamente surtida, bien ubicada y con bastante afluencia de clientes, donde la competencia no le afecta porque es la única en la zona. El destino del crédito es para la compra de mercadería de abarrotes para su tienda.  Ellos son clientes desde el año 2007 con tres créditos en la institución con pagos puntuales.
texts.en:
Eloina is 41 years old. She has two children, and her husband is employed by a dairy. She has her own house, which has all the basic services. She sells food on weekends, and also runs a small grocery store in her home, while her husband works at the dairy. Her store is moderately stocked, well-located and has enough customers; she does not have competition because her store is the only one in the area. The purpose of this loan is to buy merchandise for her store. She has been a client since 2007, and has had three loans with this institution and has paid them punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock a grocery store

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a member of the Kajificheni borrower group in Ilala,iringa,she is 35 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child,Her child is aged 21 years.

Joyce started her own grocery business 8 years ago,she works 12 hours and earn monthly profit approximately 30,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Joyce first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 400,000 Tsh in order to buy more beer and soda.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Joyce hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more beer,soda

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 19-year-old man who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon. Mouhamad has owned a bakery for two years. He uses a “saj” oven to make bread and “mankoucheh”. A “saj” is a metal oven, a traditional Lebanese cooking dome, used to make Markouk (“thinned”) bread and doughy confections or Mankoucheh. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza, most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. 

Mouhamad requests a loan of $1,500 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw material for his bakery. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan. Mouhamad is works hard to treat his clients well and to make good mankoucheh. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he rented a bakery, but now he has his own. He developed this business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase raw material for his bakery.

loans.name: Dominga Leila

texts.es:
La señora Dominga S. es propietaria de su propio tramo en el Mercado central de León donde oferta los productos comestibles como galletas, pan, caramelos, salsas, entre otros productos.

Ella se ha destacado por ser una mujer muy trabajadora que a diario se preocupa por llevar a cabo su actividad. Hoy en día espera en que Ceprodel le brinde un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la mercadería y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Dominga S. is the proprietor of her own stall in the central market of León where she offers edible products such as biscuits, bread, sweets, and salsas, among others. She has distinguished herself by being a very hardworking woman who dedicates herself daily to carrying out her business. Currently, she hopes that Ceprodel offers her a loan so that she can invest it in the purchase of inventory and in this way improve the conditions of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en: Mrs. Sarin V. is a farmer in Mea Neak village in Takeo province. She owns 9-hectar for cultivating rice. In her farming, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy rice seeds to cultivate rice so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice seeds for her purpose and she would use the rest of the loan to a pump in order to water her rice crop. Her husband, Mr. Ngaet Ly, helps her in the farming. Mrs. Sarin V. is 44 years old and the mother of three children one of whom sells café in the local village while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is shown with her on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more rice seeds for cultivating.

loans.name: Bibi Sharefa Group

texts.en: Bibi Sharefa is the group leader of Bibi Sharefa group. There are three members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan to progress their business and make it larger. So they are requesting a group of loan 30000 Afghani. Bibi Sharefa wants to take a loan for the business of bead working. Leela wants to take a loan for the business of tailoring. Hanifa wants to take a loan for the business of carpet weaving. So they thank AFS and Kiva lenders who can support all entrepreneurs around the world.

loans.use: To buy bead working materials

loans.name: Leilita

texts.en:
Leilita E. is from the village of Colonia in Valencia City. She is 37 years old. Leilita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Leilita sells snacks and other delicacies, such as fruit salad, banana cake, and cassava cake in the local community. Leilita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Leilita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leilita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP that she will use to purchase the raw ingredients that she needs to make products to sell. This will be Leilita's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make snacks

loans.name: Vinadel

texts.en: Vinadel C.  is 36 years old and married. She has five children; her oldest is seventeen years old. She is a rice farmer. Vinadel joined CEVI in September 2008. The growth of her farm has been because of the financial support she has received. Now she is requesting a loan of Php11, 000. Vinadel will use this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies that she lacks. She hopes that this loan will help her in achieving her goal of expanding her business.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Dawa

texts.en:
Dawa P. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread in her restaurant and is requesting a loan to buy more bags of sugar, powdered milk etc to make more tea to sell.

Dawa is 37 years old and is married to a businessman. She has eight children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan she hopes to be able to open a retail shop.


About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, powdered milk etc to make more tea to sell

loans.name: Guadalupe Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Guadalupe  tiene 37 años de edad, procreo dos hijos, los cuales cursan el colegio, su esposo es jubilado, y de mucho apoyo, su pequeña casa es humilde de tabla y ya muy vieja por falta de dinero no ha logrado hacerla de concreto, por gracias a Dios esta trabajando como enfermera profesional desde hace catorce años,  aunque han sido muchas las limitaciones económica para su familia logro terminar su secundaria. Cuando inicio lo hizo como aseadora hospitalaria  y luego la ascendieron por que estaba pasando un curso, el cual fue una gran alegría poder trabajar en lo que le gusta y por que sus ingresos serian mejores. Con este financiamiento comprara piedra, arena, cemento para comenzar a construir una pequeña cocina  el cual es de mucha necesidad. Sus planes es poder terminar su carrera de medicina aunque es una carrera muy alta de costo es por eso muchos estudiantes no conseguimos terminar por falta de recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Doña Guadalupe is 37 years old and procreated two children who are in college. Her husband is retired and with much support, her small house is humble and already very old for lack of money. It hasn’t been made with concrete. Thanks to God, she has been working as a professional nurse for 14 years although there have been many economic problems to attain her secondary education.

When she started she worked as a hospital assistant and just advanced because she was passing a course. This was a big achievement that she can now work in what she likes and her income will be better. With this financing, she will buy rock, sand and cement to begin constructing a small kitchen which is much needed. Her plans are that she can finish her medical career although this is a costly career and it is for this reason that many students don’t finish their studies due to economic reasons.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rocks, sand, cement to build a small kitchen

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia M. de 57 años, vive en una casa de cemento ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, es madre soltera con 2 hijos ya mayores de edad y 1 hijo menor de edad.

Natalia inicio el negocio de la tienda hace 4 años atrás porque le gustaba la idea de vender productos alimenticios y tenia que buscar la manera de tener un ingreso para sus hijos. Ahora ella trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta las 22h00 todos los días vendiendo legumbres, carnes, bebidas, arroz etc. Una de las mayores complicaciones es cuando se forman los grupos de personas que les gusta beber alcohol y tiene problemas afuera de su casa.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar carnes, legumbres, arroz, para agrandar más el negocio. En el futuro quiere ver su tienda como la mejor del sector y poder sacar una sucursal.
texts.en:
57-year old Natalia M. lives in a cement house located in Paraíso de Guayaquil. She is a single mother with two grownup children and a younger son. Natalia opened her store four years ago because she liked the idea of selling groceries and she had to find a way to support her children. Now she works from 6 in the morning to 10 at night every day selling vegetables, meat, drinks, rice etc. A big difficulty she encounters is when groups of people who like to drink alcohol gather outside her house and cause problems. With the loan she wants to buy meat, vegetables, and rice to expand her stock. In the future she would like to see her store as the best in the area and be able to open another store.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, drinks

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna O., 56 years old, is a rice grower. She has a small rice field which she has maintained for many years now to ensure a good supply of food for her family. Currently she is happy with the status of her business. It’s growing and improving every year. Now she needs a small amount of money to buy farm supplies and fertilizers. She would like a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She chose CEVI because it provides – not just loans – but insurance coverage as well to all its clients.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Legioncito.
Vilma es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo, Vilma viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza 2 veces por semana, además vende ropa a pedido.
Vilma necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa.
Los sueños de Vilma son tener una tienda en su casa y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the Legioncito communal bank. Vilma lives with her life partner, is 24 years old, and has one son. She travels to the various regional markets twice a week where whe sells assorted merchandise; she also sells based on prior orders. Vilma needs a 1500 sol loan to buy clothing. Vilma's dream is to have a store in her home and to have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Niètaga Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Niètaga sont toutes mariées. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles au quartier Dioni de la ville de Konobougou, préfecture de Baouréli, quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce d’articles divers tels l’achat vente de condiments alimentaires, de céréales, des savons, des pommes de terre, du poisson séché etc.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les 4 prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe Niètaga sont à leur  5 prêt solidaire.
Elles comptent utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour acheter, trois tonnes de céréales (haricot mil, maïs, fonio) et des colis  de condiments alimentaires. 
Elles s’approvisionnent essentiellement sur place auprès des producteurs et grossistes et effectuent leurs ventes à Dioni et au marché de Konobougou, généralement au comptant, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 17.500FCFA qui servira à étoffer leur fonds de commerce et subvenir aux dépenses ayant trait à la nourriture, à la scolarité des enfants et à la santé.
texts.en:
All ten women from the Niètaga group are married. On average they are 35 years of age with three children, and all live in traditional households in the Dioni neighborhood of Konobougou, in the Baouréli prefecture of the 4th administrative region of Mali. These women got to know each other through family ties and are retailers of various goods, such as food condiments, cereals, soap, potatoes, dried fish, etc. Having fully repaid their four previous loans, the women from the Niètaga group are now requesting a fifth group loan. They intend to use it to buy three tons of cereal (beans, millet, corn, fonio), and packages of food condiments. They mainly get their supplies from local producers. They then sell their products in Dioni and at the Konobougou market, in general for cash, to a customer base of both women and men. They hope to achieve average monthly earnings of 17,500 FCFA each, which will be used to bolster their working capital and contribute to family expenses regarding food, children’s education and healthcare.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various goods

loans.name: Matal United Group

texts.en: Amie L. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs from the township of Magburaka, northern Sierra Leone. Amie L. sells locally produced items like palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), cassava roots, and ground-nuts/peanuts. She also sells clothes. She has been a businesswoman for 15 years now. 36-year-old Amie was born in Matal village; she is married to a worker at the Ministry of Agriculture and they have 7 children. With her share of this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy local produce like palm oil and clothes to expand her business

loans.name: Rhina Maribel

texts.es: Rhina Maribel C. D. M. D. 45 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. La paz, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos D. 21, 19 y 14 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. La señora Rhina posee una panadería, en la cual se dedica a trabajar desD. hace 16 años atras, es por esta razón que ella es muy conocida en la zona ya que siempre ha sido una mujer muy trabajadora la cual entrega todos los pedidos a tiempo y que cuenta con muy buenos estándares D. calidad. En muchas ocasiones sus hijos le ayudan a repartir el pan por los diferentes lugares en donD. posee clientes fijos. Rhina solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar harina, manteca, miel, azúcar y otros ingredientes más, los cuales son necesarios para la elaboración del pan. Rhina trabaja arduamente día con día para poder brindarles todo lo mejor a sus hijos, y así también poder mejorar el negocio, el cual ha sido muy rentable para ella.
texts.en:
Rhina Maribel C. D. M. is 45 years old and lives in the department of La Paz, where she lives together with her husband and three children who are 21, 19, and 14 years old, and are all students. Rhina owns a bakery, where she has been working for the past 16 years. It is for this reason that she is very well-known in the area, since she has always been a very hardworking woman who completes orders on time and has very good standards of quality. Many times, her children help her to deliver the bread in the different places where she has regular clients. Rhina is requesting a loan through which she can purchase flour, butter, honey, sugar and other ingredients necessary for making bread. Rhina works hard day after day to be able to proviD. all the best to her children and improve the business, which has been very profitable for her.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw material for making bread

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.es: Cecilio es casado con Teresa con quien tiene cuatro hijos de 9, 11, 13 y 15 años de edad respectivamente. Cecilio se dedica a prestar sus servicios como maestro albañil y constructor, la conyugue, Teresa, vende desayunos en su carrito de manera ambulante. Ambos cuentan  con muchos años de experiencia en cada uno de sus rubros por lo que también cuentan con el reconocimiento de sus clientes fijos. La competencia es alta, pero la antigüedad y la experiencia, les ha permitido ser requeridos constantemente por los servicios que prestan. Con el crédito  Cecilio renovara sus herramientas de trabajo para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio y por consecuencia para ganar mayor clientela. Este es el cuarto crédito al que accede la Cecilio en nuestra institución. Cecilio siempre demostró excelente cumplimiento de pago en sus créditos anteriores, por otra parte no tiene otras deudas en el sistema financiero.
texts.en:
Cecilio is married to Teresa with whom he has 4 children, ages 9, 11, 13, and 15 respectively. Cecilio works as a master mason and builder, and his wife, Teresa, sells breakfasts from her little mobile cart. Both can count on many years of experience in their fields, as well as on their recognition by a fixed set of customers. The competition is high, but their years of experience has allowed them to be constantly in demand for the services they offer. With this loan, Cecilio will replace his work tools and be able to offer better service and, as a consequence, gain a larger clientele. This is his 4th loan from our institution. Cecilio has always demonstrated excellent compliance in paying off his previous loans, and moreover, he has no other financial debts.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING NEW MASONRY WORK TOOLS

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia C. de 57 años de edad, reside en Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a dos hijas, un yerno y dos nietos. Celia posee un comedor frente al cementerio municipal de su localidad, sitio muy frecuentado por visitantes y en donde hay empleados de varias oficinas de los alrededores. Ahí se encarga Celia de elaborar deliciosos desayunos y almuerzos, con la inigualable sazón casera que la caracteriza y por la cual la vuelven la predilecta para  muchos de sus clientes, por esto mismo se ha vuelto muy conocida en la zona teniendo muchos años de trabajar de esta manera. Celia es una persona bondadosa y positiva. En varias ocasiones sus clientes frecuentes, la buscan hasta el fin de mes para cancelar lo consumido, quedándose en ocasiones, sin materia prima, para poder preparar comida que solicitan nuevos clientes. Ahora con el objeto de ampliar su clientela, Celia, pide un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero que se requiere para la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de más desayunos y almuerzos, como frutas y verduras, sazonadores, carnes, entre otras cosas, y así también contar con mayores ganancias. Celia ha sido excelentemente referenciada por sus clientes y vecinos del lugar como muy responsable.
texts.en:
Celia, 57 years old, lives in Santa Tecla, Department of La Libertad. She lives with her 2 daughters, a son-in-law, and 2 grandchildren. Celia has a restaurant in front of the local municipal cemetery, a place much frequented by visitors and where there are employees from various offices in the surrounding areas. Here Celia makes delicious breakfasts and lunches with the unparalleled home-style flavor that characterizes her efforts and brings many of her customers back. For this reason, she has become well known in the zone, having worked at this for many years. Celia is a kind and positive person. On various occasions, her frequent customers ask to wait until the end of the month to pay their bills, leaving her, often, without funds to buy primary materials to prepare the meals new customers request. Now, to expand her clientèle, Celia requests a loan that will provide money to buy ingredients needed to prepare her breakfasts and lunches, including fruits and vegetables, seasonings, and meat, among other things, thereby increasing her earnings. Celia has received excellent references from her clients and neighbors as very responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING NECESSARY INGREDIENTS TO PREPARE THE MEALS SHE SELLS

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma B. is from the village of Alimannao, Peñablanca, Cagayan. She is 53 years old. Erma is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Erma owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Erma has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 4200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Erma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Erma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. Erma is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Erma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to stock a general store

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: Rosalina de 54 años, vive con su esposo. Desde hace 15 años, se dedica a su pulpería  y siempre ha tratado que su negocio este bien implementado con los productos comestibles necesarios para satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes. Su tienda es muy concurrida con gran cantidad de clientes, además Rosalina se esfuerza mucho por brindar una buena atención, para que las personas regresen en cualquier momento por el buen trato que les brinda. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque le da la disponibilidad de tiempo que necesita para realizar las labores de su hogar. Su deseo es tener una pulpería suficiente grande. El financiamiento es para comprar golosinas, pan, jugos, gaseosas, galletas, detergentes y jabón.
texts.en:
Rosalina, 54 years of age, lives with her husband. For more than 15 years, she has dedicated herself to her general store. She has always tried to have a business that is well supplied with the products needed to satisfy customer demand. Her store is very busy with a great number of customers. In addition, Rosalina puts a great effort in to provide a high level of attention so that customers will return often due to the great degree of care she gives them. She enjoys her work very much because it still allows her the time to tend to her home. Her wish is to have a sufficiently large store. The loan is for the purchase of sweets, bread, juices, sodas, cookies, detergents and soap.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles polygames à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passés ont été bien  remboursés 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  condiments alimentaires (tels la pâte d’arachide avec KADIA S.), de l’habillement, des céréales et de la restauration.
KADIA S. compte acheter avec son  prêt, 5 sacs d’arachide pour la fabrication de la pâte d’arachide.
Elle s’approvisionne  en arachide au grand marché et  dans les villages avoisinants. La pâte d’arachide est vendue au  marché de Hamdallaye et en famille à une clientèle composée de femmes, au comptant et  souvent à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 28.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  dans les dépenses de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The members of the BENKADI group are married women who, on average, are 39-years old and have 4 children. They live in polygamous families in HAMDALLAYE, a neighborhood of the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali). This is their fifth collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance organization to meet their customers’ needs. Past loans were repaid without incident. The group sells condiments (such as peanut paste by KADIA S.), clothing and cereals, and also provides food services. With her loan, KADIA S. plans to purchase 5 bags of peanuts to make peanut paste. She gets her peanut stocks at the main market and in surrounding villages. The peanut paste is sold for cash or often on credit at the Hamdallaye market and to the families, to a customer base consisting of women. She hopes to achieve an average monthly profit of 28.500 francs CFA, a portion of which to be used for the family’s expenses and the remaining portion to be invested in her commercial activities. Her goal is to increase her sales so as to better serve her clientele.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of peanuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of construction materials such as  stone, cement, sand, and concrete blocks.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
El Sr. Alfonso T. tiene 64 años de edad, esta en pareja y tiene hijos ya mayores e independientes.
El Sr. T. es propietario de una gomería hace más de 20 años, es una profesión que ya heredó de su padre.
Su actividad de servicios abarca a diferentes tipos de vehículos y su especialidad es en los camiones tipo Scania.
Su sueño es ampliar el salón donde recibe a sus clientes ya que parte de su infraestructura lo perdió en un incendio hace unos años atrás.
Solicita el crédito para la compray y  aumentar su stock de mercaderías en cuanto a cubiertas.
texts.en:
Sr. Alfonso T. is 64 years old, married, and has adult children who are independent. He is the owner of a tire repair shop that has been in operation for more than 20 years. Alfonso learned the profession from his father.

He provides replacement services for different types of vehicles, but his specialty is Scania commercial trucks. Alfonso hopes to expand the waiting room where he receives his customers since part of the infrastructure was damaged by a fire that occurred a few years ago.

He is requesting a loan to buy more tires so that he can increase his inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires in different sizes

loans.name: Cléber Eduardo

texts.es:
Cléber Eduardo P. S. tiene 28 anos. Vive en union libre en el canton de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 3 hijos de 8, 6, y 1 ano. 

Cléber es un socio de la ventanilla rural San Eraneiseo de Sibimbe. Son 13 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.  

Cléber se dedica a la agricultura. Solicita el credito para un chanchero. Con el apoyo del credito puede seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Cléber Eduardo P. S. is 28 years old. He is in a common-law marriage, and he lives in the Ventanas canton, Los Rios province. He has three children; ages 8, 6, and 1. Cléber is a member of the Eraneiseo de Sibimbe Communal Bank. There are 13 members in all, and most of them are farmers. Cléber is a farmer. He is requesting a loan for his pig farm. With the help of the loan he will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For his pig farm

loans.name: Borey

texts.en: Mrs. Borey B. lives in Samchat village in Takeo province and she is 34 years old. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice on to support her family, and she is also a clothes seller who sells a lot of clothes to earn a large profit to support her family. Since her clothes sales are going well, she wants to expand. So to improve her current business, Mrs. Borey B. is asking for a loan to buy more clothes to resell. She is a widow who does not have any children and she lives in a three-member household.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Llinset Del Carmen

texts.es:
Linsset es madre de dos hijos, dedicada al trabajo, casada, hoy en día labora como responsable de compra en una distribuidora, siendo su esposo contador.
Su meta a largo plazo ha sido la construcción de su vivienda, pues poco a poco han ido construyendo toda la casa de concreto. Siendo Afodenic una puerta de financiamiento para lograr esta mejora, este es su quinto ciclo el cual comprara materiales de construcción para cerrar el techo y puertas para poder pasarse. Comprara: doce laminas de zinc, diez perlines, cuatro láminas de zinc lisa, tubos, así como comprar las puertas  y ventana y cerrar completamente su casa.
texts.en:
Linsset is the mother of two children. She is married and devoted to work. She works as a Buyer for a distributor and her husband is an Accountant. Her long term goal has been the construction of her house since it has been built of concrete bit by bit. Afodenic has been the pathway to financing to accomplish this improvement. This is her 5th cycle and it will be used to buy building materials and supplies to finish the roof and to buy doors and windows so that she can move in. She will buy twelve zinc metal sheets, ten metal gutters, four smooth zinc metal sheets, tubing, doors and windows so that the house will be completely closed off

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish roofing her house, to buy zinc metal sheeting and tubing, and doors and windows so that she can move in soon.

loans.name: San Miguel De Ayacucho Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Miguel D. Ayacucho inicia su ciclo 7 con 17 socias.
FioreL. es miembro D. L. junta directiva del Banco Comunal, es conviviente y tiene un hijo D. 3 años, FioreL. junto a su mama se dedican a L. compra y venta D. animales, viajan a las ferias para realizar su negocio. Además siembra verduras en tierras D. su familia, sus productos los comercializa en el mercado D. abastos. FioreL. trabaja en una tienda como vendedora.
FioreL. solicita un crédito que será invertido en L. compra D. animales.
Los sueños D. FioreL. son tener una casa propia , brindar una buena educación a su hijo y negocio propio.
texts.en:
The San Miguel D. Ayacucho communal bank is starting its 7th cycle with 17 members. FioreL. is a member of the governing board. She has a live-in partner and a 3 year old son. FioreL. and her mother buy and sell animals. They travel to the various livestock fairs to do conduct business. She also farms vegetables on her family’s farmland and she sells her agricultural product to the wholesale foodstuffs market. FioreL. also works as a salesperson in a store. She is asking for funds to buy animals. Her dreams are to own her own house, to proviD. a good education to her son and to have her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals.

loans.name: Lynmar

texts.en: Lynmar S. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 29 years old. Lynmar is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lynmar raises pigs for sale. Lynmar has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Lynmar joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lynmar is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the first loan taken out by Lynmar from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité “Maria Auxiliadora” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas  de Capiibary-11 de septiembre. 
Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas, Despensa, cría de animales y otros.
  Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo y al adquirir el crédito se le abren muchas puertas para el progreso de sus emprendimiento.
Germina R. Diaz Irala, es una de las integrantes quien es la presidenta del grupo.
  Es una Sra.  muy emprendedora, le gusta  la organización por eso  se le eligió como Presidena del grupo, se dedica en crías de animales (como chancho,gallinas .etc) y tiene 25 años con dos hijos.
Solicita el préstamo para  cubrir los gatos alimentación y sanitación de los animales.
texts.en:
The Maria Auxiliador committee was formed by various neighbors of Capiibary-11 de septiembre. All the members of the committee are self employed in activities such as sales, a general store, raising animals and others. The members have a tight-knit group that can jointly take on activities that contribute to their comraderie. When taking on loans doors are opened for the growth of their businesses. 

Germina R. Diaz Irala is a member and president of the group. She is very hard working and likes to be organized, reason for which she was elected as president of the group. She makes a living raising animals (pigs, chickens etc) and is 25 with 2 children. She is requesting a loan to help with expenses related to feeding and sanitation for her animals.

loans.use: Feed and sanitation expenses for animals.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma S. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old. Wilma is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Wilma owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling fish such as sardines, milkfish, "bilong-bilog", & "matang baka" in the local community. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Wilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Wilma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Petrosyan

texts.en: P. Petrosyan lives in Sasnashen village in the Aragatsotn region, Armenia. He is married with 2 children. The main family income comes from land cultivating and farming, in which he has been engaged for a long time as the only source of improving his living standards. P. has applied to SEF for a loan to begin autumn crops and acquire cattle food.

loans.use: To begin autumn crops and buy cattle food

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en:
Dionisia A. is a 45 year old married woman whho supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: a farm and a livestock business. She lives in Sitio Campakles, Brgy. Sac-Sac, Dalaguete, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her farming and livestock businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 9200. Dionisia is now borrowing PHP 10000 so that she can fund operations. This will be her 3rd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 7000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Dionisia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund business operations

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon B. is from the village of Taguilon, Dipolog City. She is 45 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. Corazon operates a family member's business in the food sector, selling fish in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Corazon joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fish nets and other fishing materials. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials for fishing boat repair. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Corazon from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials for fishing boat repair

loans.name: Marcia Angélica

texts.es:
Marcia Angélica C. A. tiene 29 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre con su compañero y los hijos en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolivar. Tiene 2 hijos.


Los miembros de la V.R.C. TRES DE NOVIEMBRE, Esta compuesta por 28 socios y esta a 90 minutos de  la oficina se encuentra dentro de los límites del Cantón Chillanes. Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Marcia Angélica se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Compra sus productos en Mata de cacao y sus ventas se realizan en el Comercial  Matilde Esther y vende los  productos en Bucay.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando para mantener a sus hijos.

Le gusta pasear en el campo.
texts.en:
Marcia Angélica C. A. is 29 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  She has 2 children.

The TRES DE NOVIEMBRE community bank has 28 members and is located 90 minutes from our office, in Chillanes canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing rice, bananas, corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  They have been in this line of work for many years.

Marcia Angélica is a farmer who grows rice, bananas, corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  She buys her products in Mata de Cacao and makes her sales in the Matilde Esther shopping center and in Bucay.

She is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her rice, banana, corn, cacao, orange and cassava crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to continue working so that she can support her children.  She likes to go for walks in the country.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Floro

texts.en:
Floro C. is from the town of Trinidad. He is 43 years old. Floro is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Floro owns & operates a business venture in the services sector providing waste management services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating "habal-habal" (motorcycle) transport service. Floro has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

Floro joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Floro has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Floro is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Floro from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Odilia Yolanda

texts.es:
Odilia, es una señora de 42 años de edad, reside en Lolotique departamento de San Miguel, ella está viviendo con su esposo y sus hijos de 21 y 18 años de edad, vende pupusas y gaseosas, también churros hace 6 años inicio este negocio, trabajando de lunes a sábado.
Por el momento Odilia necesita un préstamo para compra mercadería como maíz, chicharrón, quesillo, tomates, bebida, dulces y churros, estos productos para abastecer la pupuseria y la tienda, con esta ayudara ella quiere ofrecer una variedad de productos y atender mejor las necesidades de los clientes.
Su aspiración con la inversión es administrar correctamente el negocio, y los fondos del préstamo, también que sus hijos continúen con sus estudios.
texts.en: Odilia is a 42 year old woman that lives in Lolotique in the department of San Miguel.  She live with her husband and two children ages 21 and 18.  She has been selling pupusas [thick, stuffed tortillas], soft drinks and churros [fried dough pastry] for 6 years.  She works Monday through Saturday.   Presently, Odilia needs a loan to buy corn, chicharrón [chopped pork], quesillo [soft cheese], tomatoes, beverages, sweets and churros to stock her pupuseria and store.  This will help her to offer a variety of products and better serve the needs of her customers.  Her goal is to properly manage the investment in her business and the loan funds and also, for her children continue with their studies.

loans.use: To purchase corn, chicharrón, quesillo, tomatoes, beverages, sweets and churros

loans.name: Narciso

texts.en:
Narciso D. is from the village of Nabbotuan, Solana, Cagayan. He is 58 years old. Narciso is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Narciso owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Narciso has been engaged in his business for over 39 years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2011, Narciso joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Narciso is requesting a loan of 22,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Narciso from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Bayardo Jose

texts.es:
BAYARDO JOSE U. E., ES DE LA CIUDAD DE MANAGUA  EL TRABAJA DIARIO COMO ENCUESTRADOR CATASTRAL, ES PADRE DE FAMILIA DE TRES HIJOS, Y ESTOS  ACTUALMENTE DEPENDE DE EL Y SE ENCUENTRA EN EDAD ESCOLAR.
DON BAYARDO ACUDE  A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: ARENA, CEMENTO, PIEDRA, PARA LA REFORZAR DOS PAREDES DE SU CASA DE HABITACION QUE SE ENCUENTRAN DETEREORADA.
TODO ESTO PARA BRINDARLES MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIVIENDA A SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Bayardo Jose Umaña E. is from the city of Managua and works each day as a survey taker. He is the father of three dependent children who are currently in school.

Don Bayardo visited the offices of CEPRODEL to request a home improvement loan. He will invest in the purchase of construction materials such as sand, cement, and stone so that he can reinforce two walls in his home that are deteriorating.

Bayardo does everything he can to improve the conditions at home for his family.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to reinforce two deteriorating walls in his home

loans.name: Celmira

texts.es:
doña Celmira es una mujer emprendedora y muy dedicada a su trabajo, Celmira se dedica a la venta de granos basicos, vende frijoles, arroz, azucar y maiz en su casa de habitacion.
Celmira tiene como meta montar una pulperia en su casa de habitacion.
Celmira es madre de 4 hijos,  los cuales los tiene estudiando en la escuela publica de su comunidad.
Junto con su esposo trabajan duron para sacar adelante a sus hijos, su esposo trabaja en agricultura.
todos los dias se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para preparar a sus hijos para despacharlos a la escuela y luego atiende a sus clientes.
sus tiempos libres lo dedica a visitar la Iglesia.
texts.en:
Celmira is an enterprising woman who is very dedicated to her work, selling basic grains.  She sells beans, rice, sugar and corn from her home. 

Celmira's goal is to set up a grocery store in her home.  She has four children who all attend school in her community.  Together with her husband, Celmira works hard to get her children ahead in life.  Her husband works in agriculture.  Every day, Celmira gets up at 4.00am to get her children ready for school, then she serves her customers.  In her free time she goes to church.

loans.use: to buy sacks of beans, corn, rice and sugar

loans.name: Tomasa Leticia

texts.es:
Tomasa Leticia T. Y. tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera, vive con los padres, vive en San Miguel  en el Recinto Tangara perteneciente a la Provincia de Bolívar.Tiene un hijos pero no vive con el padre de su hijo.

Esta Ventanillas se llama CAMPECINOS UNIDOS  esta ubicada en el recinto Tangara y se encuentra a unos 15 minutos del Cantón San Miguel, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura y al comercio.

Tomasa se dedica a la agricultura para poder comprar las cosas para la casa ella siembra maiz.
Comprar sus productos en San Miguel y los vende en la Feria del mismo Cantón.

El crédito lo solicita para la comprar de insumos agrícolas fertilizantes y semillas, el crédito apoyado en el negocio familiar ya que produce mas y se tiene que trabajar para pagar la deuda. Su sueño es tener casa propia.

Los desafíos que se enfrenta son plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Le salir a hacer deporte con mi hijo.
texts.en:
Tomasa Leticia T. Y. is 27 years old, single, and lives with her parents in San Miguel in the Tangara area, which belongs to the Province of Bolívar. She has a son but she does not live with his father.

The name of this communal bank is “Campesinos Unidos” and it is located in the Tangara area, 15 minutes from the Canton of San Miguel. The members of the communal bank work in farming and in business.

Tomasa works in farming, growing corn in order to be able to buy things for the house. She buys her products in San Miguel and sells them at the market in the same canton.

She is requesting the loan to purchase farming supplies, fertilizers and seeds. The loan will help her family business, as she will produce more and she needs to work to pay off the debt. Her dream is to have her own house.

The challenges she faces are pests and diseases among her crops. She likes to play sports with her son.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Edison

texts.en: Edison is a forty-seven year-old married man with eight children, living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family solely rests on him, and his desire is to educate his children and buy land.  After realizing that raising cattle has low returns, he decided to sell off some of the cows and start a shop.  He has been in business for five years. He has a challenge of bad debtors, and his future plan is to have a wholesale shop.  Edison intends to use the loan to buy rice, paraffin, and match boxes.

loans.use: to buy rice, paraffin and matchboxes.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn L. is from the village of Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 30 years old. Analyn is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Analyn owns & operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing & selling woven mats to local businesses and community members. Analyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Analyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analyn is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture woven native mats. This will be the first loan taken out by Analyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture woven native mats.

location.town: Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more foods and beverages.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children, who are all currently in school.  Shamim has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for three years.         

To help expand her business, Shamim has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Shamim hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself.  In the future, Shamim hopes to own a retail shop.  Shamim is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her learn new games like indoor and outside games.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Luan's Group

texts.en:
Luan was born in 1965. She lives in Dai Bi village and has three children. The first daughter was married, the two younger children are going to school. Her husband is a worker in Da Hoi. Miss Luan is a farmer. She not only grows rice, but also raises pigs and poultry. Her family has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. 

Miss Luan wants to have a better life, so she always tries to work. She has participated in SEDA since 2005. In this loan cycL., she would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy pigs.

About other borrowers in her group:

Than is 49 years old. She has a store. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to expand her store.

Men is 60 years old. She sells eggs in the market. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy more eggs to sell.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Hing

texts.en:
Hing, 25 year old, is a factory worker in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a security guard in Takeo province, and their income is $5.50 per day. They have one child who is two years old. 

Every month, Hing has to spend $25 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on rent, $15 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use as a motor taxi driver in Phnom Penh City so that he can stay with her and also make more income. Hing also plans to sell vegetables, having her husband transport them from the province to sell in the city to make more profit.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to use as a taxi.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 47 years old and married with four grown children. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of products to the community. Anecita has been in business for six years, and she earns approximately 3,000 PHP monthly.

Anecita is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy rice, canned goods and soft drinks to sell. In the future, Anecita hopes that her business will expand to increase her profits and so provide for the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy rice, canned goods and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat is a competitive and focused 37 year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with three children. Since 1997, he has been doing photography to make life more comfortable for his family.  He uses income from this trade to supplement the income he gets from supplying schools with materials.  In the next 5 years, he wants  to have expanded his business so that he edges closer to his dream of opening up a journalism school.

He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a printing machine and printing papers. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for making him financially literate.

loans.use: to buy a printing machine and printing papers

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente de 42 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana de Pacanga que pertenece al departamento de la Libertad.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace 6 años Vicente se dedica a la venta de reciclaje y al molido de botellas descartables, cuenta con su propio molino para realizar ese trabajo diariamente, tiene su propia clientela que le vende el producto, con el dinero que adquiera en su negocio será para cubrir las necesidades diarias de su hogar.

Al observar que su negocio va creciendo a creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para la compra de otro molino para seguir moliendo su reciclaje, ya que se ha incrementado sus ventas, con los ingresos podrá pagar su crédito otorgado y tener algunas mejoras en su casa.  Vicente es una persona que con trabajo y dedicación a logrado tener lo que actualmente tiene y trata de sacar a su familia adelante, con el ideal que sus hijos tengan estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Vicente is 42 years old. He lives with his family in their own house. The house has water and electricity and it is located in the urban zone of Pacanga, which belongs to the department of La Libertad. This zone is characterized by agriculture and cattle.

For 6 years Vicente has been selling recycled materials and grinding disposable bottles. He has his own grinder so he can do this work every day. He has his own clients he sells the product to. With the money he receives from his business, he covers the daily necessities of his household.

Since he sees that his business is growing, he though it would be good to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for PEN 3,000.00 to buy another grinder so he can continue grinding his recyclables. Since his sales have been increasing, with his income he will pay back the loan and make some improvements to his house. Vicente is a person who with work and dedication has achieved what he currently has and tries to help his family get ahead, with the idea that his children should have a college education.

loans.use: to buy another grinder so he can continue grinding recyclable materials.

loans.name: Mab

texts.en:
Mab is 42 years old and is a tok-tok driver who earns 10 USD a day. He lives with two of his siblings, who work in a factory and each earn 3 USD daily. Each month, he spends 30 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity, 15 USD on rent, 5 USD on transportation, and 10 USD on other expenses.  

Mab is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to buy a new tok-tok to replace his current one, which is old. In the future, he would like to be able to help his sister to buy a store in the market to sell fruit.

loans.use: to buy a new tok-tok

loans.name: Martha Lidia

texts.es: Martha Lidia tiene 54 años de edad, y junto a su esposo y a su hijo de 12 años reside en Barrio Belén en la Ciudad de Juticalpa. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería como ser calzado, ropa, lociones, cosméticos y otros productos de uso personal. Inició este negocio porque los ingresos de su esposo eran pocos y para ayudarlo decidió destinar una parte de su casa para instalar una pequeña tienda y así tener un ingreso extra que le permitiera llevar parte del sustento para la familia. Una de las desventajas que enfrenta es que su negocio está ubicado enfrente de una calle de tierra y dado a que el clima es muy caliente debe mantener la puerta de la tienda abierta y la mercadería se le llena de polvo. Martha solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como ropa interior y de vestir, zapatos, sandalias, cosmeticos, perfumes, entre otros. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá mantener su tienda bien surtida e incrementar sus ventas y así llevar el sustento a su hogar. Su meta es hacerle mejoras a su local para que el producto exhibido no se le dañe. Martha ha sido cliente de FAMA por tres ciclos y su comportamiento de pago es muy bueno, cabe mencionar que por su puntualidad ha sido premiada como una de las mejores clientas de la institución.
texts.en:
Martha Lidia is 54 and lives with her husband and 12-year-old son in the Belén quarter of the city of Juticalpa.  She sells merchandise such as shoes, clothing, lotions, cosmetics and other personal care items.  She started her business because her husband's salary was not enough to cover expenses and she decided to help out.  She organized part of her house to set up a small store to obtain extra income for the family.

One of the disadvantages of her business is that the store is located on a dirt road.  With the climate being very hot she must keep the door open and the merchandise then gets covered with dust.  Martha is requesting a loan to buy goods such as clothing and lingerie, shoes, sandals, cosmetics, perfumes and other items.  With the help of the loan she will be able to keep her store well stocked so she can increase sales and her household income.  Her goal is to make the necessary improvements to exhibit merchandise so it won't get damaged.  Martha has been a FAMA member for three cycles, always paying back the loans on time.  Because of her promptness she was awarded for being one of the institution's best customers.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as , , cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: María Ignacia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 22 De Julio se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 62 años de edad, hace varios años su querido esposo falleció pero de esa linda relación tuvo seis hijas, todas mujeres las mismas que fueron su soporte en los momentos difíciles, todas sus hijas ya están  casadas,  dos de ellas viven cerca de su casa las otras en diferentes ciudades.
 
Nuestra amiga para ganarse la vida se dedica al comercio, ella vende sabanas y productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana, ella también le envía sabanas a una hija que vive en Esmeraldas para que le ayude con las ventas. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y lo que es sabanas las compra en Picoaza donde le dejan a muy buen precio. Tiene seis años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y sobretodo sabanas. Este es el quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener buena salud para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The “22nd of July” comunal bank meets every 15 days in the parrish of Picoaza, in the city of Portoviejo. It is known for being a very commercial area, for its traditional celebrations of Saint Peter and Saint Paul, and for the cheerfulness of its people.

This is where we meet María. She is 62 yeas old. Her beloved husband passed away several years ago, but from this wonderful relationship they had 6 daughters. All women, they were their support during difficult moments. All of her daughters are now married. Two of them live near her house and the others live in different cities.

Our friend, in order to earn her living, works in sales. She sells bed sheets and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). She works three days per week. She sells her products on credit and collects each week. She receives her products at home and the sheets she buys in Picoaza, where she gets a very good price. She has been doing this work for 6 years and it is going very well for her.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and, especially, sheets. This is her fifth loan cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because the repayments are easy to make.
