Her dream is to have good health so that she can continue onward.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and sheets

loans.name: Cuneta

texts.en:
Cuneta is 44 years old and lives in Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married.

Cuneta has a retail business and earns approximately 5000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5000 to purchase cases of coke, groceries and sacks of charcoal to sell.

Cuneta became a member of PMPC this year (2011). In the future, Cuneta hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase cases of coke, groceries and sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Alma Nidia

texts.es:
Alma Nidia, ha logrado la captacion de mas clientes, en sus ventas de tortillas y ahora la venta de frijoles cocidos, palmea los tres tiempos, lo que ah aumentado mas la produccion de tortilla. Al tener los financiamiento en Afodenic, lo que ha logrado el equilibrio en sus ventas al comprar mas productos, pagando a plazos flexible.
Lo que para ella es de gran sastifaccion, seguir trabajando y apoyando a su familia, su esposo sigue laborando como albañil por cuenta propia.
Con este nuevo prestamo comprara quince quintales de maiz, el cual compra a buen precio, compra de leña, y frijoles para seguir palmeando las tortillas y mantener a un mismo precio sus productos. Logrando mantener a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Alma Nidia has succeeded in attracting more customers for her tortilla sales and now she also sells cooked beans.  She makes tortillas three times a day so production has increased.  Loans from Afodenic helped her stabilize sales by buying more products and paying in flexible installments.  For her, it’s a great satisfaction to continue working and supporting her family.  Her husband continues to work as an independent bricklayer.

She will use this new loan to buy fifteen quintals of corn that she gets at a good price; she will buy firewood and beans to continue making tortillas and keep selling her products for the same price and retaining her customers.

loans.use: to buy several quintals of corn, firewood and beans.

loans.name: Mbana

texts.fr: Madame Mbana est âgée  de 48 ans. Elle vit au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et mère de plus de 5 enfants. Elle évolue depuis 10 ans dans le secteur du commerce plus précisément dans la vente d’encens, de tissus (wax et voile). Elle fait aussi de la broderie. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis mai 2003. Elle a déjà remboursé 9 prêts  antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus à revendre a l’occasion de la fête de la Tabaski. Ce financement lui permettra d’améliorer le niveau de ses revenus et de soutenir ses enfants qui étudie dans les dépenses de frais de scolarité.
texts.en: Mbana is 48 years old and lives in Senegal. She is married and has more than 5 children. She has been working as a retailer for ten years, more specifically selling incense and fabrics (wax-print and voile). She also does embroidery. Mbana has been a member of one of U-IMCEC's offices since May 2003. She has already repaid nine previous loans. She is requesting this loan for 150,000 francs to buy fabrics to re-sell for the Tabaski holiday (Eid al-Adha). This loan will allow her to improve her income and support her children, who are in school, by paying their school fees.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to re-sell

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla is 50 years old and married with 4 children. She is a vegetable farmer who has worker in the field for 22 years. 

This is her second loan with VisionFund.  Phalla requested a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and seeds to grow vegetables. 

With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields from rice and vegetables, earn more income, savings and live in a better house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland and seeds for vegetables plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Roma Fe Group

texts.en:
Roma Fe is 58 years old and lives in Molicay, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with four children. Roma Fe has a sari-sari store business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase more stock for her general store. 

Roma Fe has been a member of PMPC for about one month. In the future, she hopes to be successful in her business dealings. She is the leader of a two-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 22 years old and is single. He sells foodstuffs such as peanuts, sorghum and maize in a store he has run for 4 years. The loan will be used to buy beans, maize, sorghum and peanuts to sell in his store.

He would like to use any profits to buy materials to renovate his house. He dreams to one day own a motorcycle to create more income for himself.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Rebecca's Group

texts.en:
Rebecca's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Rebecca is 19 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luweero region of Uganda. For the past two years, Rebecca has been working hard to selling charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Rebecca is requesting a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda, which she will use to buy more charcoal to sell. This loan will help her generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. Rebecca hopes that in the future she will be able to become a nurse. 

Rebecca is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Rebecca's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Hasna

texts.en:
Hasna is a hard-working 46-year-old woman. She is married, and the mother of two precious children whose living she works very hard to ensure. 

Hasna has been selling perfumes and accessories for three years. With the help of the last Kiva loan that she applied for from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, her business is going well. She was and will be a borrower in good standing. Today, Hasna is applying for another loan from Al Majmoua. This time she will invest it in supporting her newly opened business which is selling used shoes and clothes. She hopes this career will improve her family's social and financial situation.

Hasna hopes to expand her business more and more, and in the future to start in the wholesale trade.

loans.use: To support her newly opened used shoes and clothes business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

Lolita has a food-vending business in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Lolita is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food-vending business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 27 years old, married and has two children.  He sells items such as cooking pans, plastic trays, basins, buckets, sandals and plates.  He also does farming in his rural home.  This has helped him to earn extra income for his family.  He works hard in his business to provide for his family including educating his two children. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to improve his business because he has been trained in business management skills. He needs a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Paschalia

texts.en: Paschalia is a married woman. She has a daughter who is 7 years old. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. She operates a grocery stall where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a highly populated area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as low purchasing power. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more vegetables and fruits. Paschalia's business goal is to expand the grocery store within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Flamingo Group

texts.en:
Kombo, who is in his late 30s, is married with two children; one of them goes to school and the other one is a baby. He has been selling second-hand clothes and shoes for four years now. He works from 8.00 am to 9.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to buy more clothes and shoes to resell and has paid back his loan successfully. He hopes for a loan to further increase the second-hand clothes and shoes sold. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Flamingo", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes and shoes to resell.

loans.name: Matin

texts.en:
Matin is 30 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala east region of Uganda. For the past two years, Matin has been working hard to manage his poultry, which sells chicken. 

To help expand his business, Matin has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to get more feed for his chickens to improve the egg output, and will help Matin to generate greater profits and increase the supply of eggs. Matin hopes that in the future he will be able to. 

Matin is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Matin who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to get more feed for his chickens in order to improve the egg output.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: La señora Gregoria, es una persona de 51 años de edad, de estado civil casada, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, vive actualmente en su propia casa junto a su familia y cuenta con dos dependientes económicos a cargo las cuales son sus hijas. La actividad económica de la clienta es la producción agrícola, los productos que cultiva son la papa, haba y cebolla; produce especialmente la papa durante dos épocas de la gestión en sus terrenos propios que se hallan situadas en las comunidades de Sankayani Bajo y Cochimita del municipio de Tíraque distante aproximadamente a unos 77 Km. desde la ciudad de Cochabamba. La señora Gregoria y su familia manifiestan ser personas trabajadoras y responsables que quieren superarse e incrementar su productividad  y para tal efecto se ve en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la compra de insumos agrícolas que a corto plazo les permitirá obtener mayores  ingresos económicos que vayan a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 51 years old, and she is married.  She has an elementary school education.  She currently lives in her own house with her family.  She has two economically dependent children, her daughters, under her care.

Her business activity is farming.  She grows potatoes, beans, and onions.  She primarily grows potatoes during two growing seasons on her own land.  Her land is located in the Sankayani Bajo and Cochimita communities in the Tíraque municipality, which is approximately 77km from the city of Cochabamba.

Gregoria and her family state that they are hard-working and responsible people who want to improve themselves and increase their productivity.  In order to do so, they see the need to request a loan to buy farming supplies.  In the short term, this will allow her to get greater income, which will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Mayé

texts.fr: Âgée de 47 ans, Mayé est mariée à un certain Anatole. Le couple a un enfant scolarisé et à leur charge. Mayé vit ensemble avec son  enfants et son mari. En dehors de leur propre enfant le couple a un autre enfant scolarisé à sa charge. Mayé et son mari assurent ensemble les différentes charges du ménage. Mayé vend du riz, de l'huile végétale et divers articles depuis dix ans environ ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer à l'éducation et à l'entretien des enfants. Mayé s'approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. La clientèle de Mayé devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Mayé sollicite une sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter de l'huile végétale et divers articles.

loans.name: Joanina

texts.en:
Joanina  is a married woman with three children, two of whom attends school. She lives at her  house that has no electricity but has piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four  years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of theft and transportation in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana D. is from Silistra town. She and her husband have worked several years in Spain. Two years ago they returned to Bulgaria. Until this moment they both are unemployed. That is why they decided to open a bar.  
They rented a former bar that needed a basic repair. With this loan they will repaired it and supplied the bar with the necessary goods to start-up.

loans.use: Repair and equipment of a bar

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.en: My name is Manuel de Jesús, and I make and sell sweets and candy. My business is in my home, and I go to different markets to sell by products. Thanks to this business I have been able to provide for my family since my business generates income to cover my commitments to my suppliers and my family expenses.

loans.use: Purchase of bananas, bags, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 22 years old and has 2 small children. She and her mother run a restaurant that is very popular in their neighborhood. Maria has been around restaurants since she was very young because her mother always ran similar businesses. Now they are business partners and are having great success. Maria also sells shoes, clothes, and home products to many of the clients at her restaurant, and she also travels into large markets in the city to make her sales.

Maria is a single mother. The father of the first left her shortly after finding out she was pregnant, and the father of the second passed away two months after the child was born. Even so, she is hardworking and optimistic.

Maria is taking out her second loan with the Kiva and Mifex program. With the first loan she concentrated on her retail business. She invested in electrical domestic appliances and resold them in her neighborhood and in some rural communities. Selling appliances has been very profitable and successful for Maria. She hopes that the Kiva community will continue supporting her and her family.

loans.use: Invest in domestic appliances

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Charity would like to buy ready-made clothes and textile materials

loans.name: Cruz Adan

texts.es:
Cruz Adan is a hard-working married father of two. His spouse is a housewife. He started his auto repair business to provide for his family. Seven years he worked in a repair shop and learned the business and in his second year he went independent and opened his own shop for repairs and painting, which has allowed him to move his family ahead. Currently, he wishes to grow his business and improve his family's quality of life.

Cruz Adan is requesting a loan of $275, which he will use to purchase raw materials for his shop and to be able to fulfill pending jobs and orders on time. He plans to repay the loan within five months. He and his family are very grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Cruz Adan es un hombre casado muy trabajador y tiene dos hijos, su esposa se dedica al hogar, él inició con su negocio para poder mantener a su familia, hace 7 años atrás trabajaba como ayudante en un taller y aprendió sobre el negocio y al segundo año se independizó y abrió su propio local de enderezado y pintura, con el cual ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos y a su familia, ahora el desea continuar con su negocio y hacerlo crecer y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Cruz Adan está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 275 para comprar materia prima para su taller y poder cumplir con trabajos que tiene pendientes y entregarlos a tiempo, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 5 meses, él y su familia agradecen mucho el apoyo que le das para poder salir adelante con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Amani Brigitte

texts.en: Amani Brigitte lives with her family in Adjamé, a suburb in the north of the Abidjan district. Brigitte has 6 children, of whom 5 go to school. Brigitte's husband is a factory worker. She is a dynamic woman and is the economic and financial pillar of her family. She sells palm and groundnuts oils in the Adjamé market. She has been in this business for more than ten years. These products are very appreciated for both food preparation and traditional local cosmetic products. Brigitte will use the loan to purchase goods in bulk .

loans.use: Amani Brigitte will use the loan to purchase palm and groundnuts oils in bulk.

loans.name: Edita Graciela

texts.es:
Mrs. Edita, 59 years of age, through her hard work has been able to obtain two stalls at the “Bellavista” market in the Esperanza district of the Trujillo province, Department La Libertad. In one she sells groceries and in the other she sells prepared food (stuffed potatoes, broths, breakfast, corn bread, etc.) The first loan that she obtained from the Community Bank “Bellavista” of USD $100, she used to establish her stall for groceries.

Mrs. Edita used to work in manufacturing; she worked in a factory making clothing. She was discharged because of her age.

She started her business selling groceries in small quantities. Slowly, saving her profits and with loans from her community bank she has been growing her business.

Using the recent loan from Manuela Ramos of USD $425, which is to be repaid in 6 month, she is improving her food stall, which is a little bit disorganized. She is also buying sugar, rice and oil.

Mrs. Edita dreams of having a well run and modern restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer

La señora Edita a sus 59 años de edad y con el esfuerzo que le ha puesto al trabajo ha logrado obtener 2 puestos en el mercado “Bellavista” en el distrito de la Esperanza provincia Trujillo departamento La Libertad. En uno vende abarrotes y en el otro vende comida (papa rellena, caldos, desayunos, cachangas, etc.). El primer prestamos que recibió en su Banco Comunal “Bellavista” de S/.300 (aproximadamente $100) le sirvió para implementar su puesto de abarrotes.

La señora Edita antes se dedicaba a la manufactura, era obrera en una empresa de confección de ropa pero por su edad la despidieron.

Inició su negocio vendiendo abarrotes en pequeñas cantidades y poco a poco ahorrando lo que ganaba y con los préstamos de su banco comunal ha ido creciendo.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.1,20 para cancelarlos en 6 meses, ha mejorando el puesto de comida ya que estaba un poco desarreglado y también ha comprado azúcar, arroz y aceite.

La señora Edita sueña con tener un restaurante moderno y bien implementado.

loans.use: Purchase of various food products.

loans.name: Gustavo Antonio

texts.es:
Sr. Gustavo Antonio Castellon sells produce like tomatoes, chiltoma peppers and cabbage in the Mayoreo market in Managua. It must be pointed out that at any hour or any moment you will find him at this shop, and he is a very hardworking person. His difficult economic situation has made him search for ways to earn a living, however despite the inconsistencies of life, he has always worked to support his wife of many years, and the to grandchildren he is raising.

Gustavo Castellon has been obtained credit with Ceprodel for the last six months (three loans), and he has taken advantage of this to acquire more produce and at the same time support his wife and provide for his two grandchildren who need him. Sr. Gustavo is the only income earner in his household.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Gustavo Antonio C. se dedica a la venta de verduras como tomates, chiltomas y repollos en el mercado Mayoreo de Managua. Es necesario destacar que a toda hora y en todo momento se encuentra en su localidad por lo que es una persona muy trabajadora. Su difícil situación económica lo ha llevado a buscar la manera de ganarse la vida, sin embargo a pesar de las inconsistencias de la vida, siempre ha logrado apoyar a su anciana esposa y sus dos nietos a los que mantiene.

Desde hace seis meses el señor Gustavo C. ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel (tres créditos) y según cuenta los ha aprovechado para surtir mas sus verduras y además para apoyar a su anciana esposa y mantener a sus dos nietos que tanto lo necesitan. El señor Gustavo es el único ingreso económico en su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase tomatoes and chiltoma peppers

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.en:
Ana Mercedes is a many-sided businesswoman who is looking for the best market opportunities to do business. She is a teacher in a primary school in the Café community of Santo Domingo. She also sells silver jewelry to women and other teachers in the school and the community.

Ana Mercedes says that she wants to start selling calling cards too, because these products are always in high demand, and she thinks she could earn a lot of money selling them.

Ana is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of more jewelry in order to increase her income. The entrepreneur wants to improve her family’s living conditions and keep supporting her three children's studies.

loans.use: Purchase of silver jewelry for her business inventory

loans.name: Ndifakulya West B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Grace K.. She is currently in the business of rearing cattle and is requesting a loan to purchase cattle feed. Grace is 35 years old and is married, with a husband who is a veterinary officer for work. She has 3 children ranging from age 7 to 16 and her children go to school. Each week, Grace makes approximately UGX 15000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest in her business. Grace has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Grace is joined in her small group by Sada W., Halima M., Bayati T., and Betty M.. Sada W. has a business selling charcoal and wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal. Halima M. is currently operating a business in clothing sales and wants a loan to boost business. Bayati T. operates a business selling clothes and wants to add more clothing stock. Betty M. is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to add more furniture.

loans.use: To add capital in cattle rearing business

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin is a humble farmer in the central area of Peru, who dedicates himself to growing vegetables thanks to his ancestral heritage and he is very successful with the help of his loving wife. The family’s annual source of income is the selling of his vegetable harvest and now thanks to his wife’s initiatives who also raises and sells small animals. This year he hopes to sell his products without middlemen in order to obtain greater profits and begin to gain experience in order to be able to help his neighbors do the same, for the benefit of hundreds of families in his beloved city. So that this project has a good end he is asking for your help in acquiring a greater quantity of manure and fertilizers that will optimize the size and nutriciousness of his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Edwin, es un humilde agricultor de la zona central de Perú, se dedica a la siembra de vegetales gracias a su herencia ancestral con mucho éxito y con la ayuda de su amada esposa. Su principal fuente de ingreso familiar la obtiene año a año de la venta de la cosecha de sus vegetales y ahora gracias a la iniciativa de su esposa también de la crianza y venta de pequeños animalitos.Este año desea incursionar en la venta de sus productos sin intermediarios para obtener mayores ganacias y empezar a adquirir experiencia a fin de asociar a sus vecinos para llevar a cabo este proyecto en beneficio de los centenares de familias de su amada ciudad. Para que este proyecto tenga buen término solicita vuestra ayuda a fin de adquirir mayor cantidad de abonos y fertilizantes que optimizarán el tamaño y nutrientes de sus sembríos.

loans.use: Purchase manure and natural fertilizer

loans.name: Phal

texts.en: Mrs. Phal P. is a farmer in Prey Tachap Village in Kampong Speu Province. Her husband, Mr. Paok Yin, is a farmer. They have four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, one is a construction worker, and one generates an income from making palm tree juice. The youngest child is studying at state school. These family members have different business activities but they still do not have enough money to build their new house. Mrs. Phal P. has a plan to build a new house so she has decided to ask for a loan to achieve her goal. Last year, Mrs. Phal P. obtained a loan from AMK to buy cows to plough her rice field. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to build a new house for the family.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David's determination, diligence and perseverance is always emphasized by the activities to which he dedicates himself. In the time that he has devoted to his business of sales and purchases of second-hand tricycles and bicycles, David has found great satisfaction. Over a very short period of time he has begun to reap great benefits with which he is now able to accomplish many of his goals. In reality, this hard-working young man is continuing his studies. In order to cover his education costs he needs to have better investment in his business, investment that will facilitate the effortless completion of his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer.

El empeño, diligencia y perseverancia de David siempre lo hicieron destacar en las actividades a las que se dedicó, durante el tiempo que viene consagrándose a su negocio de compra y venta de triciclos y bicicletas de segunda mano fue atesorando mucha satisfacción por que en muy corto tiempo consiguió obtener buenos beneficios con el que está logrando concretar muchos de sus planes.Actualmente este laborioso joven viene siguiendo sus estudios superiores, para cubrir sus gastos de educación desea tener un mayor monto de inversión en su negocio, inversión que le facilitará concluir con tranquilidad sus estudios.

loans.use: Increased capital to offer higher quantity of tricycles and bicycles.

loans.name: Uok

texts.en:
Uok K. N., 52, lives in Kampong Cham with her husband, Cheav Thor, and their four children. She has been traveling around her community and selling traditional Khmer cakes for about seven years now, and typically makes US$4 each day. Her husband works as a farmer and other people will hire him to come and plow their lands for about US$10 each day.

Two of their children work in the local garment factory and help to support the family with US$200 each month. The family has many members to support and it has been very difficult to have a consistent income, because their tractor is old and in disrepair.

Uok K. N. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a new tractor for her husband to continue running his business. She sees this investment as having long-term benefits and looks forward to the increased income that her family can receive.

loans.use: Purchase a tractor

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Mrs. Yem D. is 43 years old. She is a housewife and cares for two children and cooks rice and other food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Chin On, is 45 years old. He runs a small private business providing house building in his village and other areas, and he earns $2.00 per day. They live in Tonle Bet Commune, Kampong Cham Province. They have four children in their family, two of whom are married.

Yem D. is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 500 for her husband's business to purchase construction material. They hope that the loan will help to improve their business and that that will increase the family's income.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL):

HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for her husband's business

loans.name: Ivone Aneth

texts.es:
Ivone es casada y tiene 2 hijos: Jasón de 10 años y Jacqueline de 4 años, su esposo es empleado. Ella inició el negocio por querer sacar adelante a su familia apoyando a su marido con la economía familiar. Empezó hace 3 años vendiendo ropa americana y le ha dejado buenos ingresos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía ya que quiere hacer crecer su negocio y con tu apoyo lo va a conseguir
texts.en:
Ivone is married and has two children: 10-year-old Jason and 4-year-old Jacqeline. Her husband is an employee. She began her business because Ivone wanted to help her husband in supporting the family. Three years ago she began selling American second-hand clothing, which has generated a good income. She requests a loan for $250 to be paid back in four months. The loan will be used to buy merchandise to make her business grow. With your help, Ivone will make it.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying merchandise

loans.name: Koumavi

texts.fr:
Monsieur H. Koumavi est né le 7 juillet 1969 à Agoè-nyivé. Il est marié et père de cinq enfants. Il est menuisier charpentier et fabrique des chaises, des tables et autres objets à base de bois. C’est au cours de l’année 2006 qu’il a ouvert  son atelier. Il travaille parfois en collaboration avec des maçons et les aide à faire des coffrages. Avec ce métier il satisfait ses besoins primaires. 
Il sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter du bois pour la fabrication de chaises et de tabourets.
texts.en:
Mr. Koumavi H. was born on July 7, 1969 in Agoè-nyivé. He is married and the father of five. A carpenter, he produces chairs, tables, and other items made of wood. It was during 2006 that he opened his workshop. He sometimes works in collaboration with masons and helps them make forms and frames. In this carpentry trade, he meets his basic needs. He is requesting this first loan to buy wood to make chairs and stools.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber for making chairs

loans.name: Mwatima's Group

texts.en:
Mwatima M. has been selling food in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She begins preparing the foods at 10:00am and sells them throughout the day. She is able to earn a profit of approximately $40 each month. Mwatima is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more rice, firewood, charcoal and fish so that she can prepare foods and sell them.

Mwatima is 30 years old, divorced, and has four children.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for the foods that she prepares and sells.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina tiene 28 años, vive con su conviviente, aún no tienen hijos. Ella se dedica a apoyar a su esposo en su restaurante, pero le dedica mucho más tiempo al servicio de llamadas telefónicas por celular de forma ambulatoria, esto hace ya 3 años, tiempo en el cual ha adquirido todo el conocimiento necesario para desempeñar muy bien en su trabajo, arrojándole buenas ganancias económicas. A Alejandrina le gusta su trabajo, ya que le da cierta libertad el realizarlo, movilizándose de un lugar a otro ofreciendo el servicio de llamadas. Lo más dificultoso es tener que soportar el calor que hace durante el día y el imperante frío que hace por las tardes en esta zona del país. Alejandrina se encuentra en el primer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA. Con el dinero solicitado quiere comprar otro equipo celular para mejorar  sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 28 years old. She lives with her partner. They do not have children yet. She is dedicated to supporting her husband in his restaurant, but dedicates a lot more time to a cell telephone calling service that she sells on foot. She has been selling this service for 3 years, in which time she has acquired all the necessary knowledge to perform very well in her work, earning herself a good profit. Alejandrina likes her work, since it gives her a certain liberty as she does it, moving from one place to another offering the calling service. The most difficult thing is to have to bear the heat that occurs during the day and the prevailing cold that occurs in the afternoons in this zone of the country. Alejandrina is requesting her first loan with Microfinanzas PRISM. With the requested money she wants to buy another cell phone to improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy another cell phone for her calling service.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa A. is forty-five years old. She is a married woman with six children. Four of her children are independent. They have completed college and are gainfully employed. 

Currently, she lives with her husband and their two youngest children, who are now in the basic school, in Atebubu. Atebubu is a town in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Atebubu is a farming community. The inhabitants produce food crops like maize, yams, millet, and beans. 

Hawah says she enjoys trading and has been in the trading business for three years. She owns a small grocery kiosk in her community and also trades in items such as beans, maize and millet. Hawah distributes her goods to "pito" sellers in her community. Pito is a local drink produced from milled millet with a colour similar to Coca-Cola. She says that she took over this business from her late mother and, through this business, has helped her husband take good care of the family. 

Hawah wants a loan to expand her business to purchase more goods. She is in a group called "Do Good." The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan and support each other to repay.

loans.use: To purchase more maize, beans, millet and grocery products.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose A. is a 39 year old trader. She is married with six children,  She trades in corn dough at the community market in Agogo, where she lives. She has being selling corn dough for the past seventeen years and through this business she has supported one child through senior high school. She also assists her husband with supporting the family. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of corn dough to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increased prices, due to the current food crisis in the country. To get the corn dough, you first soak the maize in water for about a week and then it is sieved for milling. This is used to prepare a food called ‘Banku’ a local porridge. She wants the loan to buy a larger inventory of maize to reduce her frequent traveling to villages in search of supplies. Rose wants to save more  for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of maize to prepare corn dough.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en: Youssef is a 35-year-old married man with two children, living in Ghaza in the Bekaa Valley. He has owned a small shop since 2000, where he fixes and sells tires in addition to engine oil. Today, Youssef has an opportunity to buy some engine oil for a very good price; therefore, he is requesting to borrow $1,200.

loans.use: Buy engine oil inventory

loans.name: Sami

texts.en: Sami is a 21-year-old man living in Jalala in the Bekaa valley. He is an aluminum handyman and works in several workshops. Sami won a contract for a new project, renovating a small building, and is requesting a $500 loan in order for him to buy new tools and finish the project on time.

loans.use: Buy new tools

loans.name: Lila Victoria

texts.es:
LILA VICTORIA B. D. M. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Rosas” con domicilio en la prolongación Túpac Amaru Mz. 192 Lt. 16 Km. 6 del distrito D. Callería, tiene 63 años, 03 hijos, y es madre soltera.

Se dedica al negocio D. venta D. ropa a domicilio y también en los poblados cercanos, el primer préstamo fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, que invirtió en la compra D. ropa y las ofreció a sus vecinos con facilidades D. pago, y así consiguió más clientes.

El negocio inicial creció y siempre ha requerido los préstamos, que desD. hace 2 años le facilita Manuela Ramos, con éste préstamo D. S/.1,200. Nuevos Soles, comprará en Lima ropa al por mayor, la misma que ofrecerá a sus clientes. Incluso comprará  un poco D. útiles escolares aprovechando la campaña escolar.
Comenta: “Si no sería la Manuela Ramos, que sería D. nosotros quien nos daría esa facilidad, aparte nos capacita con charlas sobre ventas, y atención al cliente”
texts.en:
LILA VICTORIA B. D. M. belongs to the “Las Rosas” (The Roses) Communal Bank, she lives at Túpac Amaru Mz. 192 Lt. 16 Km. 6, Callería district. She is 63 years old, has 3 children and is a single mother. She sells clothing at home and also in nearby villages. With her first loan for S.300.00 Nuevos Soles, and she bought clothing and sold them to her neighbors offering payment plans, and in this way she obtained more customers. The business began to grow and has always required loans. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. With this loan for S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles she will buy clothing at wholesale in Lima which she will then sell to her customers. She will also buy some school supplies to take advantage of the school season. She says, “If it weren’t for Manuela Ramos, what would become of us, who would give us this capability, in addition to teaching us with seminars about sales and customer service.”

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing and school supplies

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi: Chị Ngô Thị Nghĩa tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2006, gia đình chị  có 3 con  đều đã trưởng thành. Hiện nay hai vợ  chị cùng con trai lớn đang  làm công việc mua lợn thịt và cung cấp cho các lò mổ . bên cạnh đó gia điìn chị còn có thêm nghề kinh daonh dịch vụ điện nước nông nghiệp nên hàng tháng cho thu nhập ổn định 4.000.000đ/ tháng.  Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư  thêm vốn cho công việc buôn bán thịt lợn của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs. Ngô Thị Nghĩa has participated in the TYM Fund since 2006. She has three children, all now adults. Currently, she and her husband, along with their eldest son, operate a business buying pigs and supplying them to slaughterhouses. In addition, the family runs a business that provides agricultural water and electrical services, so that they now have a steady monthly income of 4,000,000 VND (230 USD). In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 20,000,000 VND to invest in her family’s business selling pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pig selling business

loans.name: Indalecio

texts.es:
El señor Indalecio A. se dedica a trabajar arduamente con el fin de llevar a cabo el mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que desde hace mucho tiempo no tiene acceso a la energía eléctrica y para ello ha adquirido un panel solar para llevar a cabo sus quehaceres del hogar.

Es por este motivo que él espera ser beneficiado con un crédito en Ceprodel para el pago del panel solar y así iniciar en su respectivo uso para mejorar la condición de su vivienda y así beneficiar a toda su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Indalecio A. dedicates himself to working arduously with the aim of improving his home since, for a long time, he has not had access to electricity. For this reason, he has acquired a solar panel so he can complete his household chores. He hopes to be benefited by a loan with Ceprodel, so he can pay for the panel and begin to use it. This will improve his living conditions, and help his entire family who relies on him a great deal.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for a solar panel.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.en:
Honorata is 39 years old and is married to Mario S., who is a humble farmer in the peaceful village of Magsaysay Naguillan, Isabela. The couple is blessed with four children. Three of them are already studying in high school, while her youngest is four years old and is not yet attending school.

Honorata further believes that patience and hard work mean a lot in reaching for success. She sells vegetables from their small farm at a local market. When they are not harvesting, or their crops are not sufficient for their sales, she also purchases other vegetables wholesale to sell along with her own goods. Currently, she sells vegetables three days a week as that is the only time that there are tricycles to rent, which is how she gets to the market. She is requesting to avail of a loan amounting to PHP 9,000 to expand her business. She hopes to be able to use any increase in profits to expand the education of her children.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Ali's Group

texts.en: Ali is a 34-year-old married man with one child. He has been a taxi driver for the past five years. Today, Ali is hoping to borrow $1,200 to be able to fix his taxi.

loans.use: To fix his taxi

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Carolina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas de Jorge Chávez II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 57 años, 03 hijos ya independientes y con familia.

El haber pasado por momentos muy duros durante su vida, le motivo a emprender su propio negocio de venta de lubricantes, nos cuenta que se inicio desde abajo y lleva 05 años dedicándose a este negocio,  ubicada en su misma casa. Luego con su primer prestamo de Manuela Ramos y con su apoyo siguió invirtiendo mas, hasta la fecha su negocio se encuentra surtido de diferentes productos que ofrece a sus clientes, en el barrio ya es muy conocida  tiene muy buenas ventas al día y al mes.

Sus principales clientes son chóferes de autos, volvos y motocarristas y motociclistas que a diario acuden a su tienda a comprar porque en ella  encuentran todo los productos que necesitan para sus unidades motorizadas y es quien personalmente les atiende  con su carisma que la caracteriza.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, lo invertirá comprando lubricantes como: 05 baldes de Aceites Castrol y Shell, otros productos como pernos de rueda, centrales, abrazaderas, cámaras y ponchos.

Carolina, como mujer se siente muy contenta con lo logrado a lo largo de su vida, y con mayor esfuerzo desea ver a sus hijos profesionales. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por haberla ayudado  a superararce y realizarse como empresaria.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carolina is a member of the Community Bank "Las Estrellitas Jorge Chavez II", Tarapoto district - San Martin Province, San Martín state. She is a 57 year old woman and has 3 children who are independent and have their own family.

She went through very hard times during her life and got motivated to start her own business selling engine oils. She has been in the business for 5 years and is it is located at her home. She invested Manuela Ramos' first loan in the business and currently offers a variety of products to her customers. She is well known in the neighborhood and has very good sales per day and per month. Her main customers are car drivers, motorcyclists and moto-taxi drivers that daily come to her store because of the variety of products she offers. She is who personally take care of the customers with her charisma.

She is asking for a loan of $350 that will use to buy engine oils and other products such as wheel bolts, centers, cameras and ponchos. As a woman feels very happy with what she has accomplished throughout her life, and hopes to see her children as professionals. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her to be an entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower makes dairy products with the milk that her 15 cows produce. Right now, she is making cheeses and manjar (a caramel-like spread) to sell in local markets.  A small container of manjar sells for $1 US, and a small mold of cheese sells for approximately 75 cents. 

She is a native of Tambo Real, a rural community that is located in the Zurite district of Anta, approximately an hour and a half from the city of Cusco. She is 41 years old, married and has three children. 

This borrower plans to use this loan to help finish building the house where she and her family reside. She will purchase cement, stones and blocks needed for construction.

She is a member of the Real Solidarity Bank, made up of 14 members who are in their second loan cycle with Arariwa. They are collectively committed to repaying the loan on time, and are also collaborating in a group savings account that serves as emergency funds for their members.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for home

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es: Ángela G. O. reside en Rosario de La Paz departamento de  La Paz. A sus  41 años de edad es una madre soltera con 4 hijos aun menores de edad. Ángela es una mujer muy trabajadora y sonriente lo cual la ha sacado adelante y ver la vida con una manera entusiasta y es así como ella maneja su negocio con energía la cual hace que sus clientes la prefieran en el mercado municipal, con doce años de experiencia en el negocio sus ventas son estables y muy buenas, es por eso que Ángela solicita un crédito ya que sus ventas aumentan y ella quiere  comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima para su comida, de esta manera lograra obtener mayores ingresos que son de gran utilidad para ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ángela G. O. lives in Rosario de La Paz in the La Paz department. She is 41, a single mother, and has four minor children. Ángela is a hard working, cheerful woman. This has helped her get ahead and view life enthusiastically. That is how she energetically runs her business, and it makes her customers prefer her over other vendors in the municipal market. She has 12 years of experience in the business. Her sales are very good and stable. That is why Ángela is asking for a loan. Her sales are increasing, and she wants to buy a larger quantity of raw materials for her food. This way she will get greater earnings, which are extremely useful to her and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 45-year-old widow and mother of three children – one daughter and two sons – who are currently in school. She lives with them in a rented apartment in a commercial town. Sarah is a hardworking woman who sells groceries such as Milo, biscuits, cooking oil, sugar, soap, etc. She has been in business for six years now and wants a loan to buy more groceries to expand her business. She is hoping to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Concepción Vicenta

texts.es: Concepción Vicenta R. reside en el oriente del país en el departamento de San Vicente. Concepción cuenta con 57 años de edad y vive con su esposo don Jorge quien se dedica a la agricultura en tierras de San Vicente. Hace treinta años Concepción monto su primer negocio, el cual es ahora su mayor fuente de ingresos , es una tienda  ubicada en su casa con productos de consumo, Concepción posee una clientela estable por ser muy conocida en su Cantón y por no tener competencia a sus alrededores; el crédito que solicita en para surtir su tienda con cereales y bebidas que son solicitadas por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Concepción Vicenta R. lives in the eastern part of the country, in the department of San Vicente. Concepción is a 57-year-old woman who lives with her husband, Jorge, who is a farmer in the area. Thirty years ago, Concepción launched her very first business—an in-home general store—which is now her main source of income. She has a fixed clientele because she is very well-known in her canton as she has no competition nearby. The loan that she is requesting will be used to restock her shop with the grains and beverages that her customers request.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock general store

loans.name: Los Picaflores Group

texts.es: El grupo “Los picaF.” esta conformado por 14 personas alegres y trabajadoras, tienen una amistad desD. hace mucho tiempo y sus edades varían desD. 19 hasta 63 años.  La presidenta Cristina tiene 2 hijos pequeños los mismos van a la escuela primaria, ella al igual que sus compañeras se dedica a la venta D. productos venta D. carteras, el resto D. los miembros del grupo se dedica a la venta D. verduras, venta D. ropa interior,  venta D. abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, comida y al servicio D. limpieza domestica;  algunos D. sus puestos D. venta son fijos y otras son ambulantes. Sus competidores D. negocios están presentes, pero las señoras tienen clientes fieles que adquieren productos constantemente, en caso D. dificultades en sus negocios, diversifican su actividad comercial para obtener ingresos, algunas D. ellas empiezan a trabajar medio tiempo con un sueldo fijo en actividades D. limpieza D. viviendas y  el otro medio tiempo atienden su negocio. Las socias quieren aprovechar las ofertas D. cosméticos por catálogos adquiriendo más mercadería e insumos para generar un mayor ingreso para poder brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida.  Las socias esta emprendiendo su tercer ciclo demostrando ganas D. salir adelante, responsabilidad, honradez y sobre todo unión que es lo esencial en un grupo solidario. Este grupo esta emprendiendo su primer ciclo pero en la reuniones han demostrando ganas D. salir adelante, responsabilidad, honradez y sobre todo unión que es lo esencial en un grupo solidario

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
28-year-old Juvy Baustista is a new member of ASHI. Because of her membership, she had an opportunity to request for a loan which she will be using for stating up her own business. Juvy thought of maximizing the product most produced in their municipality for her business to help people in marketing. Thus, loan she requests will be used as a starting capital for her rice buy and sell business.  Profit of this business will be a great source of income for the family and great means to augment the small income of her husband being a delivery boy. 

Juvy hoped that through loans she can request through ASHI, she will be able to grow her business and increase her profit thus enabling her to send all of her two children whose age range is from nine months to four years old until graduating from college.

loans.use: Will be used to pay for purchasing rice for a rice buy and sell business.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 27 years old and a single man. He is applying for his fourth loan with KADET. He plans to buy a motorcycle to use to transport produce and other goods  to market, to expand business and open a milk bar. This will enable him to increase customers and sources of income.  He came to know about KADET through market outreach in Juja town.

With the extra profit he earns he intends to expand his business and open a dairy outlet.  His future hope is to open a transport business.

Lawrence can be described as a very hardworking man, he says "I am determined and never give up on what I am pursuing despite the challenges. My motto is: never give up, keep moving forward."

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use to transport goods to market

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophat A. lives in Spha village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Ton Vantha, are farmers who own a piece of land that they use to cultivate rice to earn for living. In this plantation, they have a problem because their field is far from the irrigation system. Thus, Mrs. Sophat A. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a machine to pump water to support their rice field.

Aside from the plantation, Mrs. Sophat A.’s husband is also a construction worker. This couple has three children, one of whom is attending the local school and the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a machine to irrigate their rice field

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 50 years old and married with four children between 11 and 25 years old. He sells second-hand clothes and has operated the business since 1995. Previously, he was a distributor of soda and snacks. He is requesting a loan for Kes. 50,000 to buy three bales of used clothes. 
In the future, Joseph would like to further expand his business and keep saving so that he can buy a plot of land for his family. He describes himself as hardworking and goal-oriented.

loans.use: To buy three bales of used clothes

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Mr. Sitha C., age 49, and his wife, Mrs. Sambok Se, 37, were married in 1992 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. All of them are in school. They live in a small village on National Road number 2, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sitha has been selling cows for more than 10 years. He buys cows from the nearby district and sells them to a middleman who comes to buy them at his house. His wife stays at home and does housework. 

Sitha is requesting his first loan of $150 to help purchase cows for resale.

loans.use: To buy cows for resale.

loans.name: Mab

texts.en: Mr. Mab P. is 40 years old and lives with the other members of his family in a small wooden house in Kompong Tom province. He and his wife earn a living by making rattan cupboards, and have been in this line of work for many years. He has applied for this loan to buy a horse to carry his products to market for sale. (Mab P. was not available on the day we took this photo, so we see his wife here instead of him.)

loans.use: To buy a horse to carry his products to market

loans.name: Mujeres Esforzadas Group

texts.en:
Horimena, a 28 year old woman, is the leader of the group Mujeres Esforzadas (Hard-working Women), and her story reflects those of the other women in her group. She is a single mother of two children living in Puerto Plata, a port town in the northern Dominican Republic. It is a tourism-based area which experiences constant economic volatility, lacks access to potable water, and has unreliable electricity and inadequate sanitation and health care. 

Horimena has sought a loan from Esperanza to help expand her street vending business, which provides a variety of goods. She will use the money from this loan to buy five pots, four quilts, four pairs of pants, and various other household and clothing items. 

Horimena wants to continue meeting and working with Esperanza to further develop and expand her business. She dreams that the long-term success of her business will enable her to buy a home, and eventually a television, for her and her two children. She is grateful for the support of Esperanza and their involvement in the realization of her dreams. Thank you for lending to Horimena and Mujeres Esforzadas!

loans.use: to purchase pots, quilts and pants

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita I. is a 33-year-old married woman living in the green farm country of the Rizal province town of Morong. She has two minor children. One child is a college student and the other is a nursery student. Over the years, she has provided for her family by raising and slaughtering hogs and by selling Avon products in her village.

This loan of 28,000 Philippine pesos is for hog fattening, a common business for people in her area suffering from poverty. She will buy ten small piglets, five sacks of feed, and supplements and vitamins for the piglets. She will raise them for approximately four to six months until they are ready for sale.

Her biggest dream is to have a successful pig farm someday. She believes this opportunity will give her the confidence to succeed while helping her family rise out of poverty. The financial opportunity of hog fattening is one of the best ways to help provide for her family and she very much wants to lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: To purchase piglets, feed, supplements and vitamins

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina, de 56 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Luis (55) y sus jóvenes hijos; María (25), Jhonny (19) y Judith (17).
Desde hace 5 años, esta trabajadora mujer, se dedica a la venta de chupetes (adoquines de hielo sabor a fruta). Ella misma los prepara desde las 5 de la mañana, todos los días, con la ayuda de su esposo y una de sus hijas y  luego los distribuye a las tiendas de su localidad. Como ya cuenta con una clientela fija, sus ganancias son seguras, es por esta razón que para el futuro quiere ampliar sus puntos de venta y obtener mayores ganancias. Además sus productos tienen bastante demanda durante la época de verano y debe aprovechar en vender mayor cantidad.

Este es el 4to préstamo que ha solicitado con MFP y promete ser puntual en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas, ya que no desea fallarle a la entidad ni a ningún integrante de su banco comunal. Josefina ya tiene planeado invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra de los ingredientes para preparar más chupetes.
texts.en:
Josefina is 56 years old and lives in her own house alongside her husband, Luis (55), and their children, María (25), Jhonny (19) and Judith (17). For the past 5 years, this hard-working woman has dedicated herself to selling popsicles (blocks of fruit-flavored ice). She prepares them herself, starting at 5 in the morning every day, with the help of her husband and one of her daughters. She then distributes them to the stores in her area. Since she already has a fixed customer base, her profits are steady, and for this reason, she would like to broaden her points of sale and obtain greater returns. In addition, there is great demand for her products during the summer season, and she feels she should take advantage of this to sell in larger quantities. This is the 4th loan Josefina has requested with MFP, and she promises to be punctual in making all of her payments, since she does not want to let down the organization or any of the members of her communal bank. Josefina plans to invest the funds from the loan in purchasing ingredients to prepare more popsicles.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ingredients for her popsicles

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 32 years old and married with six children, five of whom are attending school. He is a farmer near Litein in Western Kenya. He's been farming for three years and is already able to employ two people. He sells his milk through the Kenya Cooperative Creameries and also earns some income from small-scale farming of cash crops. He says that the main challenges to his business are the market for milk and price saturation for it.

He previously completed a loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 20,000 and requested this loan for Kes. 50,000 to purchase and insure another dairy cow. He says that the extra income he'll earn will raise his family's standard of living and help him pay his children's school fees. In the future, he would like to have at least three grade cows that can produce at least 15 liters a day each.

Thomas thanks Juhudi Kilimo for the work they are doing to improve the living standards of the poor.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Enith Deysi

texts.es: Enith tiene  23 años, vive en su  casa propia, en compañía de sus padres.Casi toda su vida  ha estado ligada al comercio de productos alimenticios, porque sus padres se han dedicado a esta actividad siempre. En la actualidad trabaja en la venta y comercialización de productos comestibles, es su principal fuente de ingresos que le permite ayudar a su familia y sostenerse económicamente, Enith viaja los fines de semana a las zonas rurales de su localidad para vender diversos abarrotes; como arroz, azúcar y menestras, al por menor. Como su mercadería esta compuesta de productos de primera necesidad, tiene rápida salida, de esta manera  obtiene  buenas ganancias de las ventas, lo que le  llena de ánimo para continuar en este negocio .Para el futuro desea aumentar su mercadería  y mejorar así en el abastecimiento de sus productos. Es la octava oportunidad que tiene un crédito  con MFP y  esta muy agradecida con todas las  personas que hacen posible el préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando, además  se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas.El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de  abarrotes al por mayor, ya que quiere aumentar la producción, y continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Enith, 23, lives in her own home with her parents. Most of her life she has been associated with food sales because her parents have been in this business always. She currently is in the food retail business; this is the main source of income that helps her family support itself. On the weekend, Enith travels to rural areas of her community to sell various groceries like: rice, sugar and vegetables at retail. Because her stock is mostly basic needs items, she sells out rapidly,obtaining good profits on her sales; this motivates her to continue. For the future, she would like to increase her inventory and improve her product supply. This is her 8th loan with MFP and she is very grateful to all the persons who make the loan possible for it will allow her to continue working. Besides, she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. The funds requested will be used to buy groceries at wholesale so that she can increase production and continue to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona Banjo is a 51-year old married woman who lives in Brgy Butong, Manjuyod, Negros Oriental.  She earns her living by running her general store and by buying and selling livestock, banana, corn and dried fish.

Chona and her husband have 4 children who are adult age. Two of them have their own families while one attends school.  Their other girl helps her mother run the general store business.

Chona joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004.  With the help of her loans to run her business, from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase her family's income.  Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 6,000.

Chona is a loan member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 29,500 was used to fund operations of her general store, and had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions.  Now she is borrowing for her 14th cycle loan, the amount of Php 29,000, she intends to buy and sell of livestock, banana, corn and dried fish business.  Chona is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.
--------------------------------
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en: Irina is an entrepreneur from Kamenka. She rents a vending stall in one of the market stores to sell groceries. However, the store could be closed any day leaving Irina out in the street. She is seeking a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to buy a vending kiosk in the local market. She has been in the business for 11 years and has about 100,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her profit amounts to 7,000 to 8,000 Grivnyas a month. Irina is hoping to expand her trade and later re-construct this vending kiosk into a small grocery store. She has promptly repaid 9 previous loans without any delinquencies.

loans.use: to purchase a vending kiosk in the local marketplace

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina D. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 44 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Josefina operates a service-based business, providing boarding houses and rooms for rent to students and mall employees. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $350 a month from these activities.

In 2006, Josefina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 26,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to renovate some rooms. 

Josefina is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovations. She wants to renovate gradually and beautify her boarding house so as to attract more boarders. This will be her 9th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in renovations

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new shop and some essential cosmetics

loans.name: Sok Khum

texts.en: Mrs. Sok Khum L., who is 48 years old, lives in Krang Thmey village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Ye Chea, are farmers. They own more than one-hectare of land on which they grow crops to sell to support their famiL.. Their problem is that their field's soil has become infertile. To improve production, Mrs. Sok Khum L. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, while the rest of the loan will be used to hire some farm laborers. Through their farming they support five children, two of whom are helping their parents with the farming, while the others are attending the local public school. Mrs. Sok Khum L. and Mr. Ye Chea are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma and her family live in Multan, Pakistan. Najma's husband is very talented and creative in his work. He is involved in the business of making and selling bangle bracelets. He learned this art from his uncle because he worked for his uncle for several years. He started his own business five years ago. Now he sells the bangles to the neighboring areas and in the bangle shops as well. He takes orders from big jewelry shops and delivers the finished goods on time. 

Najma's husband wants to improve his business by adding more variety to his stock. Therefore, Najma has applied for a loan from Asasah (microfinance institute in Pakistan) for her husband so that he can purchase materials such as plastic, beads and glass in bulk in order to make a variety of bangles and expand the business.

loans.use: Purchase material for making bangles

loans.name: Jenesusa

texts.en:
Jenesusa A. is from the village of Santiago, Iligan City. She is 42 years old. Jenesusa is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Jenesusa owns & operates a business venture in the services sector providing recycling services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from hauling plastic, metal, bottle scraps, and other recyclables for local businesses and community members. Jenesusa has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2009, Jenesusa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenesusa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase plastics and other recyclables. Jenesusa is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jenesusa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Obdulia

texts.es:
La Sra. Obdulia S., tiene 53 años de edad, es soltera, tuvo 3 hijos, todos mayores e independientes.
La Sra. Obdulia se dedica hace más de 30 años a la  compra- venta de articulos deportivos, perfumes, cosméticos generales, jeans, camisas y demás artículos de vestir a créditos, sus principales clientes son los empleados de las fabricas cercanas a su domicilio, como también los empleados de estaciones de servicios. 
Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías como: jeans, calzados deportivos, camisas, celulares, perfumes y otros.
texts.en:
Ms. Obdulia S. is 53 years old, single, and has three children who are all grown-up and independent now. Ms. Obdulia has devoted over 30 years to buying and selling sporting goods, perfumes, cosmetics, jeans, shirts, and other items of clothing on credit. Her main customers are the employees of the factories near her house, as well as employees of nearby service stations. She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise like: jeans, athletic footwear, shirts, cell phones, perfumes, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy jeans, athletic footwear, shirts, cell phones, perfumes, and other items

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia nació en la ciudad de Urubamba a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad junto con su hijo Manuel. Alicia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora pues siempre está trabajando y así es la única forma de darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo. Alicia es profesora y trabajo en varios colegios como “La Salle” y otros. Actualmente, Alicia trabaja en el colegio “Jesús Lambarry” en la comunidad de Huallocari de Urubamba. Alicia también participa en un teatro “Cusi Wasi”. Ya son 6 años que participa en el teatro y le va muy bien. Hace tres años su pareja la abandono por otra mujer, y se quedo sola al cuidado de su hijo de cuatro años. 
	
Decidida a empezar nueva vida, busco mas oportunidad de trabajo y sus compañeros del teatro le motivaron para que pueda confeccionar disfraces y vestimentas típicas de la región. Ella actualmente tiene varias vestimentas que alquila a los integrantes del teatro y al público en general. Un flujo regular de clientes la buscan para alquilar sus trajes de danzas. 
   
Con su próximo préstamo, Alicia espera recibir S/. 1700 nuevos soles. Por el momento, su taller de confección esta modestamente equipado con las necesidades más básica. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo telas, hilos, botones y muchas cosas más.

Alicia pertenece al banco comunal  “Señor de Torrechayoc”. En el año 1994 se abrió el banco comunal pero Alicia, participa desde hace dos ciclos atrás y le va muy bien. El nombre que le pusieron al banco comunal es en homenaje al patrón jurado de la ciudad de Urubamba pues todos los socios le tienen fe.
texts.en:
Alicia was born in the city of Urubamba, which is one hour and ten minutes from the city of Cusco. She lives in that same city with her son, Manuel. Alicia is a hard-working and enterprising woman who is always working. That is the only way to give her son a better quality of life. Alicia is a teacher, and she has worked in several schools like La Salle and others. Alicia currently teaches at the Jesús Lambarry School in the Huallocari community in Urubamba. Alica also participates in the Cusi Wasi Theater. She has participated in the theater for six years, and it is going very well for her. Her life partner abandoned her for another woman three years ago. She was left alone to take care of her four year old son. Determined to start a new life, she looked for more work opportunities. Her theater colleagues encouraged her to make costumes and typical regional clothes. She currently has several garments that she rents to the members of the theater and the general public. A regular flow of customers seek her out to rent her dance outfits. With her next loan Alicia hopes to receive 1,700 soles. Presently her shop is modestly equipped with the most basic necessities. She would use the money from the loan to buy materials like fabric, thread, buttons, a lots of other things. Alicia belongs to the Señor de Torrechayor Communal Bank. This Communal Bank started in 1994, and Alicia has been participating for two cycles. It is going very well for her. The name of the Communal Bank is a tribute to the patron saint of the city of Urubamba. All of the members have faith in him.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials like fabric, thread, buttons, a lots of other things

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en: Batbayar A. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His elder son is a student while the youngest two children attend a district middle school. Batbayar operates a photographic and copying service in the city with the help of his wife. The two are also earn income from their rental service. His working capital exceeds 5 million MNT and currently his daily earnings are from 30,000  to  40,000 MNT. He is planning on expanding his business in the future by growing his working capital. He is working to afford his children's future education. Batbayar is a modest person and is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to install additional heating in his home where the family is currently living and to increase his working capital.

loans.use: To install additional heating in his home

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba Luz es una pequeña comerciante, madre de cuatro hijos, casada siendo su esposo mecánico.
Es un mujer dedicada al trabajo, vende comida en su especialidad es el vahó. Venta de ropa lo que lo hace ambulante en un mercado. Son quince años en las ventas pues ha hecho su medio de sobrevivencia, ya que todo está ah altos costos.
 Ambos se esfuerzan para logra equilibrar los gastos de consumo de alimentos como gastos básicos, estudios y otros. Día a día hace su comida y viaja hasta su puesto que vende que tiene forrado de plástico el techo y no lograr quemarse tanto del sol, como cuidar los alimentos.
Con este préstamo comprara: granos básicos, carne, pollo, frutas y verduras para lograr la producción de mas alimentos y poder aumentar  las venta para mejorar su economía, ya que muchas veces vende poco y pierde lo que se descapitaliza, y no cuenta con dinero para invertir más, es por este medio viable de los financiamiento que hace posible la inversión.
texts.en:
Alba Luz is a small shopkeeper, mother of four, and married to a mechanic. She is a woman who is very dedicated to her work. She sells food, and her specialty is vahó [a traditional meal of steamed meat and vegetables]. She also sells clothing as a street vendor. Working in sales has been her livelihood for 15 years since everything is very expensive. Both Alba and her husband strive to cover the expenses for food and other basic needs like school. Day after day, Alba makes her food and travels to her stall where she sells it. The stall has a plastic roof that protects the foods and keeps her from being sunburned so much. With this loan she will purchase basic grains, meat, chicken, fruits, and vegetables to produce more foods and increase sales to improve her finances. Many times she sells little and loses capital and doesn’t have money to invest more. Thanks to the the loan, she is able to make the investment.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains, meat, chicken, fruits, and vegetables to make more foods and earn more money

loans.name: Nancy Marlene

texts.es:
