La Señora Nancy Marlene C. es socia del banco comunal Señoras de Taguan, vive en la comunidad de Taguan, que es perteneciente al cantón Sigsig, su gente se dedica a la elaboración de sombreros de paja toquilla, a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.
 
La Señora Nancy se dedica a los quehaceres de la casa, cría  ganado y vende la leche que obtiene, también cría cerdos, borregos, pollos, cuyes y vende sus animales en la feria de Gualaceo.

Doña Nancy es muy joven tiene de 21 años, es casada y tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad, su esposo se dedica a la construcción, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá compartiendo los gastos.
 
Este es su tercer crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, vitaminas y alimento para incrementar su negocio.
 
Su sueño es comprarse un terreno.
texts.en:
Nancy Marlene C. is a member of the Señoras de Taguan [Women of Taguan] community bank. She lives in the Taguan community, which belongs to the Sigsig canton, whose people make straw hats, raise animals and farm. Nancy does housework, raises livestock and sells the milk that she obtains. She also raises hogs, sheep and guinea pigs, and sells her animals in the Gualaceo market. Nancy is very young. She is 21, married and has one 3-year-old child. Her husband works in construction. She does not have her own home because she lives in her mother's home sharing the costs. This is her third loan and she will invest it in the purchase of chickens, vitamins and food to expand her business. Her dream is to buy herself a plot of land.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase chickens, vitamins and animal food.

loans.name: Leonela

texts.en:
Leonela J., from the village of Talon, Gingoog City, is 58 years old, widowed and has eight adult-aged children. To make a living, Leonela owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Leonela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan, her fourth, of 5000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. Leonela plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Hector Jesús

texts.es:
Hector Jesús L. V. tiene 48 anos. Es soltero y vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos de 23 hasta 8 anos.
 
Hector es socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer de Ser Amigos, que está ubicada a 20 minutos de la parroquia San Jose del Tambo. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios.  

Hector trabaja en la agricultura. Cultiva cacao y maíz. Su hijo hace las compras y las ventas de los productos. 

Solicita el crédito para cultivar un terreno (5 cuadraditos) de cacao. Es un terreno que tiene de herencia y recién lo esta empezando a cultivar. Con el apoyo del préstamo podría ampliar mas sus cultivos de cacao. Su sueno es mantener a sus hijos. 
Le gusta salir y divertirse en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Hector Jesús L. V. is 48-years-old.  He is single and lives in the Chillanes district of the Bolívar Province.  He has five children from 23-years-old to 8.  

Hector is a member of the rural solidarity group El Placer de Ser Amigos (The Pleasure of Being Friends) that is located 20 minutes from the parish of San Jose del Tambo.  There are 15 members in total, the majority of whom work growing cacao or with their own small businesses.

Hector works in agriculture.  He grows cacao and corn.  His son makes the purchases and sales of their products.

He is requesting the loan to cultivate a plot (of about 1.5 acres) of cacao.  It is a plot of land that he inherited and recently started to plant.  With the support of the loan he can expand his cultivation of cacao.  His dream is to support his children.  He likes to go out and have fun in his free time.

loans.use: Cultivate a plot of land (about 1.5 acres) with cacao.

loans.name: Kigunda Bakyara Twekambe Group 2-Rukungiri

texts.en:
32 year old T. Amos says close friends prevailed upon him to start up his retail business 10 years ago in Kanoko-Rukungiri. It a business that brings this diligent gentleman 180,000 shillings weekly. 

Amos, for the most part, sells general merchandise ranging from sugar, beans, rice, salt, soap, etc.  Before he ventured into this business, his thoughts were more preoccupied with a small farming business that he still maintains alongside another modest side business in the form of a payphone. Amos is happily married. He has 5 kids, 4 of whom are pursuing their education with vigor. With this loan he says he is going to purchase more general merchandise retail stock for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of more general merchandise retail stock for resales.

loans.name: Norma Victoria

texts.es:
Norma es socia del bancomunal Ccatun Saccha, tiene 47 años y 6 hijos.
Norma, se dedica a la confección de mandiles, blusas, fustanes, centros, los vende en las ferias de Ayacucho, Huanta, Sachabamba, Matará, Seccelambras, aprendió a coser desde niña  con su madre y lo complemento con su esposo pues el es sastre y juntos abrieron una sastrería ahora confeccionan uniformes, ternos, mandiles, blusas y fustanes.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compras de telas, organzas, blondas e hilos.
Desde que está en Finca su vida a cambiado porque ha crecido su negocio. Lo que le gusta de las reuniones de su bancomunal es que puede ahorrar y acceder al crédito. Aprendió mucho en la capacitaciones sobre familia, matrimonio y violencia familiar.
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Ccatun Saccha communal bank.  She is 47 years old and has 6 children.  She sews aprons, blouses, fustanes [skirts], and centros [short dresses made of flannel typically worn by indigenous women].  She sells her wares in the Ayacucho, Huanta, Sachabamba, Matará, and Seccelambras markets.  She learned how to sew as a child with her mother.  Her husband is also a tailor and together they opened a tailor's shop where they make uniforms, three-piece suits, aprons, blouses, and fustanes.

The money from the loan she is requesting will be used to buy fabric, organza, lace and thread.

Working with Finca has changed her life, because her business has grown so much.  What she likes most about her communal bank is that she can save money and access credit.  She has also learned a lot in the family, marriage, and domestic violence trainings.

Her biggest dreams are that her business grows and her children become business professionals.

loans.use: To purchase fabric, organza, lace, and thread

loans.name: Jenishbubu

texts.en:
Jenishbubu S. is 42-year-old widow with two children. She graduated from medical college and worked as a nurse at the local hospital. She was characterized by her colleagues as a very precise and good-natured person.

In 1993, in order to find an additional means of subsistence for her family, Jenishbubu decided to engage in cattle breeding and land cultivating. Her hardworking efforts allowed her to develop her farm to two cows, one horse, ten sheep and to earn her living through selling milk and harvesting.    

Jenishbubu plans to use the loan of 50,000 Kyrgyz Soms to broaden her business by purchasing two milk cows and manure to fertilize her land. With the revenues from this investment, Jenishbubu plans to buy a truck for transporting meat and milk products. 
  
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and fertilizers.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Fifty-two year old Teresita C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has 4 children. Her eldest child is 23 years old and the youngest is 9. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Teresita also owns and manages a sari-sari store where she sells different products.

Teresita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to buy farm inputs and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Laura Aida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ÑAUPASUNCHIS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Laura Aida; ella tiene 62 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de cesante de educación y por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para uso personal para el mantenimiento de su casa.             
                                           
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Laura Aida is a member of the Ñaupasunchis Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco Province, Cusco department.

Laura Aida, age 62, is married and has three children.  She has her daily activities, and she supports her family with her pension as a retired teacher.  That is how she gets her children ahead, but she wants to open a grocery store.

She is requesting the loan for personal use for maintenance on her house.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Personal use for home maintenance

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline I. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 45 years old. Evangeline is married and has 3 children aged 22, 19 and 12. To make a living, Evangeline owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Evangeline has been running her store for 7 years now.

Evangeline joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like soft drinks and canned goods. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina, de 29 años de edad, reside en Santa Elena departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de las edades de 17 y 5 años, son dependientes económicamente, Reina tiene un negocio donde ofrece productos de uso personal, por el momento necesita invertir por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería, como peluches, y accesorios , entre otros que a diario le solicitan los clientes.
Reina tiene ubicado el negocio en su casa, por lo que no tiene un horario fijo para atenderlo, este préstamo le dará la firmeza de tener a disponibilidad de los clientes todo lo necesario para el hogar.
Sus aspiraciones son crecer en el negocio, desarrollarse como comerciante y velar por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Reina, 29, lives in Santa Elena, Usulután department, with her husband and two children who are 17 and 5 years of age.  They are economically dependent. 

Reina has a business selling personal use items.  For the moment she needs to invest so is asking for a loan to buy merchandise like stuffed toys and accessories, among others, that her customers request daily.

Reina’s business is in her house so she does not have a fixed work schedule.  This loan will provide her with a sure way to have everything her customers need for the home.

Her dreams are to grow in business, to develop as a merchant and to watch over her family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: To buy merchndise.

loans.name: Rizza

texts.en:
Rizza O. is from the village of Samay, Gingoog City. She is 31 years old. Rizza is single and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rizza owns & operates a bakeshop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from baking & selling a variety of staple products including bread in the local community. Rizza has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Rizza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rizza is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional cooking ingredients such as flour and eggs. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rizza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional cooking ingredients like flour and eggs

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
ESTE CLIENTE, ES DE MANAGUA, EL TRABAJA DIARIO COMO ENCARGADO DE PROTOCOLO, ES PADRE DE FAMILIA DE UN NIÑO, Y ESTE  ACTUALMENTE DEPENDE DE EL Y SE ENCUENTRA EN EDAD ESCOLAR.
EL ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN NUEVO PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: ARENA, CEMENTO, HIERRO PARA TERMINAR DE CONSTRUIR  DOS PAREDES DE SU CASA DE HABITACION.
TODO ESTO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU CASA DE HABITACION Y BRINDARLES MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIDA A SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
This borrower is from Managua and works as a Protocol Manager.  He is a family man and has a school-aged son who depends on him.

He has applied for a new loan through CEPRODEL to make home improvements.  He wants to buy construction materials such as sand, cement and iron to build two walls in his house.

His goal is to improve his environment and provide his family with the best living conditions possible.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Flor Elisa

texts.es:
La Sra. Flor tiene 24 años, vive en el Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valerosas II”, tiene 1 hijo en edad escolar.

Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, ya tiene buen tiempo en este negocio y afirma que le va bien. El negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, lugar donde acuden diariamente sus clientes fijos, amigos del barrio, vecinos y moradores de otras calles aledañas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500 Nuevos Soles, comprará abarrotes en general cómo arroz y azúcar en sacos, leche en tarros, aceite en galones, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaños, papel higiénico en paquetes, detergentes, jabones de diferentes aromas y parte del dinero lo invertirá en los productos de belleza que vende, esta actividad sirve de apoyo para solventar otros gastos menores.

Flor es una mujer trabajadora, carismática y con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando porque le gusta lo que hace, su meta es continuar con el negocio, implementarlo más y que se haga más conocido aún. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir a su crecimiento y el de otras mujeres que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Flor is 24 years old and she lives in the district of Tarapoto in the department of San Martin.  She is a member of the Communal Bank named "Courageous Women II". She has one school-aged son. 

She sells general groceries and she has a good amount of time in the business. She affirms that it has been successful. The business is installed in her house where her steady clients, friends, neighbors, and passers-by shop from her every day. 

With this loan of S/2500 she will purchase grocery store merchandise such as sacks of rice and sugar, bottles of milk, cooking oil by the gallon, boxes of preserves, bathroom tissue, detergents, and soaps. Part of the loan will be invested in beauty products that she wells. This business helps her cover her minor expenses.

Flor is a hardworking woman who is charismatic and eager to keep working because she loves what she does. Her goal is to continue with her business and to have it well stocked so that it will become even more well-known. She is thankful to the Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) movement for contributing to her development and to other women who are in need.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock her general store

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel O. S. is 36 years old, married and blessed with three children. He sells green bananas to earn a living. Daniel has been in business for five years. He works hard so as to provide for his family.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Daniel has grown his business. He hopes to open another business in the future to earn more income. He has requested a loan for 20,000 KES to add to his stock of bananas.

loans.use: To add to his stock of bananas

loans.name: Jusper

texts.en:
Jusper O. M. is a 35-year-old married man with three children.  

He repairs electronic goods such as mobile phones to earn a living for his family. He gets a good number of customers in a day. Jusper has been operating the business for eleven years.  

Through Faulu Kenya, he has been able to buy tools for repairing electronic goods. He needs 50,000 KES to buy a mobile phone repair software kit.

loans.use: to buy a mobile phone repair software kit

loans.name: Rosemary Enole

texts.en:
Rosemary Enole I., 39 years old, is a married mother of five children. She is a businesswoman who deals with groceries which she has been doing for the last fifteen years. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a registered client. This is her first loan from KADET and she is planning to buy more cereals stock of Maize and Beans in sacks which she will hawk around the market places for sale during market day. She hopes to use the profits from this loan to reinvest back into her business. 

Her hopes and her dream is to become a great businesswoman. She is a brisk woman who is dedicated to her work and who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy more cereals stock

loans.name: Kiira Development Group

texts.en: S. Soprano, 46, with hand raised, operates a retail shop in Kiira in Mukono. He has been in this business for a decade and says it has been worthwhile. The father of five, he says he was inspired by one of his close friends to start this business.  Before that he was engaged in brick making. Monthly he says this business generates him shillings 150,000 and with this loan he will purchase more retail goods to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail goods to sell

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is 21 years old and single. He works in air conditioner maintenance and has been doing so for four years. In 2009 he opened his own shop. Mohamad has a good reputation as his experience helps in making his customers rely on him anytime they face a slight problem with their air conditioners
.
Mohamad is requesting his first loan from Al Majmoua in order to be prepared for the summer high season since most of his clients ask for a check-up before the hot season begins. He will use the loan to buy necessary hardware and spare parts that he might need.  Mohamad hopes to use the income he will earn this summer to cover his house ceiling which he recently started building.

loans.use: To purchase hardware necessary for his business

loans.name: Ferdos

texts.en: Ferdos is a 43-year-old hardworking mother. After her husband passed away she was left with seven children under the age of eighteen to raise. In order to support her family she needed to find a job that would not keep her away from her children. So, three years ago, she bought a sewing machine and knitting tools, and started sewing clothes and cover sheets, and knitting scarves and gorgeous girls' dresses. Now Ferdos is applying for a loan to buy another sewing machine that will help her work more quickly and increase her productivity.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more slippers and sandals for her business.

loans.name: Benkadi  1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi 1  est constitué de femmes mariées du village de DIGAN dans la sous préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU, région de KOULIKORO (deuxième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 45  ans,  6 enfants et  cultivent de l’arachide et du gombo.   
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont à leur  cinquième  prêt  de campagne.
MOUSSONI, la première debout à droite,  compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, de la semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles,  au grand marché de OUELESSEBOUGOU. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de OUELESSEBOUGOU, BAMAKO et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail, au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 50.000 à 65.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi 1 group consists of married women from the village of Digan, in the Subprefecture of Ouelessebougou, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali). They live in traditional families and average 45 years of age with six children. They grow peanuts [ground nuts] and “gombo” [okra]. 

In order to make their agricultural work profitable, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are now on their fifth harvest-cycle loan. 

Moussoni, standing on the far right in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy peant seeds, small tools and agricultural inputs [such as fertilizers, pesticides etc] at the big market of Ouelessebougou. After the winter seasons, the harvested produce is stocked for a while until it gains enough value to be sold at the big market of Ouelessebougou, in Bamakao and at other nearby markets, retail, for cash, to customers mainly coming from large towns. After selling their produce, the group members plan to earn a profit between 50,000 and 65,000 West African Francs each, which will be used to repay the loan interest and cover ongoing family expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and small tools

loans.name: Amílcar

texts.es: Amílcar de 37 años de edad, habita en casa alquilada con su compañera de vida y su hijastro. Él se dedica a la venta de ropa. Hace varios años que posee el negocio y gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien. Cuenta con muchos clientes ya que las personas lo prefieren por la calidad y variedad en sus productos y sobre todo por su carisma, siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa y con mucha disposición. El sueña con ver su negocio florecer y poder satisfacer a más clientes que le permitan aumentar sus ventas y su nivel de ingresos. Esto lo ha llevado a tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar variedad de  prendas de vestir como: pantalones, camisas, ropa interior, etc. con esto espera lograr su sueño y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Amilcar (37 years old) lives in a rented house with his life partner and his stepson.

He sells clothing. He has had the business for many years, and thanks to God it has gone very well for him. He has many customers since people prefer him because of the quality and variety of his products, and above all because of his charisma. He always greets his customers with a smile and in a good mood.

He dreams of seeing his business flourish and of being able to satisfy more customers, which will allow him to increase his sales and his level of income. This has led him to ask INTEGRAL for this loan to buy a variety of clothing like: pants, shirts, underwear, etc. With this, he hopes to reach his dream and improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Ivan Arturo

texts.en:
Ivan lives and works in Pedro Vicente Maldonado, a canton in the west of the province of Pichincha in Ecuador. Pedro Vicente Maldonado, named after the 18th-century Ecuadoran scientist Pedro Vicente Maldonado, has a pleasant subtropical climate and is known for its natural beauty and agricultural economy. 

Ivan is twenty-one years old and is single. He lives with his mother Rita who, at 44 years old, works in their food stall. In his spare time, Ivan plays sports and plans for the development of his business.

This is Ivan's first loan with Fundación Alternativa. Ivan will use this loan to buy pigs and feed. He works long hours--from 6 a.m. to 5 p.m., but he hopes to expand his business and his dream is to one day own and operate his own full-service farm.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda lives in Isabela. She is married and has one child. Erlinda has a business selling bananas, cabbages and tomatoes. She has been in this business for six months, and she works six days out of every week. Erlinda sells her products from home. 

Erlinda has requested a loan of 6,000 Philippines pesos, which she will use to buy more vegetables and fruits. The main business challenges for Erlinda include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start growing tomatoes and to own a delivery van. Erlinda lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expense is feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, tomatoes, eggplants and pineapples.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bertha; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de elaboración de productos lácteos como yogurt y también la socia trabaja como docente de nivel inicial y los productos lácteos lo vende en forma ambulatoria repartiendo a las diferentes tiendas y al público en general, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de elaboración de productos lácteos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer los yogures como leche y azúcar.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "IMASUMAC I", which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Bertha is 40, has a common-law husband and two children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business making dairy products such as yogurt.  She also works as a beginning level teacher.  She sells the dairy products door to door and distributes them to different stores and the public in general.  She wants to expand her dairy products line and is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as sugar and milk.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make yogurt, such as milk and sugar.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: Soledad tiene 36 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Vende frutas en un mercadillo de su localidad desde hace 2 años, es así que atiende todas las mañanas hasta la tarde y al finalizar tiene se encarga de la cuentas de las ganancias del día. Pero su día de trabajo empieza cuando debe comprar la mercadería, tanto vegetales y frutas frescas en el mercado mayorista y esto es en la madrugada para luego llevarlo a su puesto de trabajo. Para María este negocio le resulta rentable porque siempre hay personas que compran sus productos. Su mayor anhelo es tener una tienda en su casa, pero le es muy necesario arreglar la infraestructura de su hogar. Es la segunda vez que esta solicitando un crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para concretar sus metas financieras. En esta ocasión el dinero estará destinado al mejoramiento de la infraestructura de su casa, en la colocación de puertas metálicas que falta instalar en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Soledad, age 36, lives with her three children in her own house.  She has been selling fruit at a street marked in her town for two years.  She attends to her business every morning until the afternoon.  To wrap up she has to deal with the accounts of the day’s earnings.  

Her work day begins when she needs to buy the merchandise.  She buys as many vegetables as fresh fruit in the wholesale market.  This is at daybreak in order to then take them to her work place.  This business has been very profitable for María because there are always people who buy her products.

Her greatest desire is to have a store in her house.  But, she really needs to fix up the infrastruction of her house.

This is the second time that she has asked for a loan from MFP.  She hopes to have the support of each one of you in order to make her financial goals a reality.  This time the money will be used for the improvement of the infrastructure of her house.  Metal doors that are lacking will be installed at her house.

loans.use: to buy metal doors for her house.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 45 years old and lives in Tinago, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental.  She is married with 2 adult and 4 school age children.  Lolita has a shop that sells canned goods, soap, toothpaste, noodles and other retail items.  She has had this business for almost 2 years. 

Lolita has requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase additional inventory such as canned goods, soap, toothpaste, noodles and etc. Lolita has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Lolita hopes to see her children finish college.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory such as canned goods, soap, toothpaste, noodles etc. for her store.

loans.name: Milagros Del Pilar

texts.es:
Milagros de 23 años, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.   Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Milagros se dedica a la venta de ropa, negocio que a colocado en su domicilio desde hace unos un año, su mercadería lo ofrece en su casa a sus clientes, también trae a pedido, tratando de tener mayor demanda de clientes y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus gastos personales.

Al observar que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de ropa y abastecer su tienda con productos innovadores, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando para poder pagar su crédito, mejorar su calidad de vida y para seguir apoyando económicamente a sus padres.
texts.en:
Milagros, age 23, is single and lives with her parents’ house.  The house has no basic services.  It is located in the rural zone of the Olmos district, which is in the Lambayeque department.  The zone is known for its agriculture and its livestock.

Milagros sells clothes.  The business has been located in her home for one year.  She offers her merchandise to her customers in her home.  She also takes orders, trying to have greater customer demand.  That way she will be able to get more income to pay for her personal expenses.

Upon observing that her business is more prosperous every day, she believed she needed to request a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She will use the loan to buy a greater quantity of clothes and to stock her store with innovative products.  She will do this so that she continues to get more customers in order to pay for her loan, improve her quality of life, and to continue financially supporting her parents.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of clothes and to stock her store with innovative products.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 30-year-old single man who describes himself as honest. He operates a charcoal sales business where he sells charcoal to the local people. He has been involved in this business for 1 year. The business is located within a residential area. James describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds.

James will use the Kes 20,000 loan to increase his stock of charcoal. His business goal is to grow his business to wholesale within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will have a family of his own.

loans.use: to increase his stock of charcoal

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru  lives in  Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  Nuru has a business of selling bananas.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week.  Nuru sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale/retail.

Nuru has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas.The main business challenge(s) for Nuru include defaulters and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and also to start going to villages for bananas. Nuru lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, market dues and paying for electricity bills.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 54 years old and presently lives in Upper Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. He is married and has four children at adult ages.

He maintains his business to support himself. He has been in this business for nearly 15 years. He has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase feed for his hog-raising business.

Milagros has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for three years. In the future, Milagros hopes that he can help with the needs of his family and live a god-fearing life.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his hog-raising business.

loans.name: Cenina

texts.es: Cenina es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras, tiene 64 años, es casada y madre de 6 hijos, tiene una bodega, esta en Finca desde hace 4 años, Finca le ayudó a afrontar los momentos mas difíciles de su vida, con la capitaciones que recibió logró ser una persona responsable, puntual, se siente muy bien en Finca, le encanta el ahorro que dice que es mas seguro que en su propia casa, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra arroz, azúcar y otros productos para implementar su bodega.
texts.en: Cenina is a member of the Alondras communal bank. She is 64, married and the mother of six children and has a small grocery store. For four years she has been associated with Finca, which helped her to confront the most difficult time of her life. With the training she received she has become a responsible, punctual person. She is very pleased with Finca. She loves having a nest egg, which she says is more secure than being in her own home. She will invest the loan she is requesting in the purchase of rice, sugar and other products to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and other products to stock her store.

loans.name: Zbs Group

texts.en:
Chengetanai is 31 years of age, married, and has three children. She sells clothes, blankets and shoes in a flea market, which she has been doing for three years. 

Chengetanai is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase clothes, shoes, and blankets to sell.  The challenge that she has been facing in her business is lack of sufficient funds to boost her stock levels in order to cater for the demand in her industry. Chengetanai is working very hard to improve her business and she hopes to operate on a larger scale.

loans.use: to purchase blankets, clothes, and shoes.

loans.name: Ritah

texts.en:
Ritah is 17 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Ritah has been working hard to manage her small business, where she smokes fresh fish and sells it at the local market. 

To help expand her business, Ritah has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fish, and will help Ritah to generate greater profits and take care of herself and her child. Ritah hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a home. 

Ritah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Ritah's future prospects by helping her to learn about what it means to be a woman and about finances.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Pélagie

texts.fr: Agée de 32 ans, Pélagie est mariée à Félicien un commerçant. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants à charge. Pélagie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Pélagie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Pélagie vend depuis huit ans, des produits cosmétiques et plusieurs autres produits nécessaires pour le trousseau d’un bébé. Pélagie s’approvisionne au Nigéria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour élever le niveau de son activité, Pélagie sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Pélagie is 32 years old and married to Félicien, a trader. The couple have 2 children, one of whom attends school. They are also raising 2 children who are not their own. Pélagie lives together with her husband and the children, and the couple both contribute to the household expenses.

Pélagie did not go to school. In order to be able to take care of her needs and those of her children, she has been selling beauty products and articles needed for a baby´s trousseau for the past 8 years. She gets her supplies in Nigeria.

Pélagie is requesting a 3rd loan from ALIDé so that she can restock on products that will enable her to satisfy customer demand and increase her business. She has fully repaid her 2 previous loans.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for resale.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 25-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and one working sibling. 

He works as a human resource manager in a local company and has reached an advanced level in his university but still needs to pay the rest of his study fees.  

For this reason, he’s requesting today to borrow $2,600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his university fees in order to be able to pursue his master’s degree. 

In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans with the ambition to achieve higher educational levels.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en:
Mediatrice is 35 years old. She is married with five children. Two of them are enrolled in school. 

Mediatrice sells foodstuffs which she has been doing for four years. She has requested the loan to buy more foodstuffs such as maize, sorghum and beans to sell. With the profits, she will pay school fees for the children. In the future, she would like to have a big stock.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: Marco Antonio de 49 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su único hermano con quien trabajan muy duro por salir adelante. Marco se dedica a la siembra de frijol y maíz el cual junto a su hermano comercializan en distintos mercados.  Él es una persona que se preocupa mucho por el bienestar de su hogar, razón por la que solicita un préstamo  a INTEGRAL por medio cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de maíz y frijoles y de esta forma sembrar más y hacer crecer la cantidad de cosecha y así  hacer crecer su negocio. Marco sostiene la esperanza de aumentar sus ventas y así contar con una vida estable en donde pueda poseer todo lo necesario para vivir mejor.

loans.use: Compra de frijol y maíz para sembrar e incrementar cosecha.

loans.name: Jose Marcel

texts.es: Marcel de 37 años de edad, habita en una comarca cercana a Managua en casa de sus padres a quienes apoya económicamente, Marcel se dedica a brindar servicios de bufette para eventos especiales, compra cerdos, pelibuey y los destaza para hacer comidas variadas y venderlos. Solicita el crédito para comprar cerdos, pelibuey, carbón y condimentos, para continuar brindando sus servicios a sus clientes.
texts.en: Marcel, 37, lives in a neighborhood near Managua with his parents, who he supports economically. Marcel works providing buffet services for special events. He buys pigs and Pelibüey sheep and then butchers them to make assorted dishes and sell them. He is asking for the loan to buy pigs, Pelibüey sheep, charcoal, and condiments in order to continue providing his services to customers.

loans.use: to buy pigs, Pelibüey sheep, charcoal, and condiments

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie aged 41 years. She is married with 5 children aged between 8 and 20 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 7 years. While her husband is a business man. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a cow for rearing.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Damani's Group

texts.en:
Damani is a simple,humble and a charming lady standing to the extreme left hand side of the photograph.She is married to a vegetable vendor and has an infant son in her care and hails from a village of Koraput district, Odisha,India. Damani belongs to a very low income household and within the limited income of her husband they have access to very limited amount of resources.Damani does not have a toilet facility in her house.She has to depend upon open fields and public toilet which is one hour walk from her home to relieve herself.She gets a lot of pain on her legs after trekking such a long distance and many a times she has fallen ill due to the infections caused by open defecation.

Damani along with her other group members is requesting for a loan amount of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum.She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a new,hygienic toilet at her home with all requisites sanitary fittings attached to it.

The loan amount will help Damani to lead a healthy disease free life and increase her savings which now she is spending on medicines.Damani is eagerly awaiting for your generous hearts to help her.

loans.use: to build a new,hygienic toilet at her home with all requisites sanitary fittings attached to it

loans.name: Onoiva

texts.en:
Onoiva is married with 7 children.

She joined the SPBD program in 2003 and has been running a small business activity of making and selling donuts. She sells the donuts in her village and also the local school. The picture shows the equipment she uses to make her donuts.

She has used her SPBD loans not only for her business but also for home improvement and school fees.

loans.use: Home improvement and school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Veronica Wanjiru Ngaruiya intends to develop her dairy farming project through renovation of the cowsheds

loans.name: Rip

texts.en: Mrs. Rip P. is 52 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She  looks after children and cooks meal for the family, while her husband is a construction worker and makes around $3/day, which is hardly enough to service the family's expenses. To supplement their income, three of her children help by working at construction like their farther does. Rip P. is asking for a $1000 loan to purchase construction tools for her sons and her husband's business and the rest is to repair house in order to protect it from the leaking in the coming rainy season.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools and to repair house

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 45 years old, married with 3 grown up children. Her economic activity is farming. She grows passion fruits and french beans. She is a dedicated member of Gatangara Pluto and she has set a good example to the youthful members of the group. She would like to improve her passion fruit sales by expanding her fruit farming project. She is hoping to get a loan but more seedlings and other farm inputs. She is willing to repay her loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: Agnes would like to carry out intensive Passion fruit farming

loans.name: Dionicia Alejandrina

texts.es:
Working in agriculture and livestock has helped Dioncia and her family to overcome the tremendous loss of her husband. 15 years ago she was forced to learn to take on alone the responsibility of obtaining and education for 6 children, something that was not an easy task. Thanks to her organizational skills and care she has been able to maintain stability in her home. Dionicia’s great knowledge regarding her profession have allowed her to produce good quality and variety, but it has still not been enough. That is why she would like to make a greater investment in livestock so that she can increase her income. She would like to earn enough to contribute to the costs of her last child’s university education. Dionicia is requesting a $450 loan which she has agreed to pay within 6 months. She appeals to the generous hearts of those who can grant her this assistance.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

La agricultura y ganadería han ayudado a Dionicia y a su familia a superar la enorme pérdida de su esposo. Hace 15 años ha aprendido a lidiar sola con la responsabilidad que genera la educación de 6 hijos, ya que la tarea no es nada fácil, pero gracias a su entereza y capacidad de organización ha obtenido estabilidad dentro de su hogar. El enorme conocimiento que posee respecto a estas actividades ha hecho que tenga mucha calidad y variedad pero aún no es suficiente puesto que ahora desea realizar una mayor inversión en ganadería para que pueda obtener gracias a la inversión mayor rentabilidad. Y de esta manera contribuir con el inicio de la carrera universitaria del último de sus hijos.Dionicia solicita para cumplir este deseo la suma de 450 dólares que se compromete a pagarlos en un lapso de 6 meses y recurre a todos los corazones generosos que a bien pueden otorgarle esta ayuda

loans.use: Investing capitol in livestock business

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Mrs. Alejandrina A. is a mother and is 58 years of age. She is brave, and despite her advancing years, she continues to show her immense diligent spirit through by working hard through all the financial hardships which have presented themselves in her life. She has been able to sustain some financial difficulties with the breeding and sale of some of her hens and roosters. She also provides laundry services for some paying customers and this has also been a help to her.

Currently she is helping the youngest of her 5 children, who is close to graduating from high school and very much wishes to continue his education by attending the small university in their city.

Her pace and hardwork, however, have taken its toll on Alejandrina's health and this is one reason why she would like to formally move her business to the market space in her town. Along with her rooster and hen sales, she'd like to incorporate the selling of some household items to the town's women.

With the help that your generous heart can offer, she'll be able to continue helping her youngest son and will also be able to take better care of her health.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Alejandrina A., es una valiente madre D. familia D. 58 años D. edad, que a pesar D. su avanzada edad sigue mostrando un inmenso espíritu diligente, con el que día a día hace frente a las duras condiciones económicas D. su realidad, a través D. la crianza y venta D. algunas gallinitas y cuyes. Asimismo lava la ropa D. algunas personas, que le pagan por este servicio con el único afán D. incrementar las perspectivas D. su hogar. A través D. su desempeño en estas actividades apoya al menor D. sus cinco hijos, quién está próximo a terminar su secundaria y tiene muchos deseos D. seguir una carrera universitaria en las aulas D. la pequeña universidad D. su ciudad. Su arduo desempeño ha perjudicado considerablemente la salud D. esta abnegada señora, por lo que desea enormemente poder tener un negocio en el mercado para dedicarse íntegramente a este espacio D. ventas, con el propósito D. ofertar sus artículos a las reinas del hogar que a diario visitan las instalaciones D. este lugar en busca D. artículos D. primera necesidad. Con el apoyo que vuestro generoso corazón le otorgue, podrá seguir apoyando a su menor hijo y también cuidará D. su salud D. una mejor manera.

loans.use: Loan will be used to rent a space where she can sell her products in her city's central market.

loans.name: Francis Dalia

texts.es:
Ms. Francis Dalia B. H. is originally from the city of Bluefields.  She is 46 years old and married to Carlos Gutiérrez.  Both have 2 daughters who are college students.  Ms. B. is the owner of a grocery store; she has 20 years of experience.  Her customers are family men/women who like to come to her store for the variety of products it offers.  Ms. B. needs to buy 1 freezer which costs $535.  This investment will also allow her to buy more dairy products and sausages to meet her customers' demands.

 Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator. 

La Sra. Francis Dalia B. H. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 46 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Carlos Gutiérrez ambos tiene 2 hijas que estudian en la universidad. La Sra. B. es propietaria de una pulpería, tiene 20 años de experiencia,  sus clientes son los padres de familia  que la prefieren por ofrecer variedad de productos. La Sra. B. necesita compra 1 freezer que le cuesta $535.00 dólares, con esta inversión podrá comprar más productos lácteos y embutidos para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Cicih

texts.en: Cicih J., 36, is a mother of 2 children. Her husband, Wawan, is a private driver who earns US$53 a month. In order to earn extra income for the family, Cicih sells candy door-to-door and to shops nearby, earning US$3 a day. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of US$100 to increase her business capital so she could pay for her children's education. Cicih promises to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Increase of business capital

loans.name: Aleksi

texts.en: Aleksi A. is 34 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in the village of Barzina, near Vratza. Aleksi works in a ferrous metals factory, but he also breeds three cows and wants to buy one more.

loans.use: To buy one more cow

loans.name: Busanzi. A. North B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jane B.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase another fridge. Jane is 35 years old and is married. She has 7 children ranging from age 3 to 15 and her children go to school. Each week, Jane makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy goats for rearing.

Jane is joined in her small group by Jane N., Mariam K., Aida K., and Aida N.. Jane N. has a business selling charcoal and maize and wants to add to her charcoal business. Mariam K. is currently operating a business in clothing sales and wants a loan to invest in her business. Aida K. operates a business selling clothes and wants to purchase more clothes. Aida N. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add more stock.

loans.use: To add to retail shop business

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto is divorced and has 2 children, 25 and 22. He started his business when he decided to leave the state of Guerrero for Queretaro. Three years ago, he realized that he could set up a seafood business, something common in his hometown and a business he knew very well. From his trailer, he makes a living selling seafood, offering his products in various cities.

Alberto is now applying for a US$250 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy merchandise. With your help, he will be able to move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

José Alberto es divorciada y tiene 2 hijos de 25 y 22 años. Inicio su negocio cuando decidió dejar el estado de Guerrero para irse a vivir a Querétaro, hace 3 años entonces se dio cuenta que podía poner un negocio de mariscos que es común en su ciudad natal, por lo que el conocía perfecto del tema, en su remolque se dedico a venderlos ofreciéndolos en diversas ciudades.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprara mercancía. Con tu apoyo don Alberto saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Fautina

texts.en:
Fautina O.  sells used clothing. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a driver. Business is doing very well but  she wishes to increase sales. She is running out of stock.
	
She is asking for $200 as additional capital to buy more used clothing for sale.

loans.use: As an additional capital to buy more clothing for sale.

loans.name: Raila

texts.en: Raila N. lives in the Kairokkum region of Tajikistan and is married with six children. For the last 30 years, Mrs. N. has made a living by raising livestock and selling various products made from milk. She went into this line of work when she was a child helping her mother. Her many years of experience in this trade have made her very skilled at what she does. Mrs. N. has applied to Kiva for a loan to buy one more cow for milking. She will repay the loan in six months.

loans.use: to buy a new cow to produce milk.

loans.name: Fazlidin

texts.en: A. Fazlidin is 21 years old. He has been a farmer since he was 18. He has been working for the past 3 years, and has used his income to support himself and his family. He grows a variety of vegetables and produce, including tomatoes, potatoes, carrots, and cabbage. Fazlidin has made plans this year to attend the University, and due to a slow planting season, needs money to jump-start his crops. He would then use the money earned from his crops to attend University, and acquire a higher education.

loans.use: Purchasing of the seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Kosar Muhammd Saleem Group

texts.en:
Kosar Parveen is the wife of M. S.. She lives in Multan, Pakistan. Kosar baji owns a two room brick house. She is the mother of four children, two sons and two daughters.

Kosar baji has a business making and selling decorative embroidered scarves. Her daughters help her in this business. Kosar baji's husband sells vegetables. He has been in this profession for the last 5 years. Kosar baji has successfully completed two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). With the profit from these two loans, she renovated the house and improved the family's financial condition. Now she is applying for a loan to expand her scarf-making business. She will use the loan to buy materials like cloth and colored thread.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy a welding machine for her iron business. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy more material (rice, cooking oil, and lentils) for her grocery shop. Kanwal baji wants a loan to buy more spices to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi: Chị Mỳ năm nay 36 tuổi, hiện chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ tại Huyện Ninh Giang tỉnh Hải dương. Sau khi được vay vốn 2.000.000 đ của Quỹ tình thương chị đã sử dụng vốn để buôn bán cau. Công việc khá ổn định và cho thu nhập  300.000đ/ tháng. Đến nay không chỉ buôn bán cau vợ chồng chị Mỳ còn nuôi khoảng gần 2000 con chim cút lấy trứng bán. Hàng tháng thu nhập của gia đình chị từ buôn bán cau và bán trứng chim cút đạt 4.000.000 đến 5.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho kinh doanh và chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Ms. M., this year is 36 years of age, she presently resides with her husband and 2 small children in Huyen Ninh Giang, province Hai duong. After borrowing 2.000.000d from the organization in which she used to invest into the fishing trade; she has seen a success earning in about 300.000d/month. Not only does she and her husband are in the fisherman trade; Ms. M. also raises about 2000 pigeon and selling their eggs. Every month the family income from selling fish and pigeon eggs ranges between 4.000.000 to 5.000.000d/month. Her next loan, she is requesting an amount of 20.000.000d to invest into doing business and raising farm animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business and raising

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Greetings from Theogene in Kigali, Rwanda! He is married with three children.

This entrepreneur has owned a small shop (boutique) for three years. He sells different items, like kilograms of sugar, maize flour, cassava flour, beans, rice, and bars of soap. Besides the shop, he also grows beans, sorghum, and cassava for sale. He employs one person to help him in the business.

Theogene is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Frws to buy more stock for his shop. The loan period is eight months.

loans.use: To increase his shop's inventory.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 30 años, es divorciada y vive con sus dos hijos Cristian de 12 y Luz Clara de 10 años. Es una mujer muy hacendosa, siempre ha trabajado, ya que tuvo que dejar sus estudios de secundaria para dedicarse a ello. Olga trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde en la venta de CDs, de películas, dibujos animados, documentales, etc., que los clientes adquieren con gran frecuencia, lo único malo de su trabajo es tener que pelear por los sitios donde se ubica para realizar la venta (es ambulante), ya que la competencia no desea que se les acerquen demasiado, pero obviando este pequeño inconveniente le gusta su trabajo, ya que se distrae y al mismo tiempo obtiene dinero para solventar los gastos de su familia. Olga quiere que sus hijos no pasen incomodidades a causa de su economía, es por eso que ella se sacrifica para darles lo mejor. Con el dinero del préstamo adquirirá más CDs para obtener mayores ganancias y en el futuro contar con una local fijo donde ofrecer su mercadería.
texts.en:
Olga is 30 years old. She is divorced and lives with her two children, 12 year old Cristian and 10 year old Luz Clara. She is a very industrious woman who has always worked since she had to leave her studies in highschool to work. Olga works from 8 in the morning until 6 in the afternoon selling CDs, movies, cartoons, documentaries, etc, which clients buy very frequently. The only bad thing about her work is having to fight for the locations where she goes to make her sales (she is a traveling saleswoman), since the competition does not want to be too close together. But aside from this small inconvenience she likes her work, since it distracts her and at the same time she earns money to cover her family's costs. Olga wants her children to not be uncomfortable because of their finances. It is because of this that she sacrifices to give them the best. With the money from the loan she will purchase more CDs to earn more income and in the future have a fixed location to sell her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of discs that she sells, and save to have a location of her own for her business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa tiene 34 años, es conviviente, tiene cuatro hijos que vive con ellos y están estudiando. Su esposo es mecánico de motos, tiene un taller en su casa, desde hace un año ella se está dedicando a administrar el motocarro que poseen. La moto trabaja con un chofer contratado de 6.00 am. hasta las 8.00pm (en transporte de pasajeros) Elsa se dedica a revisar que cada vez que llegue la moto esté en perfectas condiciones y si le falta alguna pieza ella se responsabiliza. Este negocio le es muy rentables, ya que le genera un ingreso adicional a su economía. Este es su 5to préstamo con MicroFinanzas Prisma, durante todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y puntual en sus cuotas. Con el dinero solicitado va a comprar repuestos para su moto, los que le costarán un aproximado de S/. 1.500.00.
texts.en:
Elsa is 34-years old and has 4 children who live with her and are currently studying. Her husband is a automobile mechanic , who has a workshop in their home. It has been a year now that Elsa has been maintaining the taxi cab that they own. The cab is used by hired driver from 6 AM to 8 PM for the purpose of transporting passengers. Elsa’s job is to inspect the cab each time to insure it’s in perfect condition and if parts are missing that people are held accountable. This business is very profitable as it generates additional income. This is the fifth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and each time Elsa has shown herself to be very responsible and punctual with her payments. With these funds she will buy spare parts for the cab which should cost approximately S/. 1,500.00

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy spare parts for the taxi cab

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
He is a young and dynamic individual who is motivated to improve his life so that the future can be brighter for his household. 

Ibrahim I. is twenty-nine years old. He is married with a child who is still breastfeeding. He operates a clothing shop in Atebubu, a town in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana, where most people farm crops, such as maize, beans, millet, and yams. 

Ibrahim realized that the people in his community travel to the big city of Kumasi to buy clothing, such as jeans and  shirts. He seized that as an opportunity to look for customers. Ibrahim treks to the city of Kumasi to purchase clothes from wholesalers at a moderate price, and retails them directly to customers in Atebubu. 

Ibrahim wants a loan to buy clothing, like jeans, shoes, and men's shirts. He believes this will help him to expand his business. He aspires to send his child to the university, and believes this can be possible through the loan. 

Ibrahim is a member of ‘The Living God’ trust group. They guarantee each another to access the loan and act as social collateral to repay the loan on time. His picture was taken during their group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more clothing

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en:
Chhoeun C., 55, works as a housewife and lives in Siem Reap province. Her husband, Chhen Sothy, pictured here, is the head of the family and works very hard to earn an income. He is a security guard at Angkor Temple and he can make US$ 60 a month. Of course, this couple also gets support from two of their four children who are employed as security guards at Angkor Temple just like their father. The other two are students.

Mrs. Chhoeun C. would like to take out a loan of US$ 1000 to make a new investment. She will purchase souvenir goods for her school-aged children to operate a business whenever they are free from school.

loans.use: To sell souvenirs

loans.name: Asnath

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 49-year-old Asnath S. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with six children, between the ages of 15 and 26. Asnath has been running a bar since 1999. She works at the business for 12-16 hours per day, seven days per week and is assisted by five employees. Asnath currently earns about $600 from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase stock of beer and soda. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Asnath thanks you for your support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of beer and soda.

loans.name: Yolen

texts.en:
Yolen A. is 44 years old and raises ducks. The family is in this business because her husband has the experience to run this kind of business. His friend has shared the secrets of how to handle this kind of business.

She is married to a barangay official and blessed with two children. The children are both in college and still need support from them. Her loan of P10, 000.00 will be used to purchase 60 ducks and 2 pigs that will help to support her children’s studies. The duck eggs will help to augment the family’s daily expenses.

Her dreams are to expand her duck raising business and to have a poultry supply. She also dreams that her children will finish their studies to have a better and a good life in the future.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for her poultry business

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen es contadora y trabaja en una empresa de consultaría.
Es soltera y les ayuda a sus hermanos solventando sus estudios y alimentación ya que sus padres no se encuentran con ello.
Vive en la zona de Villa Pampahasi de la Ciudad de La Paz, en la casa de sus tíos.
El crédito será destinado para capital de educación ( pago de cursos en una universidad para que pueda optar con el programa de licenciatura en contaduría pública)
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva. con este crédito tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar sus condiciones de vida, ya que mejoraran sus condiciones laborales.
texts.en:
Carmen is an accountant and works in a consulting business.

She is single and helps her brothers pay for their studies and food since her parents are no longer with them.

She lives in Villa Pampahasi in the city of La Paz in her uncle’s home.

This loan will be used as capital for education (to pay for university courses so she can apply to a degree program in public accounting).

This is the second time she has requested a loan from Impro, and the second time that she has needed Kiva’s support. With this loan she will have the opportunity to improve her conditions in life by improving her working conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for education

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es: Sofía tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y dos de sus menores hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 27 años se dedica a la agricultura y a la venta de sus productos; durante este tiempo, junto a su esposo, han forjado beneficios económicos para su hijos, que en su mayoría son personas adultas y sólo 2 de ellos viven con ellos en la actualidad, los cuales son un gran apoyo en las duras tareas del campo, sobre todo en el cuidado de los animales y la verificación de las tierras de cultivo. Sus cosechas son vendidas al por mayor y al por menor en su propio puesto de ventas que tiene en un mercado de su localidad. Para más adelante, Sofía desea ser  una importante ganadera de su zona y tener mayor cantidad de animales en su establo para seguir desarrollándose y creciendo. Es la segunda vez que está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, ella está muy satisfecha de seguir adelante con su banco comunal, pues considera que crece como persona aprendiendo el valor de la solidaridad. El dinero que ahora requiere es para la compra de sacos para empaquetar sus productos, también invertirá en el pago de transporte de su cosecha al mercado y en el pago de personal que contratará para cosechar.
texts.en:
Sofia is a 47-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 2 youngest children in her own house. For 27 years, she has been working in agriculture and sales. During this time, she and her husband have brought in profits for their children, who are mostly all adults now—except for the 2 who currently live with them. Her dependent children greatly support them with the arduous duties of the farm, particularly when looking after their livestock and overseeing their crop fields. She sells her produce wholesale and retail in her own stand at the local market. In the future, Sofia would like to become a prominent livestock farmer in her area, as well as have a greater amount of cattle in her stable so that her business can keep developing. This is the second time that she requests a loan from MFP. She is very satisfied to keep moving ahead with her microfinance institute because she believes that she is growing as a person and learning the value of solidarity. The money that she is requesting now will be used to purchase sacks so that she can pack her produce. She will also invest the money in covering transportation costs for getting her products to the market, and in paying the workers that she will hire for the harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Product transportation costs and payment for farm workers

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en casa de su tía. Hace más de 18 años viene trabajando en la venta de materiales de construcción, compra directamente la arena en la orilla del río y luego la vende donde la requieran. Hace varios meses compró un terreno que es el depósito de su mercadería. Para ella, la mejor época de venta comienza en el mes de mayo hasta noviembre, los demás meses por ser época de lluvia dificulta la obtención de arena en los ríos, pese a esto Maritza continuará trabajando en esta actividad porque es rentable. Para el futuro, desea tener su propio camión de carga para transportar ella misma su mercadería, sin tener que pagar por este servicio. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, está contenta por haber sido invitada a formar parte de su grupo, y tiene muchos deseos de continuar participando en su banco comunal en los demás ciclos de crédito. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de mayor cantidad de arena gruesa y fina que son su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Maritza is 35 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children at her aunt’s house. She has been selling construction materials for more than 18 years, buying sand directly from the shores of the river and then selling it at sites where it’s needed. For her, the best season for sales is from May to November. The rest of the months, which are the rainy season, she has a hard time obtaining sand at the rivers. Despite this, Maritza continues this activity because it is profitable. In the future, she would like to have her own truck to transport her product and not have to pay someone else for this service. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is happy to have been invited to join this group. She has a great desire to continue to participate in her cooperative bank in other credit cycles. The funds she is requesting are to purchase a greater quantity of sand, both coarse and fine, as this is the source of her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru: Файзуллаев Бахтиер живет в районе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 23 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Бахтиер имеет магазин у себя дома и занимается продажей продуктов питания. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 5 лет. Клиент хочет получить у нас кредит и пополнить свой ассортимент. На полученный доход, хочеть увеличить свой оборот.
texts.en:
Bahtiyor F. lives in the Khuroson region. He is 23 years old. He is married and has 3 children. Bahtiyor has a store in his home and sells food items. He has been in this business for more than 5 years. The client would like to get credit from us in order to increase his product assortment. He will use the received income to increase his turnover.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase assortment

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia H. is a micro-business Tanzanian woman. She runs a tailoring business at Tandika ward in Dar es Salaam. She owns three sewing machines, employing two people in the business. She makes various clothes for both women and men. She also sews school uniforms for both primary and secondary pupils. She plans to buy more sewing machines. She needs a loan of Tshs 800,000 to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes B. ha logrado mejorar su condición económica por medio de la venta de frutas y verduras en la ciudad de León. Dichas ventas las ha logrado llevar a cabo gracias al apoyo de Ceprodel porque le ha beneficiado grandemente y por ello ha salido adelante.

Hoy en día espera muy confiadamente en que Ceprodel le brindará el crédito y así será beneficiada para la compra de las frutas y verduras para ofertarlas en su localidad.
texts.en:
Mercedes B. has been able to improve her economic condition by selling fruits and vegetables in the city of León. She has been able to carry out these sales thanks to the support of Ceprodel, which has benefitted her greatly and thus moved her ahead.

Today, she confidently hopes that Ceprodel will offer her a loan that will allow her to buy fruit and vegetables to sell in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Tamaraneh Group

texts.en:
These are small-scale business entrepreneurs in the small town of Waterloo, about twenty-two miles from Freetown, the capital of Sierra Leone. Business has been growing at a very slow pace for these entrepreneurs because of low capital. With the opening of an SMT branch office in partner with Shine on Sierra Leone in Waterloo, these women formed a group in order to solicit a loan. With a loan, their businesses will improve, make more profit, and consequently improve on their standards of living.

They named their group, Tamaraneh, a Temne phrase meaning Let us help each other. Ramatu C. (middle) is the leader of the group.

Ramatu is now thirty-four years of age and was born in Lungi. She is married to a businessman and the two of them have two children, one in class five and the other still not of school-going age. Ramatu sells cosmetics and has been in this business for twelve years now. She will invest this loan in her cosmetic business.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn B. hails from the beautiful town of Pililia, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is full of faith that she can overcome poverty in her family. She is a mother to three: two boys and a baby girl. She is 41 years old and happily married to 38-year-old Rolando.

Life is not easy and the income of her husband, as a hired laborer, is not enough for the needs of her family. In 2004, she joined Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, full of hope to have access to capital for the continuation of her business selling fish.

Now on her fifth loan, she requests 10,000 pesos as rolling capital for her fish selling business: specifically to pay for 50 kilos of assorted fish. She will use a small amount of the loan to finance her secondary business – hog raising. She is hopeful that her business will grow and wishes to send her children to college so they can find jobs for greener living.

loans.use: To pay for 50 kilos of assorted fish and to finance hog raising

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
El señor Felipe H. ya ha tenido un crédito con FVP el cual pago puntual mente, nuevo mete está solicitando para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
A su casa le hace falta los enjarres y pintura al exterior de ella, pero en esté momento el no cuanta con el dinero para realizar está mejora, es por eso que solicita un crédito.
