Don Felipe trabaja en el Palacio Municipal de Nuevo Laredo en el departamento de electricidad, dando mantenimiento al  alumbrado de la ciudad.
Este es el ingreso que genera para su familia y con el cual pagara el crédito
texts.en:
Felipe H. has had a loan with FVP, which he paid back punctually. He is asking for a new loan to improve his house. His house needs plaster and paint on the exterior. At this time he does not have the money to make this improvement. That is why he is asking for this loan. Felipe works en the Palacio Municipal in Nuevo Laredo in the electrical department, which performs maintenance on the city’s lighting. This generates income for his family, and it is what he will use to pay for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For plaster and paint for the exterior of his house

loans.name: Silvia Yaroslav

texts.es: Silvia Yaroslav E. M. es cliente de Fundación León 2000 tiene 34 años de edad. Ella tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella. Este negocio lo aprendió por su abuela como es la brindar el servicio de salón de belleza. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad, además que tiene que hacerse cargo de sus hijos y atender el local, ella abre desde muy temprano para que atender a cada uno de sus clientes. El lugar está ubicado en las afueras del mercado donde transitan muchas personas por lo que le da la oportunidad de tener nuevos clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de sillas de salón, tijeras, tratamientos para el cabello, tintes y secadoras. El sueño de Silvia es poseer su propia academia de belleza para trasmitir sus conocimientos.
texts.en:
Silvia Yaroslav E. M. is client of Fundación León 2000. She is a 34-year-old woman with two dependent children. She learned this trade—providing beauty salon services—from her grandmother. She has been in business for 7 years. Besides running the beauty salon, she has to take care of her children. She opens the salon very early in the morning to attend to each and every one of her customers. The business is located on the outskirts of a bustling market, which gives her the opportunity to gain new clients. The loan that she is requesting with will be used as working capital to purchase styling chairs, scissors, hair treatments, hair dyes, and blow-dryers. Silvia’s dream is to open up her own beauty school so that she can pass on her skills.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Badara

texts.en:
Four years ago, Badara started a business exporting goods to his native Senegal. He sends products like electronics and clothing from the U.S. to his daughter, who sells them back home. He loves being able to provide a livelihood for his daughter that will pay her expenses and education back home, rather than just giving her money. 

Badara is a long-time ACCION USA borrower and this is his fourth loan. He started with a $500 loan to build his credit and has taken out incrementally larger loans since then. He is proud of his stellar repayment record and the fact that he has been able to establish a great credit history in this country, which is not an easy feat.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Badara from  United States

loans.use: Inventory for export to Senegal

loans.name: Kikawula Kamwanyi Nantale Florence Group

texts.en: N. Florence is the group loan president. She is 30 years old, married with three children in school and one sibling whom she is taking care of. She has sold fuel, mostly diesel, for almost two years. She is using the loan to purchase fuel in much larger quanities so that she can supply to more customers for more profits. For sure, the stocking of fuel will increase because of the additional capital. She is a hardworking business lady who is determined to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase fuel for resale

loans.name: Peruce Mandela

texts.en:
Peruce O. is 33 years-old and married with two children. She is in the food production business selling food to her customers in the Umoja estate. She has been in the business for a period of six years and earns a profit of approximately 8000 kenyan shillings a month.  
Mp>
Peruce plans to use the loan to open a cafeteria and a bakery. She has never borrowed from another MFI before and was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by the chairman of her group. Peruce aspires to open a hotel (a cafe) and a restaurant in the future.

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To open a cafeteria and a bakery.

loans.name: Heherson

texts.en:
According to his neighbors, Heherson G. is a responsible father of three kids and a loving husband to his wife. Their family lives in the small village of Del Corpuz Cabatuan, Isabela which is one kilometer away from the national highway. 


Heherson has been a tricycle operator for almost a year now.  He usually earns PHP300 a day, which he uses for their daily needs and for the education of his children. Aside from that, his wife is engaged in the beauty service. Wanting to earn more income, Heherson decided to borrow a loan from KIVA lenders of PHP4,000 for repair and maintenance of his motorcycle. He hopes that lenders will grant his requested loan.

loans.use: To repair and maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Rafiatou

texts.fr: M. Rafiatou est née en 1966 à Sakété au Bénin. Rafiatou est mariée à RIKPOSSOU T. Jonas, un mécanicien et revendeur de pièces détachées. Rafiatou a deux enfants en charge, dont un est son propre enfant et est scolarisé. C’est depuis 6 ans que Rafiatou vit avec ses enfants au quartier Cococodji, non loin de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Rafiatou et Jonas supportent ensemble les charges de la famille. Rafiatou n’a jamais été à l’école. Il y a cinq ans de cela que Rafiatou vend des biscuits (en gros et en détail) et également des pommes à son domicile et au parc de Cococodji. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, au Nigéria et au Togo, deux pays voisins du Bénin, que Rafiatou s’approvisionne. Rafiatou est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a bénéficié de trois crédits à ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Rafiatou aimerait accroître davantage son activité et construire une baraque pour la vente de ses marchandises. C’est la raison pour laquelle Rafiatou sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
M. Rafiatou was born in 1966 in Sakété in Benin. She is married to RIKPOSSOU T. Jonas, a mechanic and retailer of spare parts. She has two children to support. One of them is her own and in school. For six years, she has been living with her children in the Cococodji district, not far from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Rafiatou and Jonas support the family jointly. Rafiatou has never been to school. For five years, she has been selling cookies (wholesale and retail) and also apples out of her home and at the Cococodji parking lot. She stocks up from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, from Nigeria, and from Togo (two countries neighboring Benin). She is a previous ALIDé client who has benefited from three ALIDé loans, which have been repaid. She would really like to grow her business more and to build a stall to sell her goods. These are the reasons why she's requesting another loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 15 boxes of cookies and 10 boxes of apples

loans.name: Adya

texts.en: Adya N. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Bayanhongor Province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a traditional Mongolian housing tent called a "ger." Her husband uses the family car to operate a taxi service, her oldest daughter is a university student, and her youngest child attends a local secondary school. Adya operates a small grocery shop near her home. She provides a variety of food products to the residents of her neighborhood. During the winter months, she sells firewood to boost her income. Adya started her business in 2008 and has made much progress in her first year of operation. Her earnings have enabled her to purchase a small truck that she uses to transport goods to her store. Adya is a very hardworking businesswoman and is focused on the future. She hopes to expand her shop next summer and says, "I am working hard to provide for my children's education." She is requesting an 800,000 tugrug (~ $560 USD) loan to purchase firewood to sell this winter. In the picture: Adya and her husband, Ganhuyag. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva's 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: Kiva Lending Team - XacBank-Mongolia. To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click: Mongolian Borrowers on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase firewood

loans.name: Danilyn

texts.en:
Danilyn E. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 24 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Danilyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Danilyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Danilyn joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Danilyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Pablo Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Pablo Ramón Vílchez A., se dedica a la compra venta de ganado para desarrollarlos y después los vende, razón por la cual utiliza este financiamiento para comprar 5 toretes los cual venderá una vez que alcancen el peso necesario para poder venderlos y sacarle ganancia, este cliente comenzó cultivando granos básicos como frijol y maíz, este trabajo lo hacía con ayuda de su hijo mayor quien le ayudaba a trabajar en el campo, este cliente todo el tiempo se ha dedicado a esta actividad de trabajo y actualmente continua haciéndolo sembrando frijol y maíz también siembra hortaliza como el cultivo de la papa.
Con la compra de estos animales él espera incrementar sus ingresos y la ganancia  la  utilizara  para comprar más ganado e  incrementar su inventario de ganadero.
Don Pablo Ramón Vílchez es casado su esposa trabajo como maestra de educación primaria en una escuela ubicada en una comunidad de Condega, tiene 4 hijos dos varones y dos mujercitas los cuales están a su cargo, don Pablo ha tenido 10 créditos  desde el año 2001 lleva 10 años de trabajar con Ceprodel.
El impacto y beneficios que ha tenido con los financiamientos  es bastante importante ya que le permitieron mejorar y diversificar su actividades de trabajo lo que le han dado como resultado tener y mejorar su nivel de vida ya que antes el vivía en el campo y ahora con sus ganancias compro una casa en la ciudad donde él vive con su familia lo que le ha permitido que sus hijos puedan estudiar y tener mayores oportunidades en sus vidas.
texts.en:
Pablo Ramón Vílchez A. raises livestock. He will use this loan to buy 5 bullocks which he will later sell when they reach the required weight to sell at a good profit. He began as a basic grains farmer growing beans and corn. His eldest son helped him with the farm work. He has always worked and continues to plant beans and corn as well as some vegetables, like potato. He hopes the purchase of these animals will increase his income for he will use the profits from their sale to buy still more cattle and thus increase his inventory. Pablo Ramón Vílchez is married and his wife works as an elementary school teacher in a school located in Condega. He has two sons and two daughters who are under his care. He has had 10 loans since 2001 and has collaborated with Ceprodel for 10 years. The beneficial impact of these loans has been considerable in that they allowed him to improve and diversify his work activities which, in turn, has led to improved quality of life in that he used to live in the countryside and now, with his earnings, has been able to buy a house in the city where he lives with his family. This has allowed his children to be able to go to school and have greater opportunities in their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 5 young bullocks to raise.

loans.name: Avelcan

texts.en:
Avelcan M. is from the village of Sicayab. She is 51 years old. Avelcan is married and has five children.  Three of her children are adults and two are school-aged.  To make a living, Avelcan owns & operates a food stall selling ground pork and beef products called "longganisa" in the local community. Avelcan has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Avelcan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Avelcan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Avelcan is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Avelcan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living condition of the family and for her children's education. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Rene Armando

texts.es:
El señor Rene es socio del Banco Comunal “Flor de Kactus II” desde hace 1 año, vive en el distrito y provincia de Huancané, departamento de Puno, tiene 51 años de edad, es conviviente y no tiene hijos. El estudió primaria completa, es mecánico.

Rene nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Actualmente requiere un crédito  de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar: repuestos de carros y motos.

Su sueño para el futuro es agrandar su negocio y asi vivir mejor.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y capacitaciones que da la promotora.
texts.en:
Rene has been a member of the “Flor de Kactus II” communal bank for the past year. He lives in the district and province of Huancané, in the Puno department. He is 51 years old, married with no children. He is a mechanic with an elementary school education. Rene tells us that he was able to use the money from his first loan of 500 PEN, through " Movimiento Manuela Ramos" to increase his working capital. Rene needs a loan for 1,000 PEN ($350) so that he can buy spare car and motorcycle parts. He hopes to be able to grow his business in order to build a better life. What he likes about the communal bank are the get-togethers and opportunities that it promotes.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Spare car and motorcycle parts

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en:
Ghassan is a 31-year-old single man living with his two parents. He has been working as an event organizer for the past 12 years. He organizes all kinds of parties, ceremonies, weddings, and other speciA. events and he's very happy with his occupation. He has always tried to be up-to-date and to get all the new ideas and organizationA. preparation. He is the only provider for his parents and he takes good care of them. 

Today, Ghassan is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200 to purchase additionA. equipment and hosting clothes before the summer season so he will be in demand with his clients and meet their requirements.

loans.use: purchase additional equipment and hosting clothes

loans.name: Perpetuo Socorro Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudad de Carapeguá  en la Compañía Cerrito distante a 8 km de la oficina de Carapeguá unas señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidieron reunirse para recibir una información sobre el mencionado programa. 
Estas Señoras son activas muy trabajadoras y la mayoría se dedica a la artesanía actividad común entre lo lugareños. 
 Ellas buscando un poco mas de apoyo para fomentar a través del crédito sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Necesitan de esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivos trabajos y así poder lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual. 
Así como la señora Viviana O. quien se dedica al bordado de telas y fabrica ropas de hilo, todo en forma manual, sus trabajos son muy son muy delicados y muy admirados por los clientes quienes adquieren y pagan con mucho gusto las artesanías.
texts.en:
In the city of Carapeguá, in the Compañía Cerrito, 8 km from the office of Carapeguá, some low-income women found out about the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras progam. They decided to get together to find out more about the program. These women are very active and hardworking and most of them make handicrafts, a common actrivity among the people of that area. They are looking for a little support in order to increase their families' income and improve their quality of life through credit. They need this credit program to invest in their respective jobs and thus be able to have sustainable growth that will make them grow as a group and individually. Like Viviana O., who embroiders fabric and makes woven clothes, all by hand. Her work is very, very delicate and much admired by the customers who acquire and happily pay for her handicrafts.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and yarn to weave.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 30 years old and is married with two children who are 1 and 3 years old. She is commonly known in the business of wholesaling cosmetics products including body lotion, Colgate (toothpaste), etc. Vestine has been in this business for about three years.

Vestine is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business by adding more products that she can wholesale in her business. Those additional products will include a variety of jewelry, hygienic papers, etc. In addition, Vestine plans to start wholesaling a large quantity of sugar, as it seems to be highly in demand in her village.

Through the access of this loan, Vestine has a hope for the future.

loans.use: To add more products that she can wholesale in her business

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. D. Rodríguez vive en el municipio del Viejo, departamento de Chinandega.

 El Sr. D. va a utilizar el crédito para surtir su negocio en la compra de controladores, discos, CD, etc.

Se dedica al alquiler de nintendo, el  tiene 5 años de tener el negocio es propio y ya lleva 10 créditos con la Institución los cuales todos han sido cancelados.

El es soltero no tiene hijos ni esposa ya que es muy dedicado en su negocio y ahí pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo.
El se siente muy satisfecho con la Institución por todo el apoyo que le han brindado y la ayuda que ha recibido cuando mas lo ha necesitado.
texts.en:
Mr. D. Rodríguez lives in El Viejo, Chinandega department. He will use the funds to stock his business buying game controlers, discs, CDs, etc. He rents Nintendo games; he’s had this business for 5 years and has had 10 previous loans with the institution, all of which have been repaid in a timely fashion. He is single; he has neither wife nor children so he is very dedicated to his business and spends most of his time there. He is very satisfied with the institution for all the help it has given him; he has received help when he has most needed it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Nintendo game accessories

loans.name: Iris

texts.en:
Iris O. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling school bags, pack bags and shoulder bags. She also sells stationery papers, notebooks and pillows in her community. She is 28 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Magting, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. Iris has been in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Iris joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Iris has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to invest in expanding the business. Iris is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca B., from the town of Sto. Niño, is married and the mother of six grown children. To make a living, Rebecca plants and harvests rice to sell, a business she has operated for over 30 years now.

In 2008, Rebecca joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan from CEVI, she is now requesting a new one, her sixth, of 15000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Rebecca plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy A. is from the village of Barangay Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 24 years old and married, with an infant. To make a living, Mary Joy prepares and sells barbecue pork and chicken for sale. Mary Joy has been engaged in her business for more than 6 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Mary Joy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients. Mary Joy is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP to be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Mary Joy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her product offering

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying manure and seeds

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Mrs. Sor E. is a married mother, 45 years old, who is blessed with six children. Three of her children are employed: two daughters work as seamstresses in the garment factory and one is a plantation worker.  Sor E. and her husband are in the business of fishing. The couple also cultivates rice on their own farmland during the growing season. Currently, fishing has been temporarily interrupted because of broken fishing equipment and it has affecting their income. For this reason,  Sor E. requested a loan in order to buy additional fishing equipment.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing equipment.

loans.name: Petronila De Las Mercedes

texts.es:
Petronila de 58 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado), ella tiene un puesto de comidas, vende “bolones” (son bolas de plátano con queso o cuero de chicharrón), y tortillas de plátanos. 

Ella comenzó con su negocio desde que se separo de su esposo, tuvo que comenzar a trabajar vendiendo bolones y tortilla poco a poco con la ayuda de su mama, pudo pagarles la educación a sus hijos. trabaja desde las 07:00 hasta las 12h00pm.   

Ella quiere con el préstamo comprar cemento y bloques para readecuar un cuarto para alquilarlo y así tener mas ingresos, en el futuro quiere seguir construyendo departamentos para alquilar.
texts.en:
Petronila, 58, lives in along Guayaquil’s beltway, a periurbanarea surrounded by a salty estuary. She has a fast-food stall where she sells “bolones” (banana balls stuffed with cheese or fried pork skin) and banana tortillas. She started her business when she separated from her husband. She had to start selling bolones and tortillas. Gradually, with help from her mother, she was able to pay for her children’s education. She works from 7am until 12pm. She wants funding to buy cement and concrete blocks in order to refurbish a room so that she can rent it out for extra income. In the future, she’d like to continue building rooms to rent.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For cement and concrete blocks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to invest in a new roof for his house, to plaster some walls in his house, and for other personal expenses

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
From Huvsgul Province in western Mongolia, Oyunchimeg H. is a 41-year old widow who lives with her three children, all students, in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Although suffering from heart disease, Oyunchimeg has been operating a small food stand in her town since 2000, and her business methods and experience have improved steadily, as have her sales numbers. Known as a reliable borrower from XacBank, she has thus far received and repaid 17 loan. Initially she began this business with working capital of 300,000 MNT, but now it has reached 2,000,000 MNT.

Oyunchimeg is a hardworking and modest woman who would like to keep growing her business. She says, “ I want to be able to afford my children's university tuition fees so that they can help me after graduation.” She is requesting a 2,000,000MNT loan in order to purchase a large amount of food for her stand and to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of food for her stand

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth, de 38 años de edad, convive con su pareja y tiene cinco hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la localidad de Santa Rosa, específicamente en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su propio techo a base de adobe. Cuando ella visualizó las tiendas de abarrotes que tenían sus vecinas, anhela con tener uno igual, con el paso del tiempo lo logró, puesto que sus estudios se trucaron debido a la falta económica, por lo que solo se dedicaba en ayudar a sus padres en la chacra, a cambio le daba una propina para sus gastos personales.  Hoy, con una contenta, siente que ha cumplido uno de sus primeros objetivos, incluso cuenta con clientes que van a su establecimiento. Normalmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos y su pareja, su punto de venta lo realiza en su hermoso barrio de su propia localidad. Ella anhela en el futuro mejorar su tienda de abarrotes, con la finalidad de que le dé un formato distinto a la competencia, de esa manera cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además está conforme con su banco comunal, ya que todos cumplen con sus compromisos de pago. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercaderías de primera necesidad, con el propósito de que esté surtido su tienda de abarrotes y así cumplir con las exigencias de sus clientes mas asiduos.
texts.en:
Ruth is 38 years old, she lives with her significant other and has five school-going children. Together they live in the locality of Santa Rosa, specifically on the edge of the Peruvian forest where they have their own adobe made house. When she visualized the general store of her neighbors, she wishes to own one herself and eventually she managed as she did not finish her studies due to economic problems and therefore she only helped her parents with the farm and in exchange they gave her a tip for her personal expenses. Today she is happy as she feels she has succeeded in the first objectives, she even has customers that go to her establishment. Normally she works on her own but ocasionally her children and partner help her. She sells from her beautiful neighborhood. It is her dream for the future to improve her grocery store so it gets a different presentation as the ones of the competition and that way meets the demands of her customers. This is her fifth loan with MFP and she promises to continue to repay punctullay, she is also happy with her community bank as everybody repays accordingly. With the loan requested she will invest in buying essential merchandise to supply her general store and thus meet the needs of her most regular customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her store.

loans.name: Melva Lucelina

texts.es:
L a señora Melva es socia fundadora  del Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora y le gusta porque siempre le han ayudado mucho,  este Banco se reúne cada 15 días en la  parroquia la Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro.

Tiene 50 años, esta casada hace 28 años de la cual tuvo 6 hijos los que ahora ya son mayores de edad, uno de ellos falleció hace varios años, ella vive junto a su esposo y su hijo menor que aun vive con ella, su esposo es electricista.

Tiene un depósito de gas, atiende su negocio todos los días desde las 6am. hasta la noche ya que siempre está atenta  a recibir a sus clientes a toda hora ya que su negocio lo tiene en su propia casa, su hijo le ayuda en su negocio ya que es un poco pesado, ella va a comprar las bombonas de gas a la distribuidora general en Montecristi. Nos cuenta que le ha ido muy bien ya que no hay muchos negocios en su sector que se dediquen a esto.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar botellas y liquido (gas). Sus metas son seguir trabajando en su negocio y que este crezca.
texts.en:
Melva is a founding member of the Maria Auxiliadora communal bank and likes it very much because they have helped her a lot. The group meets every 15 days at the parrish church La Sequita of Montecristi, a canton recognized for being the birthplace of the old fighter, Eloy Alfaro. She is 50 years old and has been married for 28 of them and has 6 children who are now all grown, one of them passed away several years ago. She lives with her husband who is an electriciain and her youngest son who still lives with them. She has a gas deposit and tends to her business everyday from 6AM until nightfall since she always serves clients at whatever hour and her business is run from home. Her son helps her tend to the business but since he is slightly overweight she goes to purchase the gas tanks from the distributor in Montecristi. She tells us that it has been going good for her due to the fact that not too many businesses in the area offer her services. She will use this loan to purchase tanks and gasoline. Her goals are to continue working on her business and making it grow.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase gas tanks

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice N. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala West region of Uganda. Single with one child, for the past year Alice has been operating a business selling local chickens. To help expand her business, Alice has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase more chickens. Through the loan, Alice hopes to generate greater profits and take better care of herself and her child. In the future, she hopes to own a salon.

Alice is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to work hard and be independent.

loans.use: To buy more local chicken

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy is 40 years old and runs Jemuga Hardware shop. Her business is located in a very busy and heavily populated place so she gets lots of customers.  She has seven years' experience in her business and has learned how to retain them thanks to Faulu Kenya's training in good customer care. Currently, she has two employees. She hopes to open up more outlets for her business in the future. She has requested 50,000 Kes to buy cement and nails.

loans.use: To buy cement and nails

loans.name: Bring Ambercourt To Unite Group 2-Jinja

texts.en: Farming was 40 year old Poul Wangol ’s first business preoccupation. Poul still does farming but for the last 4 years, he has preeminently been growing onions. Before he used to grow a variety of cash crops but, at length, he made a deduction that onions would be his preferred crop to sell. Poul who is a happy go lucky 40 year old father of 7 says he also ekes out side profits from an old clothes sales business. Paul reveals that his monthly profit returns total up to 270,000 shillings. With this loan, Poul says he is going to purchase 6 bags of onions and old clothes to resell. Poul is affiliated to bring amber court to unite group-Jinja.

loans.use: The purchase of more bags of onions and clothes for resale

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence K.  is a resident and farmer in Nkubu town in Eastern Kenya. He produces French beans, cabbages, potatoes and carrots, which he sells at the local market.

He has been practicing mixed farming for the last four years.  He also gets extra income from teaching.  He has two employees on a temporary basis.

He has requested this loan of KES 35,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to  buy a dairy cow. He expects  to buy three  dairy cows in the future.

Lawrence’s main challenges are diseases, crop failure due to unpredictable weather conditions, and poor market for the products.

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Erdenee

texts.en:
Erdenee O. is 41 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His three children all attend a local secondary school, while his wife works as a salesperson in the shop. Erdenee owns and operates his own wooden product business out of his own work place next to his home. He started his business in 2001 making a variety of wooden items in his home, after working and living in the countryside as a herder. Since 2008, he was able to build an extra ger where he operates his business from, next to his home. All of his products are made with great care and attention to detail which has earned him a reputation among his customers as a quality furniture provider. Erdenee is a man with principle who works very hard. 

He is requesting a 2,100,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood, a lathe, and a paint sprayer for his furniture making business.

loans.use: To purchase more wood, a lathe and a paint sprayer

loans.name: Mansueta

texts.en:
Mansueta S. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 59 years old. Mansueta is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Mansueta owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Mansueta hopes to have a successful business so she can continually support her family.

Mansueta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mansueta has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Mansueta is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” CHIKON”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Florencia; ella tiene 46 años D. edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio D. restaurante  ella trabaja todos los dias atendiendo almuerzos y cenas, siendo esta la única actividad que realiza por el momento y D. esta forma saca a su familia adelante.  

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra D. insumos como arroz, azúcar, menestras entre otros mas para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota
texts.en:
Florencia is a member of the "CHIKON” community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Florencia is 46 years old, married and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her restaurant business.  She works in her restaurant every day, making lunches and dinners.  This is the only business activity that she pursues at the moment and it is how she gets her family ahead in life.

Florencia is requesting a loan so that she can buy supplies such as rice, sugar, vegetables, etc. for her business.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as rice, sugar, vegetables, etc. for her business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria A. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 56 years old. Gloria is married. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making "puto" (rice cakes) and other delicacies for sale. Gloria's husband is a farmer and maintains a rice farm. She helps by selling his harvest.

Gloria joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL MOLINITO II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yolanda; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos entre otros, la socia atiende desde las 6:00 a.m hasta 10:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "El Molinito II". The bank is located in the Cusco district, which is in the province and department of Cusco.
The member's name is Yolanda. She is 36 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children. She alternates her household work with a business running a grocery store. She sells staple goods such as rice, sugar, noodles, and others. The member works from 6:00am until 10:00pm. She wants to expand and improve her grocery store so she is requesting a loan to buy supplies for the business.
The member is happy to have the loan and promises to abide by the repayment scheme.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her grocery store.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William S. has had a business selling spare parts for three years. He is 28 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala Central Region of Uganda.  He is married and has three children.  Two of his children are currently in school.

To help expand his business, William has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase car engine oil and spare parts for resale.  With the help of this loan, William hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, William hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase engine oil and spare parts

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
CARLOS ANTONIO M. A., ES DE MANAGUA, EL TRABAJA DIARIO COMO AGENTE DE SEGURIDAD, TIENE DOS HIJOS Y ESTOS SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR.
DON CARLOS ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: DOS VENTANAS PARA SU CASA DE HABITACION YA QUE LAS QUE TENIA ESTABAN EN MAL ESTADO.
A GRADECE A CEPRODEL YA QUE GRACIAS A LOS PRESTAMOS OTORGADOS HA PODIDO MEJORAR SU CASA DE HABITACION POR LO QUE AHORA SU FAMILIA CONTARA CON UNA CASA MAS SEGURA.
texts.en:
Carlos Antonio M. A. is from Managua. He is employed as a security guard. He has two school aged children. 

Carlos has approached the offices of Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) to request a loan to improve his house. He will invest in the purchase of construction materials, including two windows for his house. The windows he has now are in a poor state of repair. 

He is thankful to Ceprodel because it is through these loans that he has been able to make improvements to his house. His family will be able to have a safer home to live.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Yennys

texts.es: En el barrio Centro del municipio de Puerto Colombia, lugar muy cercano  al mar en el Departamento del Atlántico, vive Yennys S., una mujer de  54 años, que ha educado a sus dos hijos en las edades de 25 y 28  y que tiene una miscelánea iniciada hace un año, aprovechando un  local que estaba desocupado en una zona muy concurrida  de este municipio; cuando Yennys comenzó su negocio solo contaba con una vitrina y muy poca mercancía, pero como Yennys ha sido muy disciplinada en la reinversión de sus utilidades, el surtido ha ido creciendo así como sus clientes, que cada día se entusiasman por la buena oferta de productos y servicios y  hoy en día le compran  mucho más. Su sueño es convertirlo en un gran almacén de variedades muy reconocido y bien posicionado, porque su máximo desafío es la aguerrida competencia, a la cual enfrenta con precio y calidad en el servicio. En la actualidad Yennys va a aplicar a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar mercancías en mayor cantidad y obtener buenos precios con su compra en volumen, que trasladará a sus clientes; esta es la razón de acceso a su credikiva, con el cual comprará cosméticos, accesorios, perfumes, así Yennys fortalecerá su capital de trabajo y venderá de contado, esperando una rotación de inventarios de 25 días, como es usual que lo haga.
texts.en:
Yennys S. lives in the Centro neighbourhood of the municipality of Puerto Colombia which is close to the ocean in Atlántico Department. She is 54 years old and has raised two children who are now 25 and 28. She runs a general store which she started a year ago when she noticed an empty stall in a busy area of the municipality. 

When Yennys began the business, she only had a glass cabinet and a few items for sale, but as she is a very self-disciplined person, she put the profits back into the business. In this way the business grew, as did the number of customers. They are enthusiastic about the products and the service she offers and buy more from her as each day goes by.

Yennys’s dream is to have a large warehouse of goods which is well-known and in a good position. Her biggest challenge is the tough competition she faces in terms of prices and service.

Currently she is applying for her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She wishes to use the money to buy items in bulk such as cosmetics, accessories, perfume etc. In this way she will have more capital and will be able to sell on account. She expects to have a 25-day turnover of inventory.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, accessories, perfume

loans.name: Marieme

texts.fr: Madame Marieme F. est une femme mariée de 26 ans. Elle habite  dans la localité de Yoff. Elle gère un fast  Food depuis un an. Auparavant elle était commerciale dans une entreprise de vente de thé. Elle a choisi son activité a cause de son aspect lucratif. Madame F. est sociétaire du guichet de Yoff depuis janvier 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’un réfrigérateur pour le besoin de son commerce. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices lui permettra  d’augmenter son fond de roulement et de mieux élargir son activité progressivement.
texts.en: Mrs. Marieme F. is a married woman, 26 years old. She lives in the township of Yoff. She manages a fast-food joint since a year ago. Before, she was a salesperson in a tea shop. She has chosen this business because of its profitability. Mrs. F. is a member of the Yoff branch since January 2011. She is seeking a loan of 100,000 francs to purchase a refrigerator for her business. The increase of her income will allow her to increase her working capital and to continue building up her business.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky M. is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, Vicky has sold meat goats to slaughterhouse owners. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation in her business.

Vicky decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With her loan of 40,000 KES she wants to purchase five goats to resell. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase five goats to resell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is currently in a business of selling cooking oil. She is 28 years old and single. Alice is requesting a loan, which she will use to stock more cooking oil to sell. She hopes to build a concrete house in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more cooking oil

loans.name: Fatima

texts.ar: فاطمه في عمر 39 سنة متزوجة وام لولدان تعمل فاطمة منذ 5 سنوات في بيع الالبسة والاحذية متجولة تحب عملها واولادها اولى اهتمامها تريد من خلال المجموعة الى دعم عملها وتطوير وتحقيق ما تطمح اليه في فتح محل خاص لها وخاصة بعد اذ انها تعرضة لحادث ما اضطرها الى اجراء عملية جراحية في قدمها التي هي وسيلة الوحيدة التي تعمل من خلالها اذ ان عملها متجول تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة البسة واحذية موسمية ودفع تكاليف اجراء عملية جراحية لقدمها قبل موسم الصيف حتى تتمكن من المعافات لتستطيع تكملة عملها فهي امراة تعتمد على نفسها في التقدم وبناء المستقبل وتربية الاولاد وهي طموحة وحنونة وتتلقى الدعم من عائلتها حتى تستكمل المسيرة في العمل
texts.en: Fatima 39 years old and married with two children. She has been working for the past five years and is an itinerant shoes and clothing saleswoman. Given that an accident has forced her to undergo a costly operation on her foot (a rather vital appendage in her line of work), she was hoping to obtain a loan from Al Majmoua to pay off her hospital bills and also to purchase new inventory for the summer season. Fatima is a very self-reliant and simpatico woman who is driven to give her children a proper upbringing and hopes to one day own her own store.

loans.use: to purchase summer clothes and shoes to sell and to pay off her hospital bills.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, sont toutes des femmes mariées ont en moyenne 40 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Bougoulafara, sous préfecture de Fana; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de charbon de bois, d’articles divers et de beignets.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter du charbon, d’articles divers et de la farine de blé                                                                       
La cliente KADIA compte acheter 30 sacs de charbon de bois avec les charbonniers du village et environnants. Elle effectue sa vente au village de Bougoulafara et au niveau du marché de Marka-Coungo, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité .
texts.en:
The women of the Benkadi group are all married, are of an average age of 40 and have 3 children.They all live in large extended traditional families in the village of Bougoulafara,in the sub prefecture of Fana;Kouliloro region (the second administrative area of the Mali republic )
They met through family and neighborhood ties and through friends. They sell coal, various articles and fritters.
This is the fifth solidarity loan for the women of the Benkadi group and will be used to purchase coal, various articles and wheat flour.
The client called Kadia intends to buy 30 bags of charcoal from the coalmen of her village and local area. She sells her products in the village of Bougoulafara and at the new market in Marka-Coungo, for cash and credit to a clientele of men and women.
She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 15 000F CFA which will be used to pay the dues on the loan, pay her contributions to social ceremonies and the remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: purchase charcoal .

loans.name: Khanh

texts.en:
Khanh was born in 1984. She is married with two children. They are still young.  Her husband is a carpenter. Miss Khanh has a beverage store where she sells fruit, coffee, etc. She has a monthly income of about 5,000,000 VND. 

Khanh has participated in SEDA since 2007. The last cycle, she borrowed 6,322,000 VND and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy more goods for her store.

loans.use: to buy more goods for her store

loans.name: Kaingu

texts.en:
Kaingu is a single man who lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, he has operated a clothing business, selling men's clothing, children's wear and ladies dresses. Kaingu faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. During the rainy season, the demand for light clothing decreases and demand for heavy clothing increases due to weather changes. With the 20,000 KES, he wants to purchase bundles of clothes for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. 

Kaingu dreams of establishing a boutique business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for sale

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 40 years old and lives in the town of Hoima, which is in the Hoima region of Uganda.  He is married and has 5 children, 3 of whom are currently in school.  He has had a hardware business for 4 years.  He also has two other businesses, in farming and spare parts.

Patrick has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda to help expand his business.  He will use the loan to purchase hardware goods for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, he hopes to generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees.  In the future, he hopes to expand his hardware business.

loans.use: to purchase hardware goods for resale.

loans.name: Jana

texts.en: Jana is a 49-year-old married woman living with her husband and two school-aged children. She is from Lebanon. She has 17 years of experience working in the food and beverage domain. In 2004, she decided to open her own mini-market where she started to sell dairy and daily products, juices, bread etc. She works hard in cooperation with her old husband who works in the agriculture field to be able to pay the heavy life expenses. Today, she is requesting to borrow $600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her store’s inventory of food products and drinks. She is very positive and she’s confident that the loan will help her increase her sales and therefore her income.

loans.use: to increase her store’s inventory of food products and drinks

loans.name: Hugo Jose

texts.es:
Hugo tiene 51 años de edad trabaja arduamente como gestor aduanero desde hace varios años es casado con dos hijos de los cuales uno se encuentra en edad escolar.
don Hugo visita nuevamente las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un prestamo para la compra de materiales de construccion para continuar con las mejoras progresiva de su casa de habitacion, el realizara el cambio de techo de su casa de habitacion por lo que comprara zinc, perlinez, pintura.
a gradece a ceprodel por brindarle la oportunidad de seguir mejorando su casa ade habitacion por lo que ahora contara con una mejor casa para el y su familia.
texts.en:
Hugo is 51 years old and has worked hard as a customs officer for many years.  He is married and has two children, one of which is school aged. 

Hugo visited the Ceprodel offices to ask for a loan to purchase construction materials to continue with his gradual repairs to his home.  He is going to put a new roof on the house, so he needs to purchase zinc, roof beams, and paint.  

He is thankful to Ceprodel for providing the opportunity to continue improving his home so that he can have a better house for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha is 62 years old and lives in Southern Poblacion, Plaridel. She is married with two children. To earn a living, Tabitha has a business selling longanisa (processed ground meat). She earns about 9,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Tabitha has a requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase pork and spices needed to make her product to sell. Tabitha has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase 25 kilos of pork and spices needed to make longanisa (processed ground meat).

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 25 años, está casado con Juan de 30 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, desde muy pequeña aprendió a labrar la tierra, pues fueron sus padres que le inculcaron esta actividad. Cuando se caso con Juan, decidieron juntos  comprar una parcela de cacao, de esa manera lograrían obtener ingresos económicos para el bienestar de su familia. Desde entonces se levanta muy temprano para trabajar sobre sus tierras, podando y sacando la maleza de sus plantaciones de cacao.  Antonia está muy contenta con esta labor que realiza, porque le genera buenas rentas, ya que por ser un producto de mayor demanda a nivel nacional e internacional. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en realizar el pago de sus cuotas muy puntualmente. Con los 1.000 soles que solicita, lo invertirá para contratar peones  y limpien su parcela de cacao.
texts.en: Antonia is 25 years old and married to Juan, 30.  They have two children.  They all live together in their own house located in Pichari District.  She is a very hardworking woman who learned how to till the soil while still a little girl because her parents taught her how to do so.  When she married Juan they decided together to buy a plot of cocoa beans to earn income for their family’s wellbeing.  Since then, she rises very early to work in her fields, pruning and weeding her cocoa bean crops.  Antonia is very happy with the work she carries out because it produces good profits because it’s a product in high demand both nationally and internationally.  This is her second MFP loan so she pledges to make her installment payments punctually.  She will use the 1000 soles requested to hire laborers to weed her cocoa bean field.

loans.use: to hire laborers.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 66 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 19 years, she has run a sari-sari (retail) store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from raising pigs. Lucy has borrowed and repaid 18 previous loans from NWTF.

Lucy is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more merchandise to sell. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Avil

texts.en: Avil is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 10 children. Avil has a retail shop that sells coconut wine and charcoal by the sack. She has had this business for 10 years. Avil requested a loan for PHP 3,000 to buy coconut shells and wood for making charcoal. Avil is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Avil hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconut shells and wood to make charcoal.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María Luisa de 43 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Chulucanas que pertenece  al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.
  
Desde hace 5 años María Luisa se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos, golosinas), frutas y bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en su domicilio para su  comodidad, ya que puede atender a cualquier hora, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todas sus necesidades diarias de su hogar.

Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 500 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de productos comestibles para abastecer su negocio, con el único objetivo de que su negocio sea más grande y esté más surtido de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes;  con las ganancias podrá cubrir su préstamo y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  María Luisa es una persona responsable, trabajadora y empeñosa, con el objetivo de que su familia tenga mejoras económicas  y pueda brindarles una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María Luisa, 43, lives with her husband and children in her own house which only has electricity and is located in Chulucanas District belonging to Piura Department.  This zone is known for farming and animal husbandry.

María Luisa has been selling groceries for the last five years (milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, eggs, and snacks), fruit and beverages.  Her store is at home for her comfort because she can tend to it at any time.  With profits obtained from sales she tries to cover all her household’s daily needs.

To stock her store she’s asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new sol loan to buy larger amounts of foodstuffs to stock her store.  Her only objective is that the business is larger and better stocked with merchandise to offer her customers.  With profits she’ll be able to repay the loan and improve her family’s quality of life.  María Luisa is a responsible, enterprising woman whose objective is that her family has improved economy and to provide her children with a better education.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Elizabeth Gathoni

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 33-year-old married woman. She has two children aged six and eight. She describes herself as focused. 

Elizabeth operates a a general store where she sells soft drinks, mineral water, clothes and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years and employs one staff member. Her business is located in a shopping center. Her biggest business challenge is that the area is very cold, which affects the intake of water and juices. 

Elizabeth will use the Kes 50,000 loan to increase her stock of drinks. Her business goal is to grow the business to wholesale within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a big supermarket in the area.

loans.use: to buy mineral water and soft drinks.

loans.name: Le Bienfait Group

texts.fr:
Mme BIBATA est la représentante du groupe LE BIENFAIT .Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 26ans et le moins âgé a 15an. 02 vont à l’école. Elle a 04 personnes en charge.

Elle est gérante d’un restaurant (vend de la soupe de boilleau etc.) et vend des jus et de la glace depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne à l’abattoir de Ouagadougou et au yaar de Gounghin. Elle s’approvisionne par jour. Ses clients sont les femmes et les  hommes.

Elle veut  s’acheter une charrette de bois de chauffe, 30kg de viande pour la soupe et 30 miches de pain qu’elle vend avec la soupe.

Mme  économise pour agrandir son hangar. Elle ambitionne ouvrir d’autres points de vente pour sa restauration et continuer à assurer la scolarité de  ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bibata is the representative of the group LE BIENFAIT. She is married with six children, the oldest of whom is 26 years old and the youngest 15. Two of the children go to school. She has four people under her care.

She manages a restaurant (selling meat-based soup, etc.). She also has been selling juices and ice for 10 years. She buys daily from the slaughterhouse in Ouagadougou and at the Gounghin yaar (market). Her customers are both women and men.

She wants to buy a cartload of firewood, 30 kg of meat for the soup and 30 loaves of bread she sells with the soup.

Mrs. Bibata is saving to expand her premises. She aims to open more outlets for her restaurant business and continue to provide schooling for her children.

loans.use: buy a cartload of firewood, 30 kg of meat for the soup and 30 loaves of bread to be sold with the soup.

loans.name: Akram

texts.ru: Акрам более тридцати лет занимается индивидуальным пошивом и ремонтом обуви. Он женат, имеет троих совершеннолетних детей. Старший сын пошел по стопам отца, и занимается данным ремеслом жена швея. Они вместе стараются создавать хорошие жилищные условия. Он является владельцем небольшого ремонтного цеха по пошиву и ремонту обуви. Под его  руководством работают три работника. Он хочет получить займ для расширения площади своего цеха и приобретения дополнительного оборудования для пошива обуви. Он надеется получить займ и расширить свой бизнес к зимнему сезону.
texts.en: Akram has been involved in individual shoe-making and repairs for over thirty years.  He is married and has three adult children.  His oldest son followed his father's steps and is involved in the same business, and Akram's wife is a seamstress.  Together, they try to provide good living conditions.  Akram is the owner of a small shoe-making and repair shop and has three employees working under his supervision.  He wants to obtain this loan to expand his shop space and buy additional shoe-making equipment.  Akram hopes to get this loan and expand his business for the winter season.

loans.use: to expand his shop space and purchase additional shoe-making equipment

loans.name: Loida

texts.es: Loida, D. 57 años D. edad, es una mujer independiente y trabajadora. Está casada con Ricardo, vive acompañada D. su esposo, sus cuatro hijos D. 37, 32, 30 y 21 años, y una nieta a la que quiere mucho, instalado cómodamente en una casa D. su propiedad. La actividad que realiza Loida, es la venta D. comidas criolla, comida rápida como chifa. Comenzó vendiendo en una mesa en el mercado D. su ciudad, logrando crecer su negocio a base D. mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, además D. juntar un capital que lo invertiría para montar su restaurante, en la cochera D. su casa hace 2 años. Hoy brinda un servicio D. calidad a sus clientes, atendiendo buffets  y pedidos a domicilio, contando con la ayuda D. su esposo que se dedica a la cocina y sus hijos en la atención a los clientes. Lo  que le gusta D. su actividad es el tener a su familia unida; además D. los ingresos que percibe pudo solventar los estudios D. sus hijos, que ahora son su gran orgullo. Por otro lado está contenta con la buena acogida que tiene su restaurante, por eso tiene planes D. ampliar y mejorar los ambientes D. su negocio para una mayor comodidad para sus clientes. Este será el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que le permite avanzar con su negocio, desea seguir contando con ese apoyo, por eso se compromete en cumplir con el pago D. su cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en el acabo del piso, pareD. y los servicios higiénicos D. su restaurante
texts.en: 57 year old Loida is an independent and hardworking woman. She is married to Ricardo and they live with their 4 children who are 37, 32, 30, and 20 years old and a granddaughter whom they love very much. They all live comfortably in the house that they own. Loida works selling typical Peruvian fast food such as chifa (a fusion Chinese-Peruvian cuisine.) She began selling from a stand in the market in her town and, thanks to much work and dedication, and the addition of some capital, she was able to grow her business and opened a restaurant in the garage of her home two years ago. Today, she offers a quality service to her customers, catering buffets and events in people's homes. Her husband helps with the cooking and her children attend to the customers. What she likes about this work is that it keeps the family together, and the income enabled her to pay for her children's education, and they are her great priD.. On the other hand, she is very happy with the big welcome that her restaurant has received, and for this reason she has plans to extend and improve the premises of her business to offer greater comfort to her customers. This will be her 5th loan from the institution MFP and she is grateful for the financial support that has permitted her to proceed with her business. She hopes to continue to have this support and so she promises to make her repayments on time. She will use the requested funds to invest in finishing the floor, walls and restrooms of her restaurant.

loans.use: to invest in finishing the floor, wall, and hygienic services of her restaurant.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
For the last two years, Emmanuel has been in the livestock trade. He earns a monthly profit of KES. 30,000. He is 25 and single.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more goats to rear and sell later at a profit.

He will invest the profits back into the business. He hopes to grow his business, open a butchery, and be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more goats to rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 60-year-old business man who is married to Eunice who is a farmer.  They are blessed with three children. He has been running a retail shop for the past six years with a monthly income of KES 10,500 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Francis will use the loan to buy a stock of maize-meal, sugar and rice for his shop. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

He hopes to open a wholesale shop in future which will help him get more profits and thus improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy a stock of maize meal, sugar and rice for his shop.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia is 51 years old and married, with ten children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Letecia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Letecia has been farming rice for eight years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her four younger children to college.

loans.use: To buy  fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 22 years old and married to Mutisya, and they have two children. She has been running a quarrying business for the last two years earning a monthly income of Kes 2,000.

She is requesting for her first  loan with KADET ltd of Kes 20,000 to buy light quarrying equipment i.e cold chisels, mattocks, and hammers. With the anticipated profits, she will save to buy her own quarry.

Her hopes and dreams are to own her quarry and register a limited company to trade.

loans.use: to buy light quarrying tools.

loans.name: Ykua Verá Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina Ykua Vera, en alusión al barrio donde viven todas las miembros, ellas están en el Décimo Ciclo con 12  integrantes. Es un grupo muy unido, solidario y responsable. Las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las cuotas, realizan actividades de recaudación de fondos para ayudarse en caso de inconvenientes.
Una de las miembros es la señora Rosalina, quien nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de bocaditos y bebidas. Cuenta que le va muy bien en su negocio, pues siempre recibe pedido de bocaditos para acontecimientos y eventos y eso hace correr la voz y así aumenta la cantidad de clientela que tiene. Su meta es tener un negocio donde vender sus bocaditos y bebidas y de esa forma ofrecerles más comodidad a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, condimentos, verduras, panificados y demás insumos para la elaboración de los bocaditos que vende. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad de progreso que estas le dan.
texts.en:
The communal bank is named Ykua Vera, an allusion to the neighborhood where all the members live.  They are in the tenth cycle with 12 members.  It is a very unified, supportive, and responsible group.  The members have a great entrepreneurial spirit because they are current with their payments.  They have fund-raising activities to help each other in case of problems.

One of the members is Rosalina, who tells us that she works selling snacks and beverages.  She says that it is going very well for her in her business because she always gets requests for snacks for occasions and events.  This spreads the word and so her clientele expands.  Her goal is to have a business where she can sell her snacks and beverages, and in this way offer her customers greater comfort.

She is requesting the loan to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, bread, and other supplies to make the snacks she sells.  She is grateful to the foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity for the progress that they are giving her.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, bread, and other supplies.

loans.name: Iupeli

texts.en:
Iupeli is 46 years old, is married and has five children. She has a small business making and selling u'a leaves to make tapa cloth in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy equipment and tools such as a carving knife, a wheelbarrow, paint, a paint brush, scissors and so forth. 

In the future, Iupeli hopes to build her family a fixed house and have her children graduate from college. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy carving knife,wheelbarrow,paint,paint brush,scissors,etc

loans.name: Marlene Isabel

texts.es:
Marlene es una mujer de 33 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su pequeña hija de 4 años, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño, ya que ella es madre y padre para él; lamentablemente Marlene no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Marlene trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de camotes, ella realiza sus ventas en sacos y al por menor, Marlene trabaja desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por el trato amable y respetuoso que brinda a sus clientes.
Marlene se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mas mercadería, ya que se pronto el camote aumentará su precio y desea poder comprar mayor cantidad y así poder generar mejores ventas e ingresos, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su local propio de ventas y poder darle una buena educación a su pequeña.
texts.en:
Marlene is a 33 year old woman. She lives in the city of Cañete, in the district of Imperial with her 4 year-old daughter whom she loves and is her principal motivation in life. She is a very kind, enthusiastic and hardworking woman that dedicates all her efforts to raising her child, since she is the mother and father for her. Unfortunately Marlene was not able to study a professional career. Since she was very young she had to work to help her family.
On her own initiative, with much determination and dedication, Marelene works at her small business of selling sweet potatoes. She sells them in retail bags. Marelene works from the early hours of the morning and can do it for approximately 8 hours. She feels at ease doing her work and believes that it is going well due to the kind and respectful treatment that she provides to her customers.
Marlene is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help provided she will be able to make the purchase of more merchandise. The price of the sweet potato will be increased and she wants to be able to buy in more and be able to generate better sales and revenue. In this way she will continue working and struggling to achieve her great dream of having her own sales shop and being able to give her daughter a good education.

loans.use: to buy sweet potatoes by the sack.

loans.name: Panai

texts.en:
Panai is 33 years old. He is married to Alice, and they are blessed with four children between the ages of seven years old to one year old. Panai has been in the farming business for the last eight years with the monthly income of12,000 KES.

He has borrowed his fifth loan from KADET LTD of 50,000 KES to purchase seeds for planting and fertilizers. Panai will use the anticipated profit to buy more lands for agriculture.

His hope and dream is to educate his children well and have enough land for agriculture.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 41 years old. He is married to Alice who is also a farmer and they are blessed with four children aged between 15 and four years old. 


He has had a farming business for 20 years, currently earning a monthly income of KES. 20,000. He has borrowed KES. 40,000 from Vision fund Kenya as his fourth loan, after paying the previous loan successful.


And he will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs. Therefore he hopes that the anticipated profit will help him to buy food for his family, pay school fees for his child, cater for medical care, expanding his current business and also repay his loan too. His hopes and dreams for the future are to enjoy an improved life with his wife and children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.en:
Emiliano is a blacksmith in need of a loan for metal and tools. He learned the family trade from his father as a youngster, and now he is has his business for over 13 years. He mostly gets jobs making metal gates, doors and windows. These products are in high demand in Guayaquil because of the crime rates. He has three sons who are already adults.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Materials for his operation

loans.name: Reina Margarita

texts.en: Hello, my name is Reina and I am a merchant. I have a small new men’s and women’s clothing business located in the center of my community. I have been doing this work for several years, and with the income generated I can help cover my family’s expenses, especially since the economic situation is more and more difficult each day, and other incomes are necessary in order to offer our children better opportunities. Currently I need to stock my business more, but I do not have the capital to serve my clients.
