loans.use: Purchase of men’s pants, men’s and women’s underwear, men’s shirts, towels, children’s clothing, hats, etc.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en: Nga is 40 years old. Her husband, a day laborer, is 45 years old. They have 2 sons and a daughter who stopped going to school to earn money. Nga is a cook at the local committee office daily. Now she wants to grow vegetables on the land next to her home and use by-products from cooking to raise pigs. Her family income is $12 per person/month. Nga hopes to get a loan of $75 to do her plan. She is going to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To improve the family income by growing vegetables and raising pigs.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
Business Description

Don Adolfo sells fruits on a traveling cart. His wife helps with the business by selling fruit and healing herbs as well. They started this project when they emigrated from their city two years ago. They currently sell fruits and herbs.

Loan Use

He needs this credit in order to purchase tricycles so that they can more easily get to the zone where their clients are. They've also thought about selling other products that were requested by their clients, such as legumes and vegetables.

Personal Information

Don Adolfo is 30 years old and has three children, two of whom are studying. His wife is very hardworking and his main goal is to build a house, since he has already purchased a good piece of land where he is thinking about building it.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Don Adolfo se dedica a la venta de frutas de forma ambulante, en este negocio le ayuda su esposa que tambien vende frutas y ademas yerbas curativas. Empezaron con este proyecto cuando emigraron de su ciudad hace dos años. Actualmente continuan vendiendo sus frutas y yerbas.

Uso del Préstamo

El necesita el credito para comprarse dos triciclos y asi poder trasladarse de mejor manera y llegar a la zona donde estan sus clientes. Ademas han pensado en vender otros productos que han sido solicitados por sus clientes como por ejemplo legumbres y hortalizas.

Información Personal

Don Adolfo tiene 30 años y tres hijos de los cuales dos estudian su esposa es muy trabajadora y su principal meta es de poder contruir su casa pues ya han comprado un terreno donde la piensan contruir.

loans.use: Purchase traveling tricycles

loans.name: Blanca Verónica

texts.es:
Blanca is married and has two children (2 & 7 years old). Her family has been her motivation to start her own business. Her husband is a storekeeper and his salary is very low - insufficient to cover the basic neccesities of the family. When Blanca initially began selling shoes and jewelry, she was mainly helping one of her sisters but then she decided to branch out. Thanks to her character and ease around people, Blanca's business and clientele have grown rapidly.

In order to cover the demands of her customers and offer better service, Blanca needs a loan of $375, which she will use to purchase new merchandise. She promises to repay this loan in only 3 months.

Blanca and her family appreciate your trust and help in making this loan possible.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Blanca es casada y tiene dos hijos, de 2 y 7 años de edad, ellos han sido su motivación para emprender su propio negocio, su esposo es almacenista y el salario que recibe es muy bajo, insuficiente para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, por lo que Blanca inició con la venta de zapatos y joyería, primero le ayudaba a una de sus hermanas pero después decidió independizarse, gracias a su carácter y a su facilidad para relacionarse con los demás, Blanca ha incrementado rápidamente su clientela y ha hecho crecer su negocio.

Para poder cubrir las demandas de sus clientes y ofrecer un mejor servicio Blanca necesita un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en solo 3 meses. Forma parte de los logros de Blanca, ella y su familia agradecen tu confianza y colaboración.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase new merchandise for her business

loans.name: Minelva Brito

texts.en:
Minelva is a 39-year-old married woman living with her husband and four children.  The eldest recently began university studies.  The others go to the public school.  Her husband is a teacher and works for a private college.
Shortly after her marriage fifteen years ago, Minelva opened a business with her husband’s help.  She retails clothes that she buys in bulk in Santo Domingo or La Romana, a province located on the southeastern coast of the Dominican Republic.  Minelva has a very well established clientele.  But like any visionary entrepreneur, Minelva wants to grow her business and become one of most known and profitable businesses in the township.  She needs funds to buy larger amounts of clothing in bulk so that she can sell more.  She also is thinking about saving money in order to have an own local (market stand) where she can operate her sales activity.  Minelva is very positive and thinks that she fulfill her dreams if she keeps working hard and being persistent.

loans.use: To buy clothing in bulk and to save money  to have a local soon.

loans.name: Pnov

texts.en: Mrs. Pnov M., 36, is a mother of four children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham, province, Cambodia. She and her husband work producing and selling palm sugars to the people in their community, earning collectively around $4/day in revenue. Two of her children, therefore, are currently employed at a garment factory making $80/month each and the rest of whom one is student and another one is too young. Mrs. Pnov M. hope to use this loan to purchase a plot of farmland to grow rice crops and wide variety of vegetables in order to raise her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of farmland to grow rice crops and wide variety of vegetables in order to raise her standard of living

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: 23 year old Hawa runs a business of selling bags, shoes and cotton materials in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone. Married with a child, her business is the family’s main source of income. Her husband assists her with the business after working as a casual laborer each day. Her hope is to expand her business and that is why she is requesting a $525 loan.

loans.use: To generate more income by increasing her stock of bags and shoes for sale in her general store

loans.name: Romoke

texts.en: Romoke D. is 37 years old, married, has 2 children and hails from Iba Area in Lagos State.  She has been in the business of selling provisions and foodstuffs since 2000 and needs the loan amount of $450 to buy more supplies for sale.

loans.use: to buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Kimangano

texts.en: Kimangano J. is a 47-year-old resident of Lumo, an area in Dar Es Salaam. He has been running a retail shop for the past ten years, and things have changed for the better ever since he began. He sells all sorts of household items, including food products. He is in need of a loan to help boost his business.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es:
Mauro is a very hard working and multi-faceted man. He has 3 kids and it is for them that he works so hard every day. He was unable to complete secondary school because of his parents’ financial situation. This is why, since he formed his own family, he has been producing livestock, an activity that is helping to improve their quality of life and their family home. Mauro’s greatest desire is to give his family security and their own roof – this is why he is asking you to find it in your heart to give them a loan, so that he can finish the project that he already started. Mauro and his family are waiting for help from you.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Don Mauro es un hombre muy trabajador y multifacético, es padre de 3 niños razón por los que trabaja arduamente y se esfuerza todos los días, no pudo concluir sus estudios secundaros porque sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos.Por esa razón desde que formó su familia decidió dedicarse a la producción de ganado, actividad con la que está logrando mejorar su calidad de vida y con el que pretende terminar de refaccionar su casita. El deseo más grande que tiene es brindarles seguridad y un techo propio con ese fin recurre a tu solidario corazón para solicitarte un préstamo a fin de culminar con satisfacción el proyecto que ya inició.Mauro y su familia se encuentran en espera de la ayuda de tu buen corazón.

loans.use: An injection of captial to finish home improvements/Inyección de capital para concluir el mejoramiento de su hogar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing utensils and electrical appliances for her kitchen

loans.name: Potma

texts.en:
A. Potma is 49 years old. She is the mother of two children. Her husband is a taxi driver, and they are both loving parents. Potma and her husband are working hard to ensure the future for their children.

Potma has her own business for 15 years already. She started as the seller of clothing. Gradually she was becoming more involved in this business and dreaming to open her own trading place. Now she sells men's suits, coats, trousers and shirts in the central local market. Potma’s elder daughter, who is pictured on the photo, helps her with the business. Potma is a friendly and polite woman. She is trying to diversify the range of goods to satisfy the needs of the clients with the various levels of income.

The business is stable, allowing Potma to make a considerable contribution to the family budget. Her children are growing up and their expenses are increasing. Thus she wants to develop her business. With this purpose, Potma requests 1600 Somoni (475 $ US Dollars) for purchasing new modern suits and shirts for selling. The loan will be repaid within 4 months. Potma thanks all supporting her and promises to pay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchasing new goods to increase her stock

loans.name: Him

texts.en: Mrs. Him T. is a farmer and her husband is a horse cart taxi driver. They both live in Prasat Village in Kampong Thom Province. She has a daughter who works as a garment worker in Phnom Penh. Mrs. T. is asking for a loan to purchase a pig to raise. She hopes to use the remainder of the loan to purchase fertilizer for her rice crop. She hopes the loan will allow her to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase a pig and fertilizer

loans.name: Jane Nanyonga's Group

texts.en:
Jane works six days a week in Kalerwe market outside Kampala, where she rents a space to sell second-hand clothes and shoes, a trade she has handled for over 9 years. She travels by taxi to buy the clothes from Owino Market, one of the biggest markets downtown. There is an available market for her merchandise, and she serves all kinds of people.

Her main challenge is the rainy season, which makes movement difficult and wets the ground onto which the shoes and clothes are spread for clients to view and buy. After being with MCDT for 10 years and repaying 12 loans, Jane boasts of improved standards of living and expanded business and income. She would like to put up a commercial building so that she can stop paying rent and instead collect income from tenants.

Jane is the leader of a 5-member group. She is 56 years old and married with 9 children. They are aged between 34 and 10 years. Three of them are in school. She is also looking after 2 children for her deceased siblings. Jane rents a three-roomed house in which she lives with 4 people. There is piped water and electricity. She resides and works in a semi-urban and slum area in the outskirts of Kampala.

loans.use: To invest more in her business

loans.name: Ayesha's Group

texts.en:
Ayesha Baji is a wife of A. M. and lives in an area of named Walton, of city Lahor, Pakistan. She has been living in this area for the last 25 years. She is the mother of four children: two boys and two girls. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Ayesha Baji's husband is a milk seller by profession. Presently her husband has two buffalos at his home. Ayesha Baji is a housewife and also go for cooking in several houses in her community. She successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy a buffalo to expand her husband's milk business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Parveen Baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart. Bushra Baji wants a loan to buy leather to make more shoes to sell. Martha Baji wants a loan to buy tools for her business of repairing bicycles.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for her milk business

loans.name: Olabisi

texts.en: Olabisi is 43 years old and married to Mr. B.; together they have three children. She sells soft drinks in wholesale and retail as well as rechargeable phone cards and phone calls. She has been in this business for the past five years. She needs a loan of 700 USD to purchase more soft drinks and phone cards for sale. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible!

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks and phone cards to sell

loans.name: Santo Domingo Acocro Group

texts.en:
Julia G. H. is a member of the community bank, Santo Domingo Acocro in Acocro, which is best known for its high production of grains. Unfortunately, there is not an easy way to access the fairs in the area, which is problematic because most vendors in Perú rely on the weekly fairs to sell their goods. Most businesses are based on the markets of agriculture and selling small animals.

Julia sells animals and soon she would like to begin selling adult and children’s clothing as well. She lives in Acocro with her husband and their 6 children. She will invest her loan of 600 soles into improving her quality of life and to purchase and to improve her business. She is currently saving to purchase a car which is one of her goals. Ensuring her children continue their education and become professionals is another dream of hers.

The community bank, Santo Domingo D. Acocro, needs a loan for 13,900 nuevos soles in order for 15 of its members to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To improve their businesses.

loans.name: Khom

texts.en: Mrs. Khom S. is 52 years old and lives in Prey Chuor village in Takeo Province. She is a grocer who operates a small stall in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Teang Saroeun, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. Even though both of them work, they do not have enough money to support their household. Mrs. Khom S. hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s standard of living with a loan to buy two cows for breeding. She and her husband have two children who are employed in garment factories.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 49-year-old man who lives in Bourj el Barajneh (in the southern suburbs of Lebanon) with his wife and their three children. For the past nine years, he has owned and operated a kiosk where he sells coffee, tea, candies, chicken, sandwiches, beverages, telephone cards, and makoucheh. (A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza, and the most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese), and lahm bi ajin (minced meat); it can be eaten anytime of the day, but for some reason it tastes better in the morning.)

Ibrahim is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 via A. Majmoua in order to purchase telephone cards, candies, and tobacco. This is the first time that he has asked for a loan. Ibrahim hopes that the loan proceeds will enable him to diversify his product line, which will in turn help him expand his client base (his clients are mostly workers). When he first started his business, he lacked cash, but his business has been doing very well in recent years. In the future, he plans to expand his business into a restaurant business.

loans.use: To attract new customers by diversifying his product line

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Mr. Soeurn H. is a villager in Kdey Tnaut village in Takeo province. He is a motorbike taxi driver. 

His wife, Mrs. Pach Met, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. On this plantation, she faces a problem because she usually pays a lot of money to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow her field. Thus, Mr. Soeurn H. decided to request a loan to buy two oxen to breed and use to plow the field. 

He is 39 years old and the father of five children, one of whom helps the mother on the plantation while the others are enrolled in the local school. His wife is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy two oxen to breed and use to plow the field.

loans.name: Ritha

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Ritha M. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with three children between the ages of 1 and 8. Ritha has been running a poultry business since 2003. 

Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. First, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Second, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Third, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. 

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, seven days per week. Ritha currently earns about US$300 from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase chicks and feed. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Ritha thanks you for your support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and feed.

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima G., forty-five, is a married woman with five children who are in high school. Alima lives with her family at Madina, a suburb of Accra in Ghana. She runs a small provisions store in her neighbourhood. She has been in business for twelve years. 

Alima buys her goods from wholesalers in the city. She says that she also supplies her products to food vendors in her community. Alima wants a bigger working capital. She desires to buy the goods in bulk whenever she travels to the city in order to save herself the expense of frequent trips. Alima is in a group called “Miracle”. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To procure provisions for re-sale

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
La señora Santos Sánchez D. V. tiene 49 años D. edad, vive en vive en el distrito D. Moche, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. la Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió secundaria completa, tiene 3 hijos, pero actualmente solo vive con su nieto quien depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Santos se dedica a la venta D. menú trabaja solamente con pedidos, los cuales son llevados a domicilio; cuando empezó su negocio solo repartirá menú entre la familia pero ahora ya tiene más comensales porque el alimento y un buen servicio; su negocio es preparado en su casa.
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco Comunal “Luis Alberto Sánchez II”, lo invirtió en la venta D. menú, pues con el crédito D. 300 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo seguirá invirtiéndolo en la venta D. menú y en bienes como sillas, cubiertos y vasos.
Santos tiene como sueño hacer un buen capital con la venta D. menú, para poder iniciar con la venta D. ropa y disfrutar D. paseos con su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Santos Sánchez D. V. is 49 and lives in the district of Moche, the province of Trujillo, and the department of La Libertad, Perú. She studied through high school and has 3 children, but currently she only lives with her grandson, who depends economically on her. Santos sells food and works only by taking orders, which she then delivers to homes. When she started her business she only delivered food among family members, but now she has more customers because of her good food and service. She prepares the food in her home. With her first credit of 300 soles, which she received from the communal bank, "Luis Alberto Sánchez II," she invested in selling her food. With this credit of 300 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will continue to invest in selling her food and in goods such as chairs, silverware, and glasses. Santos has the dream of making good capital by selling her food to be able to start selling clothing and enjoying trips with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase goods like chairs, silverware, and glasses

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Alexander tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres y su hermana. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de arroz, maíz y otros tipos de granos, ya que tiene una pequeña piladora (instrumento para el descascaro y pulido del grano) con la trabaja sus productos luego de la cosecha. Alexander cuenta con el apoyo de toda su familia para los trabajos agrícolas, lo que le satisface grandemente, además le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que desde muy pequeño incurrió en esta actividad. Este negocio le es rentable porque sus productos (arroz, maíz, fréjol, entre otras variedades de granos) los lleva listos para la venta al mercado y los comercializa a buen precio que le permite obtener ganancias acordes a su trabajo. Más adelante, Alexander quiere dedicarse también a la crianza de vacunos. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque le brindan confianza y todos sus integrantes son muy responsables. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más granos (semilla) para sembrar, lo que le costará 200 soles; con lo restante pagará el mantenimiento de su máquina de granos.
texts.en:
Alexander is 23, single, and lives with his parents and sister. For 3 years he has been involved in agriculture, the cultivation of rice, corn and other types of grains. He has a small husker (a machine that takes the shells off and refines the grains) that he uses for his grains after the harvest. Alexander has the support of all of his family for his agricultural work, and that makes him extremely satisfied. Also, he really likes his work, which he has been involved in since he was very small. This business is profitable because he takes his products (rice, corn, beans, and other grains) ready for sale to the market, and he receives a good price for his work. Later, Alexander would like to also raise cattle. This is his first loan with MFP. He likes working with his community bank because it gives him confidence, and all of the members are very responsible. He will use the loan to buy more grains (seeds) to plant. That will cost 200 PEN. The rest he will use to pay for the maintenance of his husker.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and maintenance of his husker

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos D. es casado, y tiene 2 dependientes económicos, viven en la colonia Gobernadores de nuestra ciudad, el trabaja para una empresa como operador de maquinaria pesada con una antigüedad de 3 años.
Esta solicitando este crédito para realizar los acabados interiores de su casa, ya que el gobierno les dono estas casitas cuando sucedió la tragedia de la inundación de  Villa de Fuente y perdieron todo su patrimonio.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos D. is married and has two dependents. They live in the Gobernadores (Governors) section of the city of Piedras Negras, Mexico. Carlos works for a business as a heavy machinery operator with three years of experience. He is requesting this credit in order to complete the interior finishing for his house. The government donated these small homes after the tragic flooding of Villa de Fuente, in which Carlos and his family lost all their personal assets.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Interior home finishing (plaster interior walls)

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Ниезова Мухайе проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 26 лет, замужем и имеет одного ребенка.Муж находится  в России на заработках. Деньги не высылает, так что семью обеспечивает сама. Занимается торговлей. Опыт в данном бизнесе уже четыре года. Торгует на рынке "Ориеи.". Для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот , она планирует получить кредит . Так она сможет привезти летний ассортимент товара и таким образом привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en:
Muhayo N. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. She is 26 years old, is married and has one child. Her husband is in Russia earning money. He does not send money, so she provides for the family. She works in sales. She already has four years of experience in this business. She sells at the “Oriei” market. In order to increase her turnover she plans to get credit. This way she will be able to purchase a summer assortment of products and attract new customers this way.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Ylis

texts.es: Ylis tiene 19 años, vive en casa de sus padres con su esposo y su bebé. Junto a su esposo, se dedica a las tareas agrícolas, su familia está recientemente formada y por el momento han recibido el apoyo de sus padres y sus suegros con algunas tierras de cultivo que están utilizando para la siembra de papa. También crían animales, tales como cuyes y gallinas, además Ylis borda fustanes, todos estos esfuerzos los realiza con el único fin de consolidar la economía familiar. Hasta el momento el trabajo que ha realizado con su esposo ha dado buenos frutos, por lo que se proyectan un buen futuro como agricultores. Esta es la primera vez que tiene una experiencia en bancos comunales, fue invitada a formar parte del grupo al que actualmente pertenece porque vieron en ella a una joven madre muy responsable en sus cuentas. Con el dinero solicitado comprará aproximadamente 8 sacos de abono para sus próximas siembras.
texts.en:
Ylis, 19, lives in her parents’ house with her husband and her baby. She and her husband work together as farmers. Her family is recently formed, and at the moment they are receiving help from her parents and parents-in-law. Her parents and in-laws have given them some fields to cultivate. They are using the fields to plant potatoes. They also raise animals like guinea pigs and chickens. Ylis embroiders "fustanes" (clothing typical of her region, like a skirt). All of her efforts are made for the sole purpose of strengthening the family’s finances. Up until now the work she and her husband have done has born good fruit. Therefore, they project a good future as farmers. This is her first experience with a community bank. She was invited to join the group that she currently belongs to because they saw in her a young mother who is very responsible with her accounts. The loan is to buy approximately eight bags of fertilizer for their next crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en: Elenita P. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 34 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. Elenita owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Elenita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Elenita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Juan Diego

texts.es: Don Juan O. tiene 27 años de edad, es casado de oficios Sastre,  “Confección de Playeras” cuenta con un taller de 3 maquinas, habita junto  a su esposa e hijos, él y su esposa se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 6 años de elaborar Playeras en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Pacoc Siguán Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Don Juan O. is 27 years old and lives with his wife and children. He is a tailor by profession and owns a three-machine shop called "Confección de Playeras". He and his wife work in the same office with their two employees. “Playeras” has been in business for 6 years and operates from his home situated in Paraje Pacoc Siguán Cantón Poxlajuj in the Totonicapán district of Guatemala.

Now that customer demand has increased, he does not have sufficient capital to grow his business. He has applied for a loan from Asociación ASDIR with the intention of purchasing raw materials, which will result in increased sales. He also hopes that his family will be successful and experience better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.en:
Joaquina U. believes that being poor is an opportunity to step forward into a higher status of living. She is a 61-year-old and married to Porfirio her business partner. She is mother to seven children and almost all of her children are already of legal age. She lives in Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines.

In 2001, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines with hope to have access to capital for her business Sari-sari Store (General Store). She has been doing the business for  five years already and she found it to be helpful to her and her family. Now on her 4th loan, she proposes a loan to pay for 1 sack of sugar, 1 gallon of cooking oil, soft drinks, liquors and groceries for the store.

She is looking forward to improving her status of living. She dreams of helping her grandchildren in their school fees and also to expand her business.

loans.use: To pay for 1 sack of sugar, 1 galoon cooking oil, soft drinks, liqours and groceries for the store.

loans.name: Alborada Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de el Alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal Villa Exaltación, a este pertenece la asociación "Alborada", formada por doce miembros que trabajan con mucho entusiasmo por mejorar en sus pequeños negocios.
Con la ayuda de sus familias se dedican a diversas actividades, por ejemplo: Elaboración y venta de muebles, elaboración de comida, venta de verduras,  chompas, frutas, otras tienen tiendas de consumo.  La asociación Alborada afirma que desean ampliar sus ventas, para esto necesitan reforzar su capital comprando mayor mercadería, tienen la seguridad que podrán generar mayores ganancias para el bien de sus familias.
texts.en:
The Villa Exaltación center is located in the city of El Alto. The Alborada association, which is comprised of twelve members who work enthusiastically to improve their small businesses, belongs to this center.

With the help of their family, these group members own different types of businesses, such as furniture manufacturing and sales, food sales, fruits and vegetables, sweaters, and general stores. The Alborada association members state that they would like to boost sales, but in order to do so, they need to reinforce their capital by purchasing more merchandise. They are sure that they will be able to generate more profits for the good of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es: La señora Janeth vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposo el señor Alexandro Ríos quien es albañil independiente desde hace 5 años y juntos establecieron un negocio de nombre  “Abarrotes Alejandra “el cual esta funcionando muy bien desde hace 6 años son una familia muy trabajadora y comprometida con sus proyectos a realizar. En este momento su objetivo es invertir en su negocio para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes y así incrementar las ganancias, motivo por el cual están solicitando este crédito

loans.use: Compra de mercancia para su negocio

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a member of the Migombani borrower group in  Ilala, Iringa. She is 28 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 1 child. Her child is 10 years old.

Martha has owned a shop business  for 1 year, she works 14 hours a day and she  earns a monthly profit approximately 300,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Martha`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more shop  commodities for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Martha hopes to save more money and expand hr business.

loans.use: To buy more shop commodities

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is thirty – two years old. She is married and has give birth to three children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Agnes is a trader. She trades in foot wears. She buys all kinds of foot wears from Kumasi. She hawks to sell in her community and also treks to nearby communities to sell. Agnes has been in business for two years. She wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy foot wears

loans.name: Gualberta

texts.en:
Gualberta A. is from the town of Poblacion1 in Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Gualberta is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gualberta sells fish. Gualberta has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Gualberta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gualberta has successfully repaid a previous loan 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Gualberta is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her business. This will be Gualberta's sixth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her business

loans.name: Ching

texts.en:
Ching M. is from the village of Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 65 years old. Ching is married. To make a living, Ching operates a specialized "sari-sari" retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Ching has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ching joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ching has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Ching is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Ching from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her arable area and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Horolmaa

texts.en:
D. Horolmaa is 51 years old and lives with her 20-year-old son in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. They live in a traditional Mongolian housing tent called a ger. Horolmaa operates a clothing business out of a rented stall at the market in her town. She imports a variety of clothes from China and transports them back to her province to sell. Horolmaa started her clothing business in 2006 after previously managing a vegetable trading business for four years. She has found success over the last three years and hopes to expand her stall in the near future to sell more products. Horolmaa is very hardworking and uses her business to provide for her family. She says, "All I want is to support my son and help him find a good job so he will have a happy life." Horolmaa is requesting a 400,000 tugrug loan to purchase children's clothing and stationary items to sell.

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase children's clothing and stationary items

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma C. is from the village of Tiaman, Bonifacio Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Wilma owns and operates a "sari sari store", selling a variety of products such as sugar, canned goods, soap and toothpaste to local community members. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $75 a month from this activity.

In 2008, Wilma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao V., 26, is married and lives with her one-year-old child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Her husband works as a construction builder, earning an income of 5 USD per day.

V. is engaged in a business selling groceries, boiled duck eggs and fried meatballs at her home from which she is able to earn an an income of 50 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. She has been in this business since 2008. She always travels everywhere in the town of the province to sell her food.

V. and her husband try to work hard and help each other ensure a good standard of living for the family and are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, V. is requesting a loan of US $1,000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase cows, a motorbike, and more meatballs to expand her business. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy cows, a motorbike, and more meatballs to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Eufemia Gregoria

texts.es: Eufemia Gregoria tiene 50 años, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general y una pulpería. Ella es una persona muy responsable que lucha por salir adelante y además sus 3 hijos que trabajan de manera independiente le ayudan en lo que pueden. Este negocio lo inicio hace 12 años como un medio de vida para su familia, por lo que siempre busca la forma de generar ingresos a su hogar. Ella está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra una parte de calzados, ropa interior, cosméticos y la otra parte en su pequeña pulpería. Es una mujer muy luchadora y con muchos sueños como es que su negocio sea más grande.
texts.en:
Eufemia Gregoria is 50 years old. She sells general merchandise, and she has a mini-market. She is a very responsible person who fights to get ahead. Her three children who work independently help her when they can. She started this business 12 years ago as a way of providing for her family. She is always looking for a way to generate income for her household. She is requesting this loan to buy footwear, underwear, and cosmetics. She will use part of the money in her small mini-market. She is a very tenacious woman with lots of dreams. One of them is that her business becomes bigger.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle Astou F. est une jeune femme de 22 ans .Elle habite dans la localité de Camberene et est societaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis 2006. Elle a déjà rembourse 2 prêts antérieurs au sein de l’institution. Elle gère  un local ou elle vend des effets de toilette. Mademoiselle F. exerce cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs en vue de renforcer et diversifier  son stock  de produits. Ainsi elle pourra élargira sa clientèle et augmenter ses bénéfices. L’évolution positive de son activité lui permettra de mieux supporter ses besoins sociaux et personnels.
-
texts.en:
Miss Astou F. is a young lady who is 22 years old. She lives in the village of Camberebe and has been a shareholder-member of the U-IMCEC (a Senegalese mutual savings and loans institution association) savings institution since 2006. She has already repaid two previous loans from the institution. She manages a shop where she sells toiletries. Miss F. has been carrying out this activity for more than ten years. She is applying for a loan of 300,000 francs in order to strengthen and diversify her stock of products. This will allow her to enlarge her customer base and increase her profits. The positive development of her business will enable her to provide for her personal and social needs more easily. -

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of funds

loans.name: Los Ceibos Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Los Ceibos” esta representado por el señor Mariano  Casimiro y conformado por 13 socios los cuales 8 son mujeres y 5 varones este banco se caracteriza por ser solidario y unido. El presidente es Mariano Casimiro es separado D. su esposa y tiene 4 hijos los cuales ya son independientes, el se dedica al transporte vive en alquiler en L. zona Norte y su mayor anhelo es terminar  L. construcción D. su vivienda, es por ello que parte D. este financiamiento es para cubrir esta necesidad. El resto del grupo tiene diferentes actividades L. mayoría se dedica al comercio por menor D. forma ambulante vendiendo detergentes, abarrotes, plásticos, bisutería, tarjetas, comida, ropa interior y otras se dedican a L. costura. El grupo tiene experiencia en los negocios que desempeñan ya que por este motivo son conocidos por sus clientes, en cuanto a L.  competencia es granD.  pero L. gente del grupo pone todo D. su parte para salir adelante. El crédito será utilizado para incrementar su capital D. operación y algunos utilizaran el mismo para construcción D. sus viviendas o puestos D. venta, como por ejemplo Mariano Casimiro utilizará el financiamiento para poder continuar con parte D. L. construcción D. su vivienda que tiene pendiente. El historial D. este grupo indica que ya tiene experiencia y que van por su sexto ciclo demostrando puntualidad, responsabilidad y ganas D. trabajar.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Los Ceibos” ("The Ceibo Trees") is represented by Mariano Casimiro and maD. up of 13 members, of whom 8 are women and 5 men. This bank is characterized by solidarity and unity. The president is Mariano Casimiro, who is separated from his wife and has 4 children who are already independent. He works in the field of transportation and lives in a rented dwelling in the northern zone. His greatest desire is to finish building his home. The rest of the group members pursue a range of activities; most sell retail merchandise as traveling vendors, offering detergents, groceries, plastic products, costume jewelry, phone cards, food, or underwear; others are tailors. The group's members have experience in the businesses they pursue, and because of this, they are well-known among their customers. With regard to competition, there is a lot of it, but the people of this group make every effort to be successful. The loan will be used to increase their working capital, and some will use it for the construction of their homes or sales stands. For example, Mariano will use the loan to do some construction work on his home. The group's history indicates that they have already gained experience and that they are entering their sixth loan cycle demonstrating punctuality, responsibility and the desire to work hard.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home construction

loans.name: Benta

texts.en:
Benta A. sells charcoal in Nyalenda Kisumu, Kenya.  It's a business that she has been doing for the past six years.  Before that she sold groundnuts, but that didn't generate enough income. 

Ever since she started selling charcoal, business has been better in terms of customers and income.  Benta wants to expand her business by increasing her stock, so that she can achieve a dream of having her own house.  She wishes to get a loan of Ksh. 20,000.

loans.use: Increase her stock.

loans.name: Kaniz's Group

texts.en:
Kaniz is the wife of M. M. and lives in Borewala, Pakistan. She owns a two-room house and has been living in it for over thirty years.

Kaniz describes herself as hardworking. Her business is making artificial flower sets and she has been doing this for over ten years. She makes flowers to order and earns a good income which allows her to manage her financial expenses.

Kaniz’s husband runs a games shop in the community. His shop is always filled with young kids. He also supports their home. Kaniz is applying for a loan to purchase a billiard table to expand her husband’s games business.

loans.use: To buy a billiard table for her husband's game shop

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan es un hombre muy emprendedor, él  tiene 41 años y comparte su vida con su pareja y sus dos hijos. Todos elL. viven en su casa propia. Hace más D. 5 años se dedica en la venta D. productos necesarios para el consumo humano, es por ello que tiene una panadería y tienda a la vez, instalada en un espacio dentro D. su domicilio. La venta D. sus productos y panes es buena, debido al gran empeño que le pone todas las mañanas, desD. que amanece, preparando L. panes suficientes para abastecer a sus clientes.  Es así que sus clientes acuden a su establecimiento a comprar el pan ya listo, sacado del horno y que además consumen otros productos alimenticios que acompañan al desayuno como: leche, yogurt, salchichas entre otros, generándole buenas ganancias. Juan se siente muy contento con el trabajo que realiza, por tal motivo tiene planeado comprar mejores instrumentos y herramientas para facilitar la preparación del pan. Según manifiesta, todo esfuerzo es valido, con tal D. sacar adelante a su familia. Este  su primer préstamo en MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual en todos L. pagos D. las cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en ingredientes para la preparación D. sus panes además D. mercadería para abastecer su tienda, con lo cual espera obtener buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Juan is an enterprising man who is 41 years old, and shares his life with his partner and their 2 children. They all live together in their own home. For more than 5 years he has been selling products necessary for human consumption. He has a bakery/store installed in a part of his house. The sale of his products and bread is good, due to the great effort he puts into the business. Every morning at dawn he is preparing the bread needed to satisfy the demand of his customers. For this reason his customers come to his establishment to buy the bread, fresh out of the oven, and they also consume other breakfast food products such as: milk, yogurt, and sausages, among others, generating good earnings. Juan feels very content with the work that he does, and for this reason he has plans to buy better utensils and tools to expedite the making of bread. As he says, every effort is valid, as long as it helps the family to get ahead. This is his first loan with MFP, and he pledges to be very punctual with each of his payments. With the loan he requests, he will invest in ingredients needed to make bread and he will also restock his store with merchandise, thus hoping to obtain good earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make bread, and to restock his store

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en:
Tomas S. lives in the town of Sto. Niño. He is 34 years old, married and has three school-aged children. He makes a living by growing rice on his three-hectare farm. He sells his rice in the local market, and also supplements his income by raising pigs. He has been in these lines of work for more than 16 years.

In 2008, Tomas joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. He has successfully repaid five previous loans from CEVI, and is now applying for a new one for 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and feeds for his pigs. He plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and feed for his pigs

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon A. is from the village of Christine Village, District 1, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 51 years old. Corazon is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Corazon owns & operates a business selling personal use products such as perfumes, lotions & talc powder in the local community. Corazon is just starting this business.

In 2007, Corazon joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Corazon from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Chinbaatar

texts.en: Chinbaatar D. is 34 years old and lives with his wife in the Arhangai province, central Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His wife seasonally works for a private company as a decoration plasterer. Chinbaatar operates a transport service in his town. He purchased a large van in 2008 with a working capital 700,000 MNT, and it has now reached 1,500,000 MNT. He has also fully repaired his van. He has found success with his business and has gained much experience as a driver over the years. Chinbaatar is a very honest and hardworking person and is known for his good character by his customers. He hopes to continue to provide a quality and efficient transportation service in the future. He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to expand his business.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is 50 years old. He is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya. He is married and has 4 children between the age of 12 and 20. Three of the children are still attending school.

Wilfred has been farming for 30 years and has employed 2 farm-hands. His main products are maize, beans, bananas, and sorghum which he sells on the local market. He is also a carpenter and a timber merchant (pictured here in his shop). His major challenges in farming have been lack of an organised market for his products and lack of capital to expand his farming activities.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo in the amount of KES.50,000 to expand his dairy unit and plant more nappier grass for his cows. He believes this loan will increase his milk production and earn him extra income that will help him educate his children and provide for their basic needs.

In future, he intends to improve his dairy herd by buying more cows of superior quality for higher production of milk. He recommends that Juhudi should increase the amounts of loans being issued.

loans.use: To expand his dairy unit and plant more nappier grass for his cows

loans.name: José Armando

texts.es: El Señor José T.,  tiene con 45 años de edad, es Casado de oficios , Servicio “Maestro de Educación Primaria Rural”, lleva 8 años de Laborar como Maestro en su residencia que se encuentra en Caserío Xepatan, actualmente por la necesidad que tiene que cubrir sus gastos personales, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de cubrir sus  necesidades como el pago de estudios de sus hijos para darles una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose T. is 45 years old, married, and works in services. He is a teacher who works in rural primary education. For 8 years he has worked as a teacher in his home, which is located in the rural Xepatan settlement. Now he has a need to cover his personal expenses, but the economic conditions have left him short of resources. For this reason he has come to the Asociación ASDIR to request a loan. He intends to use the proceeds to cover his necessary expenses, such as paying for the education of his children so that he can provide a better quality of life for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for the education of his children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies such as flour, yeast, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace E. is from the village of Tipolo Plaridel Occidental. She is 47 years old. Grace is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Grace owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, candies, eggs, energy drinks, and fruits, like lanzones, in the local community. Grace has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Grace joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and engage in business activities. Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and build up working capital. Grace is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Grace from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units of offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Martha Adriana

texts.es:
La Señora. Martha Adriana L. es socia del banco comunal La Inmaculada, vive en la comunidad de Ingapirca que pertenece a la parroquia  Santa Ana, es de  clima frió típico de la región sierra, su población se dedican en su mayor parte a la cría de animales y a la agricultura y mucha de su gente también trabaja realizando varias actividades en la ciudad de Cuenca.

La Señora Martha es muy joven tiene 21 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 3 años de edad, su esposo labora como chofer de un camión, los dos realizan su mayor esfuerzo  ya que se encuentran construyendo  su casa.

Doña Martha se dedica a la limpieza de hogares, trabaja de lunes a viernes, no tiene un horario fijo y lleva realizando esta actividad hace 2 años, en su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos, chanchos y cuyes.
 
Es socia de la banca comunal, los créditos le han beneficiado en su negocio, su nuevo crédito lo va a utilizar en la compra de materiales para la construcción de su casa como: cemento, arena, etc.

Su meta es terminar su casa y ponerse una tienda en ella.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha Adriana L. is a member of the La Inmaculada (Immaculate Conception) communal bank. She lives in Ingapirca which is part of Santa Ana parish. Its climate is cold, typical of the mountains. Most of the population is into farming and animal raising. Many of its residents work a variety of jobs in the city of Cuenca. Martha, 21, is very young. She’s married and has 2 children who are 4 and 3 years of age. Her husband is a truck driver. Both work hard because they are building their house. Martha works cleaning houses. She works Monday to Friday. She doesn’t have a fixed work schedule and has been in this line of work for 2 years. At home she raises chickens, pigs and guinea pigs. She is a member of the communal bank. The loans have benefited her business. The new loan will be used to buy building materials and supplies for her house construction like: cement, sand, etc. Her goal is to finish building her house and installing a store in it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sand, iron rods, cement, etc.

loans.name: Chheoun's Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people make up a village bank loan located in Svay Prey village, Kandal province. Chheoun P. is a 38-year-old married woman. She is the village bank president who was selected by the members of the village loan. With the loans, they will support their different purposes. 

Chheoun P. and her husband, Mr. Phum Sam Art, are duck breeders who are able to earn some profit to support their family. For supporting this business, Chheoun P. decided to ask for a loan to buy duck food for duck breeding. 

This couple has four children: One is a seamstress in a garment factory and another is a duck breeder, while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy duck food for duck breeding

loans.name: Junaphil

texts.en:
Junaphil C. is from the village of Tambagan, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 34 years old. Junaphil is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Junaphil owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling bananas in the local community. Junaphil has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Junaphil joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Junaphil is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Junaphil from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy palm oil in bulk

loans.name: Margo

texts.es:
Doña Margo, es una señora muy trabajadora a sus 74 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa y pollo, vive con su madre en el municipio El Transito departamento de San Miguel, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de 26 años, el negocio lo inicio hace varios años con la ayuda de su madre, no tiene horario para realizarlo y actualmente está en busca de ayuda para invertir en el negocio.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa y pollo para salir a ofrecer a los clientes, esto le ayudara a mantener siempre el negocio y a contar con varias prendas de vestir para la venta, al igual que podrá ofrecer pollo a sus vecinos y clientes.
Para ella el sueño principal es vivir en armonía con su familia, aportar dinero para cubrir los gastos del hogar y seguir progresando con el negocio.
texts.en:
Margo, 74, is a very hard working woman.  She sells clothes and chicken.  She lives with her mother in El Transito, San Miguel department.  She is a single mother of a 26-year-old son.  She started the business with her mother’s help many years ago.  She does not have a fixed work schedule and is currently looking for help to invest in the business.

She is asking for a loan to buy clothes and chicken to go out to sell to customers.  This will help her stay in business and have new items of clothing to sell as well as to be able to offer chicken to her neighbors and customers.

For her, the main dream is to live in harmony with her family, to provide money to covert household expenses, and to continue progressing with the business.

loans.use: To buy clothes and chicken.

loans.name: Pedrino

texts.es:
Don Pedrino, tiene una tienda donde ofrece distintas cosas, él comercializa hamacas, ropa y calzado, vive en El Divisadero, departamento de Morazán, en su vivienda solo lo acompaña su esposa y un nieto.
El negocio de don Pedrino es una tienda que la ubica en su casa de habitación, cultiva maíz y maicillo, además de forma ambulante ofrece a las personas de la zona  hamacas, ropa y calzado, es una persona emprendedora y siempre busca la manera para recibir ingresos para su hogar, hoy día el solicita un préstamo para la compra de arroz, frijoles, jabón y otros productos para la tienda, con esta ayuda el estará incrementando sus productos del inventario y tener a disponibilidad para los clientes.
Su propósito es mantenerse estable con los negocios y seguir viendo cualquier actividad como una oportunidad para aumentar su potencial económico, también desea vivir en tranquilidad con su familia preparados por cualquier imprevisto.
texts.en:
Pedrino has a store where he offers his customers a variety of things.  He sells hammocks, clothing and shoes.  He lives in El Divisadero, in the Morazan department.  In his house he is accompanied by his wife and grandson.

Pedrino's business is a store that is set up in his house, and he also cultivates corn and sorghum.  In addition, he sells hammocks, clothing and shoes door-to-door to people in his neighborhood.  He is an enterprising person who is always on the lookout for ways to generate income for his household.  Today, he requests a loan to buy rice, beans, soap and other products for his store.  With the help of this loan, he will increase his inventory of products and have more products available for his customers.

His goal is to keep his businesses stable, and to continue to look for any opportunity to increase his economic potential.  In addition, he desires to lives in tranquility with his family and be prepared for any unexpected expenses.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans and soap.

loans.name: Keo's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of ten members who are located in Reang Dek village in Kandal province. Mrs. Keo K., 53 years old, is the village bank president selected by its members. All members of this village group will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Keo K. is a farmer who owns 2-hectares of land to cultivate a variety of vegetables for a living. Even with the farming, she still earns very little income to support her family. In order to increase her income to improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. Keo K. would like to start a new business. She decided to ask for a loan to buy Khmer cake supplies; she will use the rest of the loan to cure her child. Mrs. Keo K. is a widow with one child who is a fisherman.

loans.use: To buy Khmer cake supplies

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela R. is from the village of Lurugan, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 42 years old and widowed with four adult children. To make a living, Marcela owns and operates sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Her main source of income comes primarily from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, and junk food in the local community. Marcela has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. 

Marcela joined HSPFI in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell such as beverages and junk food. This will be Marcela’s first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand her shop.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es: La señora Cruz H., es casada tiene 49 años de edad y cuatro hijos aun a su cargo. Sus hijos asisten a la escuela. Su esposo trabaja como agricultor y le ayuda con los gastos de su casa. Doña cruz, cultiva junto con su esposo diferentes terrenos ahora están  cosechando diferentes productos como espinacas y ejote, los productos los vende en una  cooperativa local donde ella vive  y otra parte en el mercado local con sus clientes que ya la conocen. El préstamo lo solicita porque necesita invertir más en la compra de abono y semilla porque necesita seguir cultivando  nuevos productos ya que al terminar la cosecha  ella necesita tener ya sembrado otros cultivos. Su sueño es  terminar de darles estudio a sus hijos pequeños, aunque el trabajo en el campo no es fácil ella se siente contenta de poder tener la oportunidad de sacar adelante a su familia y es una mujer responsable en sus pagos ya que ella dice que es para corresponder a la confianza que se le ha dado a través del crédito.
texts.en: Ms. Cruz H. is 49 years old, married, and has four children who go to school and are still under her care.  Her husband works as a farmer and he helps her with the household expenses.  Cruz farms different lands with her husband and they are now harvesting different crops such as spinach and green beans.  She sells the crops in a local cooperative where she lives, and sells another part to her customers that already know her at the local market.  She is requesting the loan because she needs to invest more in the purchase of manure and seeds to continue growing new products, since she needs to have other crops already planted at the end of the harvest.  Her dream is to finish providing her young children with an education.  Although working in the field is not easy, she is happy to have the opportunity to get her family ahead.  She is a woman who is responsible with her payments because she says that it corresponds to the confidence provided through granting her the loan.

loans.use: To purchase manure and seeds for farming

loans.name: Rael

texts.en: Rael is a married lady with one child.  She owns a stall in Kibera slums where she mainly sells  shoes.  She runs a business with one employee.  She has been running the business for three years.  She joined Faulu Kenya under the Karina group.  In the group, she is able to access loans from Faulu Kenya because the members guarantee each others loans.  She has requested a loan for 20,000 Kes to add stock of second-hand shoes.

loans.use: To add stock of second-hand shoes

loans.name: Sean's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members; they are located in Anlong Ta Sek Leu village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Sean S. was born in 1969, and she is the group leader.  She was selected as the group leader by the other members.  She and her husband, Mr. Em Hel, are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to cultivate corn and different vegetables that they sell to support the family.  The house they are currently living in does not have electricity. Mrs. Sean S. is asking for a loan to pay for accessing electricity. 

This couple is working hard with the farm to support their three children: one is a farmer and the others are students and also support their parent's farming.

loans.use: To pay for accessing electricity.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo P. is from the village of Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 64 years old. Arturo is single and has one adult child. To make a living, Arturo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Arturo has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Arturo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arturo has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Arturo is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the third loan taken out by Arturo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama el limoncito, está ubicado en el municipio de tecoanapa, los integrantes de este grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre, porque así se llama la comunidad de donde la mayoría son originarios, esta historia es acerca de la señora María Lourdes L. R., puesto que es una de las integrante de este grupo, ella tiene 40 años de edad, está casada, tiene 4 hijos, José Luis, miguel Ángel, adelma y Erika de los cuales solo la menor estudia, está cursando el tercer año de secundaria, ya que los demás todos están casados, ella se dedica a la venta de carne, lleva más de 10 años con este negocio.

María eligió esta actividad, puesto que es lo que mejor se vende en su comunidad, también porque dice que es una muy buena fuente de ingresos, que le ayuda para continuar apoyando la economía de su familia, ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de mas marranos y carne para continuar con sus ventas. 

Dice que su negocio le está beneficiando muchísimo, ya que está mejorando su calidad y la de su familia, al igual que ahora podrá apoyar más y mejor a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y con la educación de sus hijos, también empezara a tener una buena solvencia económica.

La meta que dice tener doña María para su negocio, es la de continuar invirtiéndole mucho mas, ya que lo quiere hacer crecer, puesto que está pensando en construir un local, para poner una carnicería, para mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias y así continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios, para que puedan tener una muy buena carrera profesional y un mejor futuro.

Nos comenta que en su grupo se trabaja muy bien, puesto que todos los integrantes se conocen perfectamente y son personas muy responsables con sus pagos y sobre todo bien trabajadores.

Estos son los nombres y las actividades que realizan cada uno de los integrantes del grupo el limoncito.
Luciana R. M.-fruteria
Marcelina R. G.-frutería
Audifa J. R.-venta de refrescos
Elideth V. B.-venta de semillas
Eloísa C. R.-venta de perfumes
Vianey G. M.-venta de antojitos
Honorina G. S.-carniceria
Miriam S. R.-venta de calzado
María de Lourdes L. R.-carnicería
Odilia M. R.-abarrotes
Leonor C. R.-venta de maíz
Sulpicia B. L.-venta de pescados
Clara B. R.- venta de frijol
texts.en:
This group is called 'El Limoncito' (The Little Lemon), and is located in the Tecoanapa municipality. The group members decided to give the group this name because the community where most of them are from is called El Limoncito as well. This description is about Mrs María Lourdes L. R., who is one of the group members. She is 40, married and has 4 children - José Luis, Miguel Ángel, Adelma and Erika. Only the youngest studies (in the third year of secondary school), as the rest are married. María sells meat, and has had her business for more than 10 years. 

María chose this activity as it is the best thing to sell in her community, and also because she says it is a very good source of income which helps her to continue supporting her family. María will invest her loan in the purchase of more pigs and meat to continue her sales. 

She says that her business has benefitted her a lot, as she is improving the quality of life for her and her family, and she can now support her husband more with the household costs and her childrens' education. She is also starting to establish a good economic situation.  

María's goal for her business is that she continues to invest in it, as she wants it to grow. She is thinking about constructing premises to establish a butcher's shop, to improve her earnings and in this way continue supporting her children with their studies, so that they can gave a good professional career and a better future. 

She tells us that the group works very well, as all the members know each other perfectly well and are very reponsible with their repayments, and above all, are hard workers. 

These are the names of the members of El Limonicito and their associated activities:

Luciana R. M arin - fruit shop
Marcelina R. G. - fruit shop
Audifa J. R. - drink sales
Elideth V. B. - seed sales
Eloísa C. R. - perfume sales
Vianey G. M. - snack sales
Honorina G. S. - butchery
Miriam S. R. - shoe sales
María de Lourdes L. R. - butchery
OdiliaM. R. - grocery sales
Leonor C. R. - maize sales
Sulpicia B. L. - fish sales
Clara B. R. - lentil sales
