loans.use: Invest loan in purchasing pigs and meat to continue business

loans.name: Kuña Kyre'y Tavapygua Group

texts.es:
El comité de mujeres de nombre "Kuña Kyre'y Tavapygua" se conformó el 20 de julio del 2007 con mucho esfuerzo y esmero, ya están en el décimo-primer ciclo.
Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también realizan actividades para fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que es la de trabajar para apoyar economicamente a sus familiares.
Una historia muy conmovedora es la de la Sra. Petrona S., quien se dedica al comercio minorista, nos comenta que mediante el crédito y la asesoría recibida en ciclos anteriores pudo mejorar bastante su actividad y administración.
Ella posee un salón en su domicilio donde cuenta con gran variedad de mercaderías con precios muy accesibles, y que mediante esto la economía de su familia mejoró bastante, ya que actualmente poseen su ingreso y el ingreso de su marido, quien trabaja como albañil.
Según la Sra. Petrona las actividades que realizan con la Fundacion Paraguaya son muy importantes, ya que pueden desarrollar sus capacidades de trabajo, además de levantar la autoestima como madres trabajoras.
texts.en:
The Women’s Committee named “Kuña Kyre'y Tavapygua" was established on July 20, 2007, through hard work and dedication. The members are already in their eleventh loan cycle. In addition to working in each of their independent businesses, the members also conduct fundraising activities so that the group can have capital, which helps them reach their goal of working to support their families financially.

One very moving story is that of Sra. Petrona S., who works as a small retailer. She says that the loans and advice she received in previous cycles have helped her with managing her business. Petrona has a room in her home where she has a wide variety of merchandise at affordable prices. Through this business, she has been able to improve her family’s finances. At the moment both she and her husband, who works as a mason, earn an income.

According to Sra. Petrona, the activities conducted by Fundación Paraguaya are very important since they have enabled the members to develop their work skills and raise their self-esteem as working mothers.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products.

loans.name: Genny Esperanza

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Sequita se reúne en La parroquia Sequita que pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, su gente es muy trabajadora, dedicada a sus familias y muy orgullosa de sus raíces.

La señora Genny  es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque para obtener los créditos no les piden tantos requisitos. Tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 8, 6 y 2 años, los dos mayores estudian en  escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo realiza los créditos, él tiene un negocio de venta de frutas y legumbres las cuales las realiza de forma ambulante en su triciclo por la ciudad de Manta. Trabaja tres días a la semana, muchas veces compra a las personas que cultivan por su localidad y también a los mayoristas en Manta.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres.

Su sueño es tener una casa más grande.
texts.en:
The La Sequita communal bank meets in Sequita parish, which is part of Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí province.  Its people are very hardworking, are dedicated to their families, and are very proud of their roots.

Genny is a founding member of the communal bank.  She likes it because they do not ask for so many requirements in order to obtain the loans.  She is 34 years old and married, and from this relationship she has three children, 2, 6, and 8 years old.  The two older children are students at the school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is a housewife, and she takes out the loans in order to help her husband.  He has a business selling fruits and vegetables, which he sells by traveling around the city of Manta on his tricycle.  He works three days a week.  Many times he buys from people who farm in his town.  He also buys from the wholesalers in Manta.

This loan is to buy fruits and vegetables.

Her dream is to have a larger house.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is currently in the business of selling sweet potatoes. She is 45 years old, married, and has 7 children who all go to school. Josephine borrowed a loan to stock more sweet potatoes to sell. She hopes to build a house with the extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more sweet potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad A. Ghanem, a 23-year-old hard working young man, is married and has a baby girl. Mohammad has been working at a carpeting company since 2003 and has gained a lot of experience in the field, but he wasn’t fulfilling his dreams.Mohammad started to teach his wife how to design carpets so they can work together and have another source of income. They have been doing a great job for a while now by creating new designs that caught the customer’s eyes. To be able to improve and continue their work, Mohammad has applied for this loan to open a speciA. and safer home carpeting workshop.

loans.use: To open a special and safer home carpeting workshop.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last 21 years. He is 41 years old and married to Margaret. They have two children.  

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He repaid his previous loan well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, James hopes to become a leading farmer in the Olkalou area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Arnold

texts.es: Arnold de 27 años vive en el barrio Las Nieves de la ciudad de Barranquilla con su esposa; allí tienen un negocio de variedades, donde venden ropa, productos de belleza, ofrecen servicios de internet y juegos; este negocio lo planeó Arnold, porque su salario no le alcanzaba para lograr un completo bienestar familiar, razón por la que inició vendiendo mercancía en su propia casa, luego fue agregando vitrinas y en la medida en que ha ido creciendo, él y su esposa se han  entusiasmado y hoy tienen el servicio de internet,  trabajos computarizados y ofrecen el servicio de juegos play station  también. Con su negocio les ha ido muy bien y tienen planes de crecimiento y de lograr pronta estabilidad, porque el sueño de Arnold  es que su esposa termine sus estudios y sobre todo tener una casa propia, para cuando lleguen sus hijos,  brindarles bienestar y fomentarle un futuro exitoso. En la actualidad acude a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante credikiva, con la cual comprará ropa, calzado, productos cosméticos y todo lo relacionado con la línea masculina, pues se acerca el día del padre y necesitan responder a los pedidos que sus clientes han solicitado, con motivo de esta celebración.
texts.en: Arnold, age 27, lives in the Las Nieves neighborhood of Barranquilla with his wife. There, they run a shop in which they sell a variety of goods like clothing and beauty products, as well as offer internet and video game services. This business was planned by Arnold because his salary was not big enough to completely reach his family's well-being, which is why he started out by selling merchandise from home. He then started adding display cases and as the business continued to grow, he and his wife have become very enthusiastic. They now offer internet and computer services, as well as play station video game rentals. They have prospered with this business, and they plan to expand and gain stability quickly because Arnold dreams of his wife finishing her studies and of buying a house so that when their children come along, they can provide well-being and promote a successful future for them. He is currently seeking his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, via Credikiva, with which he will purchase clothing, footwear, cosmetics, and men's products because Father's Day is approaching and they need to fill their customers' orders for this holiday.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, footwear, cosmetics, and men's products.

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.en: Eliseo, single, is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. He provides motorela or habal-habal transportation services. He has had this business for four years. He is requested a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy tools needed for the maintenance of his motorbike. Eliseo has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Eliseo hopes to see his business grow.

loans.use: to buy tools needed for the maintenance of his motorbike

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis has worked in his quarry in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last ten years.

He is 46 years old and married to Ruth. They have five children who all go to school.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers. This will be Francis' third loan. He paid his previous loans, which he used to boost his quarry business, well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy a new motorbike and he will employ someone to operate it.

In the future, Francis hopes to mine stones on a larger scale and sell them in bigger towns, such as Naivasha. He also wants to try his hand at farming as Ndunyu Njeru is very favorable for farming.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to boost his income.

loans.name: Jafar

texts.en:
Jafar is married with one child. He sells food items. His grocery store is located in a very busy place, which is why there are always many customers who come to buy groceries. He is a hard worker and works long days to make sure his family has everything it needs. Eminaga has been running this business for eight years. His monthly profit is 300 AZN.

Jafar’s business is the only source of income for his family. He realizes this responsibility and is doing his best to meet the needs of his family. 

Today he is requesting a loan of 1,200 AZN  to purchase more food items.  Jafar is hoping that from the increased profit from his business, he can expand his grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase more food items for sale

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her mother).

Sarah has a business of selling soft drinks. She has been in this business for five years and she works six days out of every week. Sarah sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

Sarah has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of soda and mineral water. The main business challenges for Sarah include transportation and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and also to build her own house. 

Sarah lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rents, school fees and  feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more crates of soda and mineral water.

loans.name: Juana Irene

texts.es: La señora  Juana es un cliente antiguo que trabaja con emprender desde el año 2007, actualmente tiene dos créditos  en la institución uno de inversión y otro para capital de trabajo, la señora se  dedica ala venta de verduras por mayor en uno de los mercados más populosos de la ciudad de la Paz y vive en la zona Indaburo. El crédito  invertirá para adelantar a sus proveedores de verduras ya que ellos le venden por mayor,  La cliente se siente  beneficiada al ser otorgado el crédito Kiva. Juana  tiene  gran visión para  los negocios y quiere superarse  y fortalecerse con su  negocio que es la venta de  verduras  por mayor.
texts.en: Mrs. Juana is past customer who has been an entrepreneur since 2007.  Se has had two loans through the institution, one for investment and the other for working capital.  She sells wholesale vegetables in one of the busiest markets in the city of La Paz and she lives in the Indaburo area.  She plans to use this credit to pay her suppliers for the vegetables they sell to her wholesale.  She is grateful for the Kiva loan.  Juana has a great business sense and a desire to get ahead and strengthen her vegetable business.

loans.use: To buy wholesale vegetables.

loans.name: Salley

texts.en: Salley is 40 years old and a single mother of three children, ages 16-20 years, with no other dependents, living in Hoima, Uganda. She is the only one who earns income for the family, and her dream is to educate her children. She has been operating a retail shop for seven years. She started the business with 600,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) but now it has grown to 2,500,000 UGX. She faces the challenge of fluctuating prices and her dream is to run a wholesale business. Salley needs a loan to buy sugar, soap and soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “FRATERNIDAD DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Juan Alberto; el tiene 50 años de edad y es casado y tiene 6 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de carpintería, el hace trabajos como sillas,mesas,camas y puertas, también el socio se dedica a la agricultura, el tiene un terreno donde siembra maíz y papa y luego lo vende al por mayor en el mercado de Urubamba y el negocio de carpintería lo realiza a pedidos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de carpintería y mejorar sus tierras de cultivo. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar madera y también para comprar semillas y fertilizante para su tierra de cultivo. 
                                        
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juan Alberto belongs to the Fraternidad de Urubamba Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.  Juan Alberto, age 50, is married and has six children.  

He alternates his daily activities with his carpentry business. He works on things like chairs, tables, beds, and doors.  He is also a farmer.  He has land where he grows corn and potatoes.  He later sells them wholesale at the Urubamba market.  He conducts his carpentry business by orders.

He wants to expand his carpentry business and improve his fields.  He is requesting the loan to buy wood and to also buy seeds and fertilizers for his fields.

He is happy about the loan, and he pledges to make all of his payments

loans.use: to buy wood and to also buy seeds and fertilizers for his fields.

loans.name: Mamlekat

texts.ru:
Компания «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» выражает искреннюю признательность всем социальным инвесторам Кива, кто поддержал Мамлекат в ее бизнесе посредством финансирования ее кредитов по линии Кива. 
Мамлекат родилась в городе Карабалта (Жайылский район, Кыргызская Республика). Вдова с 1987 года. Проживает с младшим сыном.
Мамлекат родилась в семье ветеринара и доярки. С раннего возраста помогала родителям по хозяйству и была самостоятельным ребенком. Вышла замуж в 1977 году в возрасте 20 лет. Жили с мужем в селе Степное (45 км к северу от города Карабалта) с его родителями. Через год у них рождается сын, Анвар. Муж тогда работал в колхозе «Серп и Молот» в городе Карабалта, туда и устроил Мамлекат дояркой. Со временем, они отделились от родителей и переехали в город Карабалта, купив небольшой домик недалеко от колхоза, в котором оба работали. В 1987 году у них рождается второй сын Ильдар. В этом же году, в связи с неизлечимой болезнью, у Мамлекат скоропостижно скончался муж. Она стойко пережила этот период, продолжая работать в колхозе дояркой, а так же содержала дома дойную корову, которую ей выделил колхоз в помощь. Сыновья росли, росли и потребности. Заработной платы на содержание семьи не хватало, и поэтому было решено завести свое хозяйство. В 1999 году Мамлекат продает свой дом в городе Карабалта и весь имеющийся на тот момент скот, а именно две дойных коровы и двух бычков, и покупает заброшенную кошару в 5 км от села Степное. Немного помогли родители Мамлекат с обустройством кошары, а так же с приобретением первых голов телят. Таким образом, в течении 10 лет, Мамлекат  занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота в собственной кошаре. На данный момент у Мамлекат в хозяйстве имеется 13 дойных коров, 25 бычков, 10 телят и 2 лошади, а так же несколько коз. Два года назад женила старшего сына, который в данное время проживает с семьей в доме ее родителей и ухаживает за стариками. 
Для дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Мамлекат обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS). На этот кредит она планирует закупить молодых бычков для откорма.  
Со временем, Мамлекат мечтает увеличить поголовье крупнорогатого скота, и помочь сыну купить дом в городе Карабалта.
texts.en: Company "Bai-Tushum and Partners" expresses a sincere appreciation to all social investors from Kiva, who supported Mamlekat in her business by financing her Kiva credit lines.  Mamlekat was born in the city of Karabalta (Jaiyl district, Kyrgyz Republic).  She has been a widow since 1987 and lives with her youngest son.  Mamlekat was born into a family of a veterinarian and a milkmaid.  Since young age, she had helped her parents with the household and was an independent child.  She got married in 1977 at the age of 20.  Her husband and she lived with his parents in the Stepnoe village (45 km north of Karabalta).  Their son Anvar was born one year later.  Mamlekat's husband worked at the "Hammer and Sickle" collective farm and helped Mamlekat get a job of a milkmaid there.  With time, they moved away from the parents and relocated to the city of Karabalta, where they bought a small house nearby a collective farm, where they both worked.  Their second son Ildar was born in 1987.  Also this same year, Mamlekat's husband passed away due an incurable sickness.  She steadfastly lived through this period, continued working as a milkmaid at the collective farm and also kept a dairy cow, given to her by the collective farm, at home.  Her sons grew and so did their needs.  Her salary was no longer enough to support the family, and this why she decided to start her own business.  in 1991, Mamlekat sold her house, all of the remaining livestock (two dairy cows and two bulls) in Karabalta and bought an abandoned shed 5 km away from the Stepnoe village.  Mamlekat's parents helped a little with fixing up the shed and also with buying first few calves.  This is how Mamlekat has been involved in breeding cattle in her own shed over the period of ten years.  Currently, Mamlekat has 13 dairy cows, 25 bulls, 10 calves and 2 horses, and also several goats.  She married off her son two years ago, and he now lives with his family in her parents' house and takes care of them.  In order to further increase her livestock quantity, Mamlekat requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company.  She plans to buy young bulls for fattening up.  With time, Mamlekat dreams of increasing her cattle headcount and helping her son to buy a house in Karabalta.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is in her fifties. She has been widowed for almost six years and she is blessed with eight children. Six of them were married early and the other two are still single and working. She is thankful because she has been able to raise her children since her husband had left them.

Teresita runs her home-based store for almost nine years and she is able to earn about PHP3,000 a month. According to her, the income she generates from her business is great. This is true, most especially, in the months of crop seasons during April-May for the first crop and September-November for the second crop. 

Aside from groceries, Teresita is also vending some vegetables and meats because their location is far from the market. For these reason, she wants to offer products for all of the needs of her neighborhood. But, due to shortage of funds she has, she is asking for additional capital funds of PHP20,000 to buy stock of groceries, vegetables and meat. Through this amount, she can further support her family's needs.

Teresita is looking forward to making her business grow, which will enable her to become a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to buy stock groceries such as soft drinks, canned goods, ingredients, shampoo, junkfood, biscuits, meat and vegetable needed in her retailing business.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Sandra Elizabeth es una mujer muy emprendedora que les gusta el negocio por tal motivo pensó en poner venta de ropa usada  en una de las colonias de la ciudad, el cual se podría desarrollar como una buena negociante. Con el negocio ya tiene 16 años ofreciendo a su clientela una buena atención, un mejor servicio y variedad de estilos de ropa. Desde que comenzó su negocio vio que daba resultados por lo que siguió adelante ya que seria la forma de tener un ingreso extra aparte del que percibía por su esposo que trabaja como albañil por cuenta propia.
Sandra Elizabeth desea comprar ropa de temporada de tiempo de frio, por que en este momento ya sus clientes le están solicitando y ve que es una buena oportunidad de tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sandra Elizabeth is a very enterprising woman who likes business.  Because of that she decided to establish a used clothes sales business in one of the city’s neighborhoods where she can develop as a good merchant.  She’s been in business for 16 years offering good customer service and a variety of styles of clothing.  Since she began her business she noticed that it produced good results so she continued going forward with it since it would be a way to earn extra money aside from what her husband earned working as a bricklayer.

Sandra Elizabeth wants to buy cold weather seasonal clothes because her customers are starting to request it already and it’s a good opportunity to earn higher profits.

loans.use: to buy cold weather seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Adijah

texts.en:
Adijah is a mother of four children and three of which are already in school.  She has been in farming for seven years producing vegetables, beans, maize, and eggs which are sold to the local market.

Adijah has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to construct a bigger and better poultry unit for her growing number of birds.  She says poultry diseases are a great challenge and good housing will ensure the birds health and improve the business income, thereby making life better.  This is her sixth subsequent loan with Juhudi and she reiterates that the loans have changed her life and that of her entire family.

Adijah notes diseases and drought as the major challenge in farming.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds.
